original: @38a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @38a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: tantra r'a je shr'i gu hya sa m'a dza t'i k'a / bod skad du /
analyzed: tantra r'a je shr'i gu hya sa m'a dza t'i k'a / bod skad du /
translated: Tantra-Rajesvari-Guhyasamaja-Tika🔽In Tibetan:

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rnam par bshad pa //
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rnam par bshad pa //
translated: The glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra, the king of tantras, explained

original: snying po byang chub kyi sems rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: snying po byang chub kyi sems rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the vajra mind of enlightenment, the essence.

original: thams cad ma lus rgyal ba'i gtso //
analyzed: thams cad ma lus rgyal ba'i gtso //
translated: The principal of all victors without exception,

original: sku gsung thugs dang rab ldan zhing//
analyzed: sku gsung thugs dang rab ldan zhing//
translated: Endowed with body, speech, and mind,

original: @38b lha mo'i tshogs bcas bde chen la //
analyzed: @38b lha mo'i tshogs bcas bde chen la //
translated: Together with the assembly of goddesses, in great bliss,

original: dad pas rtag tu phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: dad pas rtag tu phyag 'tshal te //
translated: With faith, I constantly pay homage.🔽Those who are pure in the path of reasoning

original: gang zhig rigs lam dag pa dang // gsang 'dus dag la dad pa rnams //
analyzed: gang zhig rigs lam dag pa dang // gsang 'dus dag la dad pa rnams //
translated: And have faith in the Guhyasamaja,

original: da ltar dad pa'i lam du ni //
analyzed: da ltar dad pa'i lam du ni //
translated: On the path of faith at present,

original: bde bar gshegs pas rtsa ba gsungs //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pas rtsa ba gsungs //
translated: The Sugata taught the root.

original: de la brten te mgon po yi //
analyzed: de la brten te mgon po yi //
translated: Relying on that, the secret

original: sku gsung thugs kyi gsang ba rnams //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi gsang ba rnams //
translated: Of the body, speech, and mind of the protector,

original: rnal 'byor rnams kyis rtogs bya'i phyir //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rnams kyis rtogs bya'i phyir //
translated: In order for yogis to realize,

original: ma nor tsam du bshad par bya //
analyzed: ma nor tsam du bshad par bya //
translated: I will explain it merely without error.

original: de la 'di mgo mjug tu phun sum tshogs pa lngas bstan te /
analyzed: de la 'di mgo mjug tu phun sum tshogs pa lngas bstan te /
translated: There, it is taught by the five perfections at the beginning and end.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: ston pa dang / sdud pa dang / gnas dang / 'khor dang / rgyud phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa dang / sdud pa dang / gnas dang / 'khor dang / rgyud phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The teacher, the compiler, the place, the retinue, and the perfect tantra.

original: de la ston pa ni //
analyzed: de la ston pa ni //
translated: Among those, the teacher is

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la mngon no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la mngon no //
translated: the Bhagavān.

original: bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na zhes bya bas ni sdud pa bstan to //🔽gnas ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes pa nas /
analyzed: bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na zhes bya bas ni sdud pa bstan to // gnas ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes pa nas /
translated: “I heard at one time” shows the compiler.

original: padma la bzhugs so zhes pa'i bar ro //🔽brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med ba nas /
analyzed: padma la bzhugs so zhes pa'i bar ro // brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med ba nas /
translated: The place is from “all tathāgatas” up to “seated on a lotus.”

original: gang bar snang ngo ba'i bar gyis 'khor bstan to //
analyzed: gang bar snang ngo ba'i bar gyis 'khor bstan to //
translated: The retinue is shown from “inconceivable” up to “filled the sky.”

original: de yang dang la 'di skad ces bya bas ni rgyud phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: de yang dang la 'di skad ces bya bas ni rgyud phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: “Thus” shows the perfect tantra.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di skad ces smos pas 'og nas 'byung ba'i rgyud kyi don mgo mjug rdzogs par 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di skad ces smos pas 'og nas 'byung ba'i rgyud kyi don mgo mjug rdzogs par 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this statement leads to the complete beginning and end of the meaning of the tantra that will be explained below.

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang gzhan nas brgyud pa lta bu ma yin pa'i don te /
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang gzhan nas brgyud pa lta bu ma yin pa'i don te /
translated: “I” means that the meaning is not like that of a lineage from one person to another.

original: rdo rje chos mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nyid kyis gzhan dang gzhan nas brgyud pa las thos so zhes mi sbyar ba'i phyir ro //🔽des na 'di skad ces bya ba nas //
analyzed: rdo rje chos mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nyid kyis gzhan dang gzhan nas brgyud pa las thos so zhes mi sbyar ba'i phyir ro // des na 'di skad ces bya ba nas //
translated: because it is not connected with the statement “I heard it from another and another.”🔽Therefore, the phrase “thus have I heard” indicates that he heard it directly,

original: mngon par bstod do ba'i bar dag gis mngon sum du thos so zhes ston to ;
analyzed: mngon par bstod do ba'i bar dag gis mngon sum du thos so zhes ston to ;
translated: from “at one time” up to “he rejoiced in it.”

original: / de yang bdag kho nar 'dzin pa ni ma yin te ci'i phyir zhe na //
analyzed: / de yang bdag kho nar 'dzin pa ni ma yin te ci'i phyir zhe na //
translated: Moreover, it is not that he heard it from himself, because that would contradict the statement that the Bhagavat attained supreme enlightenment.

original: brjod kyis mi lang ba la sogs pa'o gnas 'byung ba'i tshig dang mi mthun par thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod kyis mi lang ba la sogs pa'o gnas 'byung ba'i tshig dang mi mthun par thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It would also contradict the statement that the assembly was beyond measure, and so forth.

original: thos pa ni sgrar snang ba'i gsung gi rnam pas so //
analyzed: thos pa ni sgrar snang ba'i gsung gi rnam pas so //
translated: He heard it through the sound of the voice that appeared to him.

original: de la gzhan dag gis brgal ba /
analyzed: de la gzhan dag gis brgal ba /
translated: Here, others object:

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te gnyis med pa nyid pas //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te gnyis med pa nyid pas //
translated: Since he attained supreme enlightenment, he is nondual.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa zhes bya bas chog mod /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa zhes bya bas chog mod /
translated: Therefore, it is sufficient to say “the Bhagavat taught this.”

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba dgos ched med de /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba dgos ched med de /
translated: The phrase “thus have I heard” is unnecessary.

original: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu de brjod par rigs pa'i phyir ro //🔽de ltar mngon @39a * //🔽sum na bzhugs pa'i dus na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu de brjod par rigs pa'i phyir ro // de ltar mngon @39a * // sum na bzhugs pa'i dus na /
translated: because it is appropriate to say that after the Lord’s parinirvana.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes brjod pa 'di dag rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes brjod pa 'di dag rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is not reasonable to say “thus have I heard”🔽when he was present in person,

original: lan du rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: lan du rigs pa yin te /
translated: we reply that it is reasonable,

original: rgyud thams cad kyang 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes grags la /
analyzed: rgyud thams cad kyang 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes grags la /
translated: because all the scriptures are renowned as “thus have I heard.”

original: ston pa mya ngan las 'das so zhes ni rgyud gzhan gang las kyang ma gsungs so //
analyzed: ston pa mya ngan las 'das so zhes ni rgyud gzhan gang las kyang ma gsungs so //
translated: And it is not said in any other scripture that the teacher has passed into parinirvāṇa.

original: yang de la dgos ched ci yod ce na /🔽rgyud 'di las phyir gyur pa gzhan dag ci ste /
analyzed: yang de la dgos ched ci yod ce na / rgyud 'di las phyir gyur pa gzhan dag ci ste /
translated: What is the purpose of this?🔽If there were no questioner other than those in this scripture,🔽how could these scriptures have arisen?

original: 'dri ba po cig med na rgyud 'di dag ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur zhes rnam par rtog ste /
analyzed: 'dri ba po cig med na rgyud 'di dag ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur zhes rnam par rtog ste /
translated: In order to eliminate such doubts,

original: de dag bsal ba'i phyir zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag bsal ba'i phyir zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: we reply that the scriptures arose in this way.

original: de'i phyir 'dul ba'i thabs kyis gcig dang du ma'i ngo bor ston te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dul ba'i thabs kyis gcig dang du ma'i ngo bor ston te /
translated: Therefore, by the method of instruction, the Buddha is shown to have a single nature and a manifold nature.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said,

original: rnam dag sku ston ma yin te //
analyzed: rnam dag sku ston ma yin te //
translated: The pure body is not shown.

original: log 'gro rtog pa thams cad la //
analyzed: log 'gro rtog pa thams cad la //
translated: And all wrong thoughts and actions.🔽

original: so sor 'dul ba'i skur yang ston //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: so sor 'dul ba'i skur yang ston // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: He manifests bodies that tame each of the errant conceptions.

original: de dag gis phyogs rnams su 'dul ba rnam pa bzhis 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa ni 'di skad du //
analyzed: de dag gis phyogs rnams su 'dul ba rnam pa bzhis 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa ni 'di skad du //
translated: Thus he works for the welfare of the world in the ten directions by means of four kinds of taming.

original: bltams pa dang / rab tu byung ba dang / dka' thub mdzad pa dang / sangs rgyas pa dang / bdud btul ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / cho 'phrul bstan pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs par gsungs pa dang /
analyzed: bltams pa dang / rab tu byung ba dang / dka' thub mdzad pa dang / sangs rgyas pa dang / bdud btul ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / cho 'phrul bstan pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs par gsungs pa dang /
translated: He is said to be born, to go forth, to perform austerities, to awaken, to subdue Mara, to turn the wheel of the Dharma, to display miracles, to pass into final nirvāṇa, and so on.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi spyan la sogs pa drug dang / kun du sku bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa bzhi dang / de dag la sogs par snang ngo //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi spyan la sogs pa drug dang / kun du sku bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa bzhi dang / de dag la sogs par snang ngo //
translated: He is said to have six kinds of miraculous eyes, and four kinds of inconceivable bodies, and so on.

original: de yang chu snod kyi gzugs brnyan bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang chu snod kyi gzugs brnyan bzhin no //
translated: And these are like reflections in a vessel of water.

original: de yang gdul bya'i dbang gis lha dang mi'i theg pa la sogs pa lnga gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang gdul bya'i dbang gis lha dang mi'i theg pa la sogs pa lnga gsungs so //
translated: And he is said to have five vehicles, such as the vehicle of the gods and the vehicle of humans, in accordance with those to be tamed.

original: gsung ngo // gsung bar 'gyur ro zhes grags pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gsung ngo // gsung bar 'gyur ro zhes grags pa bzhin no //
translated: He has spoken, he will speak, as is well known.

original: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe na zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe na zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: At one time: this is to be connected with “at that time.”

original: 'di ni 'di'i dus gcig na gzhan ni gzhan gyi dus gcig na bya ba lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'i dus gcig na gzhan ni gzhan gyi dus gcig na bya ba lta bu ma yin te /
translated: This is not like “at one time here, at another time there.”

original: 'di ltar dus mtshon pa yang dus gsum la sogs pa dus nges par bstan pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dus mtshon pa yang dus gsum la sogs pa dus nges par bstan pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the indication of time is not a teaching of a definite time such as the three times.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyis bdud bzhi bcom pa dang legs pa'i yon tan drug dang ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes te byang chub sems rdo rje'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyis bdud bzhi bcom pa dang legs pa'i yon tan drug dang ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes te byang chub sems rdo rje'o //
translated: The Blessed One: because of the destruction of the four demons by wisdom and because of the possession of the six excellent qualities, he is the Blessed One, the Bodhisattva Vajra.

original: yang 'dir dgyes pa'i gnas na bzhugs pa'i phyir yang de skad ces bya la /
analyzed: yang 'dir dgyes pa'i gnas na bzhugs pa'i phyir yang de skad ces bya la /
translated: Moreover, here he is so called because he dwells in the place of delight.

original: ye shes kyi rang bzhin la @39b bcom zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi rang bzhin la @39b bcom zhes gsungs te /
translated: The nature of intuition is said to be the destruction of those.

original: de rnams dang gang ldan pa de de ltar yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams dang gang ldan pa de de ltar yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is so called because he possesses those and is such.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pas bla na med pa'i chos bstan pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i rten gyi khyad par gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pas bla na med pa'i chos bstan pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i rten gyi khyad par gsungs so //
translated: The special support that is in conformity with the teaching of the unsurpassed Dharma by the Tathagata and so forth is stated.

original: bshad pa de bzhin gshegs pa ni ji ltar skyes pa bzhin skyes pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bshad pa de bzhin gshegs pa ni ji ltar skyes pa bzhin skyes pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The explanation is that the Tathagata is called the Tathagata because he is born just as he was born.

original: de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: pha dang ma gnyes thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i dbang gis pho mo phrad par gyur nas /
analyzed: pha dang ma gnyes thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i dbang gis pho mo phrad par gyur nas /
translated: From beginningless time, due to the power of being endowed with desire, a male and female come together.

original: de nyid rnam par sbyangs nas yang dag pa'i lam du 'gro ba'i phyir na de de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par sbyangs nas yang dag pa'i lam du 'gro ba'i phyir na de de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he has purified that and goes on the true path, he is called the Tathagata.

original: yang ji ltar 'ongs pa bzhin 'gro ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: yang ji ltar 'ongs pa bzhin 'gro ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, he is the Tathagata because he goes just as he came.

original: dper na zangs dang gser la sogs pa rdzas kyi dngos po gcig la /
analyzed: dper na zangs dang gser la sogs pa rdzas kyi dngos po gcig la /
translated: For example, a single substance such as copper and gold,

original: ngan snod du byas pa'i tshe na mi gtsang bar 'dzin cing 'dor par byed /
analyzed: ngan snod du byas pa'i tshe na mi gtsang bar 'dzin cing 'dor par byed /
translated: when made into a vessel for the impure, is held as impure and discarded.

original: de gzhong pa la sogs par byas pa'i tsho na gtsang bar byed cing blang bar byed /
analyzed: de gzhong pa la sogs par byas pa'i tsho na gtsang bar byed cing blang bar byed /
translated: When it is made into a bowl, etc., it is purified and used.

original: de sku gzugs la sogs par byas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de sku gzugs la sogs par byas pa'i tshe /
translated: When it is made into an image, etc.,

original: phyag 'tshal zhing mchod par byed do //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal zhing mchod par byed do //
translated: it is worshipped with prostrations.

original: de bzhin du 'khor ba'i rgyu la dang po brgyad dang dgu pa dang bcas par spyad pa'i dus na ni smad cing spang bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor ba'i rgyu la dang po brgyad dang dgu pa dang bcas par spyad pa'i dus na ni smad cing spang bar bya ba yin la /
translated: Similarly, when the eight causes of cyclic existence are practiced, along with the ninth, they are to be despised and abandoned.

original: de nyid thabs dang shes rab kyi tshul du rnam par sbyangs pa'i dus na ni sku 'grub par byed pa'i longs spyod kyi gnas kyang yin la /
analyzed: de nyid thabs dang shes rab kyi tshul du rnam par sbyangs pa'i dus na ni sku 'grub par byed pa'i longs spyod kyi gnas kyang yin la /
translated: When they are purified in the manner of method and wisdom, they are also the basis of enjoyment that creates the body of a buddha.

original: de ltar zung du 'brel pa'i goms pa'i dbang gis 'bras bu nyid mngon par 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar zung du 'brel pa'i goms pa'i dbang gis 'bras bu nyid mngon par 'grub par byed do //
translated: In that way, through the power of cultivating the union, the result itself is actualized.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa chos lnga po 'di dag kyang /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa chos lnga po 'di dag kyang /
translated: These five dharmas of desire, etc.,

original: dang po'i tshul ltar spyad nang na song gi rgyu yang yin /
analyzed: dang po'i tshul ltar spyad nang na song gi rgyu yang yin /
translated: are the cause of going to the lower realms when practiced in the manner of the first.

original: de nyid rnam par dag par bsgoms na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes skye ba'i rgyu yang pas nyes par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par dag par bsgoms na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes skye ba'i rgyu yang pas nyes par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one meditates on that very thing as pure, then there is no fault, since it is the cause of the arising of the gnosis of omniscience.

original: de'i phyir de skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, it is applied in that context.

original: de la sgra mang du ci dgos she na /
analyzed: de la sgra mang du ci dgos she na /
translated: What is the use of many words there?

original: don nges par bstan pa 'di yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don nges par bstan pa 'di yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this meaning is ascertained.

original: de thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs ni gsang ba ste /
analyzed: de thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs ni gsang ba ste /
translated: The body, speech, and mind of all of them is secret,

original: gzhan gyi spyod yul ma yin pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi spyod yul ma yin pas so //
translated: because it is not the domain of others.

original: de rnams kho na snying po'i sa bon yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kho na snying po'i sa bon yin no //
translated: Those very [bodies, etc.] are the seed syllables of the essence.

original: rdo rje ni mi phyed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje ni mi phyed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: A vajra has the characteristic of being indivisible.

original: de'i btsun mo ni phyag rgya'i don to //
analyzed: de'i btsun mo ni phyag rgya'i don to //
translated: His queen has the meaning of a mudra.

original: bha ga la zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das chos kyi 'byung gnas de'i padma'i gnas na bzhugs par ston to //
analyzed: bha ga la zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das chos kyi 'byung gnas de'i padma'i gnas na bzhugs par ston to //
translated: The word bhaga indicates that the Bhagavan resides in the abode of the lotus of that dharmodaya.

original: so sor snang ba'i 'byung ba nges par 'brel pa nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: so sor snang ba'i 'byung ba nges par 'brel pa nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: Because of the definite connection of the individual appearances arising,

original: gcig la yang @40a * //
analyzed: gcig la yang @40a * //
translated: even in one,

original: chos kyi 'byung gnas la sogs pa mang po'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi 'byung gnas la sogs pa mang po'i tshig yin no //
translated: there are many words such as dharmodaya.

original: de bzhugs zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de bzhugs zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: The word “abides” is connected with “that”.

original: bzhugs pa'i sgra ni rnam par gnas so pa'i don to //
analyzed: bzhugs pa'i sgra ni rnam par gnas so pa'i don to //
translated: The word “abides” means “is situated”.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa la spyod pa'i sems can rnams la /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa la spyod pa'i sems can rnams la /
translated: In sentient beings who are engaged in passion, etc.,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i thabs kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa mngon par byang chub pa'i rang bzhin rnams bya ba de kho na de'i bzhugs pa rang gi las yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i thabs kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa mngon par byang chub pa'i rang bzhin rnams bya ba de kho na de'i bzhugs pa rang gi las yin no //
translated: the reality of the manifest enlightenment of passion, etc., through the method of passion, etc., is the abiding of that, its own action.

original: 'byung ba gtso bor gyur pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba gtso bor gyur pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the primary element,

original: 'das pa la sogs pa yang de ltar nyid du des yang dag par rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa yang de ltar nyid du des yang dag par rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the past, etc., are also known in that way by it.

original: gang dag dang bzhugs pa ni brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa la sogs pa dang ste /
analyzed: gang dag dang bzhugs pa ni brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa la sogs pa dang ste /
translated: The “abiding” with which is described as “inconceivable, beyond the inconceivable, etc.”

original: bshad pa grangs dang grangs las 'das pa'i don du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa grangs dang grangs las 'das pa'i don du bstan pa yin te /
translated: The explanation is given in the sense of number and beyond number.

original: de'i phyir gzugs dang yon tan brjod du med par bstan pa des ni de rnams la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs dang yon tan brjod du med par bstan pa des ni de rnams la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because form and quality are taught as “inconceivable”, they are called that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing rdul phra mo snyed ces pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing rdul phra mo snyed ces pa ni /
translated: Therefore, as many as the atoms in the Buddha-fields

original: rab tu mang po'i don te grangs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu mang po'i don te grangs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means very many, because of the countless number.

original: byang chub ni phyag rgya /
analyzed: byang chub ni phyag rgya /
translated: Enlightenment is the seal.

original: sems dpa' ni 'dod pa //
analyzed: sems dpa' ni 'dod pa //
translated: The being is the desire.

original: chen po ni bde ba chen po'i ye shes la gnas so ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chen po ni bde ba chen po'i ye shes la gnas so ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The great is the abode of the exalted wisdom of great bliss.

original: sems can gyi don la 'jug pa'i phyir de rnams dang thabs cig tu bdag gis thos so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sems can gyi don la 'jug pa'i phyir de rnams dang thabs cig tu bdag gis thos so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: I heard means that I heard together with them, in order to engage in the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de skad ces bsdus pa'i don du bstan mod kyi /
analyzed: de skad ces bsdus pa'i don du bstan mod kyi /
translated: Although it is taught in this way as the condensed meaning,

original: de la gang gang bzhugs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la gang gang bzhugs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach each of them,

original: 'dir so so'i mtshan yang gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir so so'i mtshan yang gsungs so //
translated: their individual names are also stated here.

original: 'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pas ni /
translated: The phrase for example and so forth

original: nye bar mtshon pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: nye bar mtshon pa'i tshig ste /
translated: is a demonstrative term.

original: de rnams kyi nang nas rgyu'i sgo nas nye bar shes pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la 'ga' zhig brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi nang nas rgyu'i sgo nas nye bar shes pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la 'ga' zhig brjod pa yin no //
translated: Among them, some are stated for the yogis who understand them by way of their causes.

original: rgyud las mig rnam par dag pa dang rna ba rnam bar dag pa phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa rnams ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha kho na ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyud las mig rnam par dag pa dang rna ba rnam bar dag pa phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa rnams ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha kho na ma yin te /
translated: The tantra does not say that the pure eyes and pure ears and so forth are only the deities of the mandala,

original: 'dir rang gi phyag mtshan dang ; ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo dang / spyan drang pa'i sngags la sogs pa gsungs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir rang gi phyag mtshan dang ; ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo dang / spyan drang pa'i sngags la sogs pa gsungs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because here there is no mention of their own hand implements, the nature of their meditative concentration, the mantra for inviting them, and so forth.

original: 'o na ji ltar de brjod kyis mi la ra ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de brjod kyis mi la ra ba yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how are they inexpressible?

original: bden te de ltar yin yang de rnams re re yang grangs med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: bden te de ltar yin yang de rnams re re yang grangs med pa nyid yin te /
translated: Although that is so, they are also countless.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi lha'i dbang du @40b byas nas gtso bor gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi lha'i dbang du @40b byas nas gtso bor gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the principal ones in terms of each of their own mandala deities.

original: des mngon du byas pa de shes so //
analyzed: des mngon du byas pa de shes so //
translated: One should understand that they are manifested by that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: For that very reason,

original: de dag la sogs pa'i zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa'i zhes pa ni /
translated: those and so forth

original: rdul phra mo snyed kyi grangs te /
analyzed: rdul phra mo snyed kyi grangs te /
translated: are as numerous as the smallest particles.

original: nge rnams ni gtsor brjod par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nge rnams ni gtsor brjod par bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that they are the principal ones.

original: kha cig na re rdul snyed pa'i 'khor lo smos na yod pa nyid pas 'dir ma smos kyang /
analyzed: kha cig na re rdul snyed pa'i 'khor lo smos na yod pa nyid pas 'dir ma smos kyang /
translated: Some say: If the retinue equal to particles is mentioned, then even though not mentioned here,

original: sku mdog dang phyag mtshan dang sngags dang spyan drang ba la sogs pa rgyud gzhan nas 'byung dgos te /
analyzed: sku mdog dang phyag mtshan dang sngags dang spyan drang ba la sogs pa rgyud gzhan nas 'byung dgos te /
translated: the colors of the body, implements, mantras, and invocations must come from other tantras.

original: de 'khor lo mthun pa'i rigs su bskor dgos pas /
analyzed: de 'khor lo mthun pa'i rigs su bskor dgos pas /
translated: Since the retinue must be turned into a suitable type for the wheel,

original: sems can gyi thabs kyi don mi 'grub par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sems can gyi thabs kyi don mi 'grub par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: it would not be suitable for the purpose of sentient beings.

original: 'gyur te gtso ba ni gcig kho na yang kun dang ldan zhe'o //
analyzed: 'gyur te gtso ba ni gcig kho na yang kun dang ldan zhe'o //
translated: That is not so, because the principal is just one, but all possess the wheel.

original: da ni gtsor brjod pa rnams bstan te /
analyzed: da ni gtsor brjod pa rnams bstan te /
translated: Now the principal ones are taught.

original: de la dam tshig rdo rje zhes thog mar smos ci dgos she na /
analyzed: de la dam tshig rdo rje zhes thog mar smos ci dgos she na /
translated: Why is it necessary to mention the pledge vajra at the beginning?

original: lha rnams mnyes pa'i rgyu dam tshig gis byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha rnams mnyes pa'i rgyu dam tshig gis byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the pledge is the cause of delighting the deities.

original: de nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: don rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: don rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It has two topics:

original: phyi dang nang ngo //
analyzed: phyi dang nang ngo //
translated: outer and inner.

original: phyi ni 'jig rten pa'i bsrung ba rnams so //
analyzed: phyi ni 'jig rten pa'i bsrung ba rnams so //
translated: The outer is the worldly protections.

original: nang gi ni rtag tu dag pa'i sems la sogs pa lnga dang / sha lnga bza' ba dang / gzhan las dbrog pa dang / rmang du byung bas gsod pa ma sogs pa ni dam tshig sdom pa yin no //
analyzed: nang gi ni rtag tu dag pa'i sems la sogs pa lnga dang / sha lnga bza' ba dang / gzhan las dbrog pa dang / rmang du byung bas gsod pa ma sogs pa ni dam tshig sdom pa yin no //
translated: The inner ones are the five always pure ones, mind, etc., and the five meats to be eaten, and the taking away from others, and the killing of the mother, etc., which occur in the root tantra.

original: bshad pa dam tshig ni yul la yul can gnyis su med ba'i rdo rje ni dam tshig ste mig sa'i snying po'o //
analyzed: bshad pa dam tshig ni yul la yul can gnyis su med ba'i rdo rje ni dam tshig ste mig sa'i snying po'o //
translated: The explanation of the pledge is that the pledge is the vajra of nonduality of object and subject, and the eye is the essence of the earth.

original: chos 'di'i rtags kyis kyang gong du byung ba'i sgras /
analyzed: chos 'di'i rtags kyis kyang gong du byung ba'i sgras /
translated: By the sign of this Dharma, as it occurs above,

original: sems dpa' dang po'i rnam pa kho nar ting nge 'dzin 'di rnam par bshad do //
analyzed: sems dpa' dang po'i rnam pa kho nar ting nge 'dzin 'di rnam par bshad do //
translated: this meditative stabilization is explained in the form of the first hero.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ni mngon du byas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ni mngon du byas nas /
translated: The bodhisattva, the great hero, having actualized it,

original: da ni de ltar dam tshig bsrungs nas sku 'grub par bya ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: da ni de ltar dam tshig bsrungs nas sku 'grub par bya ba'i phyir ;
translated: now, having thus guarded the pledge, in order to accomplish the body,

original: sku rdo rje smos so //
analyzed: sku rdo rje smos so //
translated: he mentions the vajra body.

original: sku grub dang tshig kyang dgos te /
analyzed: sku grub dang tshig kyang dgos te /
translated: The body is accomplished and speech is also necessary,

original: sku gsung tha mi dang par bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sku gsung tha mi dang par bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: and in order to demonstrate that the body and speech are not different,

original: gsung rdo rje smos so //
analyzed: gsung rdo rje smos so //
translated: he mentions the vajra speech.

original: de ltar tshig grub nas sems dpyod par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar tshig grub nas sems dpyod par byed de /
translated: Thus, he analyzes the mind from the sentence.

original: sems ni rang bzhin dang bral bar yang mkhyen la /
analyzed: sems ni rang bzhin dang bral bar yang mkhyen la /
translated: He knows the mind to be free from intrinsic nature,

original: mi gnyis par rig ste /
analyzed: mi gnyis par rig ste /
translated: and he knows it to be nondual.

original: de'i phyir thugs rdo rje smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir thugs rdo rje smos so //
translated: Therefore, he mentions the vajra of mind.

original: sku gsung thugs de nyid ting nge 'dzin med par /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs de nyid ting nge 'dzin med par /
translated: That very body, speech, and mind, without meditative concentration,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku dang gnyis su med pa mi 'grub pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku dang gnyis su med pa mi 'grub pas /
translated: are not accomplished as nondual with the body of a buddha.

original: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin rdo rje smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin rdo rje smos so //
translated: Therefore, he mentions the vajra of meditative concentration.

original: de ltar ting nge 'dzin thob nas /
analyzed: de ltar ting nge 'dzin thob nas /
translated: Thus, having attained meditative concentration,

original: gang gis sems mngon par dga' bar bya ba de rgyal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gis sems mngon par dga' bar bya ba de rgyal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to show that which delights the mind,

original: @41a * // rgyal ba rdo rje smos so //
analyzed: @41a * // rgyal ba rdo rje smos so //
translated: he mentions the vajra of the victor.

original: de bshad pa /
analyzed: de bshad pa /
translated: That is explained.

original: lus rdo rje la sogs pa rnam pa lnga'i sgras phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa lnga'i rnam pa kho nar 'byung bas /
analyzed: lus rdo rje la sogs pa rnam pa lnga'i sgras phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa lnga'i rnam pa kho nar 'byung bas /
translated: The five aspects of the vajra body and so forth are only the five aspects of Vajrapāṇi and so forth.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di rnams bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di rnams bshad pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, these meditative concentrations are explained,

original: de sgra rnams kyi rtags yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de sgra rnams kyi rtags yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are the signs of those sounds.

original: des na phyag na rdo rje dang nam mkha'i snying po dang / spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang / sgrib pa rnam par sel ba dang / rdo rje sems dpa' rnams go rims bzhin du gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: des na phyag na rdo rje dang nam mkha'i snying po dang / spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang / sgrib pa rnam par sel ba dang / rdo rje sems dpa' rnams go rims bzhin du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, Vajrapani, Akashagarbha, Avalokitesvara, Nivaranavishkambhin, and Vajrasattva are taught in order.

original: de rnams ni nang gi skye mched kyi bdag nyid gnas pa dang / gcod pa'i rim pa bzhin du rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir na nye bar bsgrub ba la rnal 'byor pa'i de rnams byin gyis brlab sa pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de rnams ni nang gi skye mched kyi bdag nyid gnas pa dang / gcod pa'i rim pa bzhin du rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir na nye bar bsgrub ba la rnal 'byor pa'i de rnams byin gyis brlab sa pa kho na yin no //
translated: Since they are the internal sense bases, they are the blessings of those yogis who are established in the process of purification, which is like the process of cutting.

original: de ltar bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: de ltar bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni /
translated: The result of such meditation

original: 'phrul gyi mig la sogs pa mngon par shes pa drug skyed par byed do //
analyzed: 'phrul gyi mig la sogs pa mngon par shes pa drug skyed par byed do //
translated: generates the six higher perceptions, such as the magical eye.

original: gal te thog mar byung ba'i sgras don yod grub pa la sogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te thog mar byung ba'i sgras don yod grub pa la sogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If one says that the first arising refers to Amoghasiddhi and so on,

original: ma yin te rigs kyi mtshan 'og nas mngon du brjod pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa'i le'u la de bzhin gshegs par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te rigs kyi mtshan 'og nas mngon du brjod pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa'i le'u la de bzhin gshegs par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because the characteristics of the family are expressed below, and because it is not possible for the chapter on the bodhisattva to be the Tathagata.

original: da ni rigs kyi yum rnams gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni rigs kyi yum rnams gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the mothers of the family are stated.

original: sa rdo rje la sogs pa lnga'i sgras byang chub sems lhun gyis grub pa las chos lnga po 'di dag skyed par byed de lnga ni sa la sogs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: sa rdo rje la sogs pa lnga'i sgras byang chub sems lhun gyis grub pa las chos lnga po 'di dag skyed par byed de lnga ni sa la sogs pa lnga'o //
translated: The five words beginning with earth-vajra indicate that these five dharmas are generated from the spontaneous mind of enlightenment. The five are the five beginning with earth.

original: ji ltar skyed par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar skyed par byed ce na /
translated: How are they generated?

original: de yang go rims bzhin bshad na sa'i khams ni sangs rgyas spyan /
analyzed: de yang go rims bzhin bshad na sa'i khams ni sangs rgyas spyan /
translated: And that is explained in order: the earth element is Buddhalocana,

original: chu'i khams ni rgyal ba'i yum /
analyzed: chu'i khams ni rgyal ba'i yum /
translated: the water element is Mamaki,

original: me'i khams ni na bza' dkar mo /
analyzed: me'i khams ni na bza' dkar mo /
translated: the fire element is Pandaravasini,

original: rlung gi khams ni 'phags ma sgrol ma /
analyzed: rlung gi khams ni 'phags ma sgrol ma /
translated: the wind element is the noble Tara,

original: nam mkha'i khams ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma'o //
translated: and the space element is Vajradhatviśvari.

original: de la nam mkha' rdo rje ni de bzhin nyid dang gzhal yas khang brtsegs pa la sogs pa rten dang rten can gyi ngo bo nyid rnams la /
analyzed: de la nam mkha' rdo rje ni de bzhin nyid dang gzhal yas khang brtsegs pa la sogs pa rten dang rten can gyi ngo bo nyid rnams la /
translated: Here, space-vajra is the reality of the abode and the inhabitants, such as the celestial mansion and the stacked up deities, etc.

original: rnam par dag pa'i don bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i don bstan pa yin te /
translated: It is the teaching of the meaning of purity,

original: rang bzhin gyis yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is natural.

original: de nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: de nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: It is like space.

original: nam mkha'i dngos po'i rkyen dang ldan pa'i rdo rje ni sgrib pa med par snang ba'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i don te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dngos po'i rkyen dang ldan pa'i rdo rje ni sgrib pa med par snang ba'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i don te /
translated: The vajra endowed with the condition of the entity of space is the meaning of purity by the very nature of the wisdom of unobstructed appearance.

original: de'i phyir yang rdo rje 'dzin pa yongs su 'dod pa ni ma yin te /🔽bzhugs @41b so zhes 'byung bas /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang rdo rje 'dzin pa yongs su 'dod pa ni ma yin te / bzhugs @41b so zhes 'byung bas /
translated: Therefore, it is not that the one who is present is the Vajra Holder,🔽because it is said that he is present as Vajrasattva.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' kho nar gsungs pa'i phyir dang / de'i phyir bdag nyid dang thabs cig tu bzhugs pa mi 'byor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' kho nar gsungs pa'i phyir dang / de'i phyir bdag nyid dang thabs cig tu bzhugs pa mi 'byor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not appropriate that he is present together with himself.

original: 'dir rnam par bsgyur bar byas kyang mi dgag ste /
analyzed: 'dir rnam par bsgyur bar byas kyang mi dgag ste /
translated: Here, even if it is transformed, it is not refuted,

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gnas pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gnas pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the characteristics of the conditioned, such as endurance, etc.

original: gang du yang nang gi nam mkha' nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang du yang nang gi nam mkha' nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa zhes brjod do //
translated: And in all places, the inner space itself is called Vajra Holder.

original: mngon du sems dpa' rnams brjod nas de'i don gyis gsungs pa ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa ste yul du gyur pa'i gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang / ro dang reg dang chos kyi rang bzhin gyi go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: mngon du sems dpa' rnams brjod nas de'i don gyis gsungs pa ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa ste yul du gyur pa'i gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang / ro dang reg dang chos kyi rang bzhin gyi go rims bzhin du /
translated: Having mentioned the actual heroes, he states their meaning: Form Vajra and so on, that is, the six goddesses Form, Sound, Smell, Taste, Touch, and Reality, in that order.

original: gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo drug kyang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo drug kyang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He also states the six goddesses Form Vajra Woman and so on.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa drug kyang de ltar ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa drug kyang de ltar ro //
translated: The six, generosity and so on, are also like that.

original: de dag gi byang chub sems dpa' chen po ni sngon du yang btang ste go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: de dag gi byang chub sems dpa' chen po ni sngon du yang btang ste go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: The great heroes of those are also mentioned before, but since they are easy to understand, they are not explained.

original: de dag la sogs pa'i sgras gtso bor brjod par mngon te /
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa'i sgras gtso bor brjod par mngon te /
translated: The word and so on indicates that the principal ones are mentioned.

original: gtso bo nyid kyis thams cad brjod du mi lang ba zhes pa'i don gsungs so //
analyzed: gtso bo nyid kyis thams cad brjod du mi lang ba zhes pa'i don gsungs so //
translated: The meaning of by the principal ones, all are not mentioned is stated.

original: de ltar rdul phra mo snyed ces bya ba ni grangs med pa'i nye ba'i dpe bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar rdul phra mo snyed ces bya ba ni grangs med pa'i nye ba'i dpe bstan to //
translated: Thus, as many as the smallest particles teaches an example of the countless.

original: de dag ni 'khor gyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de dag ni 'khor gyi rang bzhin te /
translated: These are the nature of the retinue.

original: dang zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The word “and” has the sense of “also.”

original: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bstan te /
analyzed: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bstan te /
translated: Now the Tathagatas are taught.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa ni sngon du byas pa ste go sla bas so //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa ni sngon du byas pa ste go sla bas so //
translated: Among them, the Tathagata is the one who acts first, because it is easy to understand.

original: de yang tshad ji tsam zhe na /
analyzed: de yang tshad ji tsam zhe na /
translated: And how great is he?

original: nam mkha'i dbyings dang mnyam pa zhes 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings dang mnyam pa zhes 'byung mod kyi /
translated: It is said that he is equal to the realm of space.

original: re zhig mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rang rang gi dbang du byas nas gtso bo tsam zhig bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rang rang gi dbang du byas nas gtso bo tsam zhig bstan pa yin no //
translated: But for the time being, Akshobhya and so forth are taught as the chief ones, each in his own place.

original: 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa mi bskyod pa la sogs pa lnga'i sgras ni bdag gi zhe sdang la sogs pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa mi bskyod pa la sogs pa lnga'i sgras ni bdag gi zhe sdang la sogs pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin bstan te /
translated: Here, the words “Akshobhya” and so forth refer to the nature of one’s own hatred and so forth, and the aggregate of consciousness and so forth.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes la sogs pas de dag rnam par dag pas mi bskyod pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad dang / dkon mchog dpal dang / tshe dpag tu med pa dang / gdon mi za ba ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes la sogs pas de dag rnam par dag pas mi bskyod pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad dang / dkon mchog dpal dang / tshe dpag tu med pa dang / gdon mi za ba ste /
translated: The Buddhas Akshobhya, Vairochana, Ratnasambhava, Amitabha, and Amoghasiddhi are explained respectively as the purities of the mirror-like wisdom, etc.

original: gnyis su med pa dang ldan pa'i lha rnams go rims bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa dang ldan pa'i lha rnams go rims bzhin du bshad do //
translated: The deities who are endowed with the non-dual are explained in order.

original: rdo rje mi bskyod pa ni gang dag zhe sdang dang rnam shes ldan pa'i sems de'i ngo bor gnas par bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje mi bskyod pa ni gang dag zhe sdang dang rnam shes ldan pa'i sems de'i ngo bor gnas par bstan to //
translated: Vajra Akshobhya is taught as the essence of those who abide in the nature of the mind endowed with hatred and consciousness.

original: gang dag gti mug dang de'i zlar byas pa rnams la /🔽rdo rje rnam par snang mdzad de'i ngo bor gnas par bstan to //
analyzed: gang dag gti mug dang de'i zlar byas pa rnams la / rdo rje rnam par snang mdzad de'i ngo bor gnas par bstan to //
translated: Those who abide in the nature of ignorance and its antidote are

original: dkon mchog @42a * //🔽dpal ni / gang dag nga rgyal dang de'i zlar byas pa ldan pa rnams la /
analyzed: dkon mchog @42a * // dpal ni / gang dag nga rgyal dang de'i zlar byas pa ldan pa rnams la /
translated: Vajra Vairochana.

original: rin chen dpal de'i ngo bor gnas par bstan to //
analyzed: rin chen dpal de'i ngo bor gnas par bstan to //
translated: Ratna Shri is taught as the essence of those who abide in the nature of pride and its antidote.

original: rdo rje 'od dpag tu med pa ni gang dag 'dod chags dang de'i zlar byas pa ldan pa rnams la de'i ngo bor gnas par bstan to //🔽gang dag phrag dog dang de'i zlar byas pa ldan pa rnams la /
analyzed: rdo rje 'od dpag tu med pa ni gang dag 'dod chags dang de'i zlar byas pa ldan pa rnams la de'i ngo bor gnas par bstan to // gang dag phrag dog dang de'i zlar byas pa ldan pa rnams la /
translated: The vajra of immeasurable light is taught to abide in the nature of those who are endowed with passion and its antidote.

original: rdo rje gdon mi za bar grub pa de'i ngo bor gnas par bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje gdon mi za bar grub pa de'i ngo bor gnas par bstan to //
translated: The vajra of Amoghasiddhi is taught to abide in the nature of those who are endowed with jealousy and its antidote.

original: 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgras gtsor brjod par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgras gtsor brjod par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here also, the word “etc.” indicates that the principal ones are taught.

original: de la nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad ces bya ba ni de rnams kyis brjod kyis mi lang ba'i don gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad ces bya ba ni de rnams kyis brjod kyis mi lang ba'i don gsungs pa yin te /
translated: There, “the entire realm of space” indicates the inexpressible meaning of those.

original: nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is an illustration.

original: til 'bru ji tsam pa bzhin du til mar gyis khyab ste /
analyzed: til 'bru ji tsam pa bzhin du til mar gyis khyab ste /
translated: Just as a sesame seed is pervaded by sesame oil,

original: de dang 'dra bar nam mkha'i dbyings ji tsam pa thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis khyab par snang bar gyur to zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du thams cad sprul nas bzhugs so ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar nam mkha'i dbyings ji tsam pa thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis khyab par snang bar gyur to zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du thams cad sprul nas bzhugs so ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Similarly, the entire realm of space appeared to be filled with all the Tathagatas. This means that all of them were emanated in the nature of the realm of reality.

original: de ltar gzhir gnas kyi dngos po nam mkha' rdo rje ma gtogs par sngon du byas pa'i rtsa gcig dang / dang bo bzhi'i dang / bzhi pa las gsungs pa'i sngags dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams 'byung ba'i phyir na khro bo bzhi yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gzhir gnas kyi dngos po nam mkha' rdo rje ma gtogs par sngon du byas pa'i rtsa gcig dang / dang bo bzhi'i dang / bzhi pa las gsungs pa'i sngags dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams 'byung ba'i phyir na khro bo bzhi yin te /
translated: Thus, the four wrathful ones are the four channels mentioned in the first, second, third, and fourth chapters, and the mantras and pledge seals mentioned in the fourth chapter, because they are the source of the five channels that exist in the ground, except for space-vajra.

original: de ltar rtsa lngar mngon no //
analyzed: de ltar rtsa lngar mngon no //
translated: Thus, the five channels are clearly mentioned.

original: gzhan dag ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ma yin te /
translated: Others are not,

original: gdon mi za bar 'grub pa nyid kyi phyir dang / rgyu nye bar mi sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'grub pa nyid kyi phyir dang / rgyu nye bar mi sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are definitely accomplished and because they do not apply the cause.

original: de dag gi don ni 'di skad du sngon du rim bzhin du gsungs nas /
analyzed: de dag gi don ni 'di skad du sngon du rim bzhin du gsungs nas /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows. Having been mentioned in sequence,

original: de'i rjes su mngon par rtogs pa rab tu dkrugs nas bstan pa ma byas na /
analyzed: de'i rjes su mngon par rtogs pa rab tu dkrugs nas bstan pa ma byas na /
translated: After that, if the clear realization is not taught by thoroughly mixing it,

original: shes pas rgyags pa rnams kyis nga rgyal gsal bar byed pa dang / bla ma dang so sor 'brel pas 'grub po zhes ston pas /
analyzed: shes pas rgyags pa rnams kyis nga rgyal gsal bar byed pa dang / bla ma dang so sor 'brel pas 'grub po zhes ston pas /
translated: then the proud ones, intoxicated with knowledge, will make their pride clear, and it will be taught that one is accomplished by the connection with the guru.

original: mngon par rtogs pa dkrugs nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa dkrugs nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the clear realization is explained by thoroughly mixing it.

original: da ni bskyed pa'i rim pa las 'ongs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: da ni bskyed pa'i rim pa las 'ongs pa ma yin te /
translated: Now, it is not from the stage of generation,

original: 'gro ba rnams skal ba thob pa'i mtshan ma gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba'i sprul pa'i ched du thabs dang shes rab dga' bar bya ba gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams skal ba thob pa'i mtshan ma gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba'i sprul pa'i ched du thabs dang shes rab dga' bar bya ba gsungs pa ni /
translated: but for the purpose of the emanation of the empowerment in the secret mandala of the sign of the good fortune of migrating beings, the joy of method and wisdom is taught.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa tshig bzhi bas so //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa tshig bzhi bas so //
translated: Then and so forth is explained in four lines.

original: de la tshig rnams sngon du byas te rnam par snang mdzad ni rnam par snang bar mdzad pas na de skad ces bya ste don du na byang chub kyi @42b sems rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de la tshig rnams sngon du byas te rnam par snang mdzad ni rnam par snang bar mdzad pas na de skad ces bya ste don du na byang chub kyi @42b sems rdo rje'o //
translated: There, having made the words prior, Vairochana is so called because he makes things visible. In fact, it is the bodhichitta vajra.

original: chags par byed pa dang / chags par byas pa gnyis so sor chags pa la 'dod chags chen po ste /
analyzed: chags par byed pa dang / chags par byas pa gnyis so sor chags pa la 'dod chags chen po ste /
translated: The great passion is the passion of each one, the one who is passionate and the one who is caused to be passionate.

original: de la gnas pa'i yon tan gyi rnam pa thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid du ldan pa'i sems la yang 'khril ba'i tshul gyis ting nge 'dzin dang gang ldan pa de rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rnam pa kho nar bzhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i yon tan gyi rnam pa thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid du ldan pa'i sems la yang 'khril ba'i tshul gyis ting nge 'dzin dang gang ldan pa de rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rnam pa kho nar bzhugs pa yin no //
translated: The mind endowed with the method and wisdom natures, abiding in those qualities, also is endowed with samadhi in the manner of embracing.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sems kyang thabs dang shes rab kyi rang nyid du 'khril ba'i don to //🔽de lta bu'i don la snyoms par zhugs nas shes rab ma dga' bar mdzad pa'i don du 'khor de dag thams cad nyid kyi sku la zhugs par mdzad de zhes pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pas kyang gsang sngags kyi 'dul ba'i thabs kyis bsgrub pa shes pa nyid
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sems kyang thabs dang shes rab kyi rang nyid du 'khril ba'i don to // de lta bu'i don la snyoms par zhugs nas shes rab ma dga' bar mdzad pa'i don du 'khor de dag thams cad nyid kyi sku la zhugs par mdzad de zhes pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pas kyang gsang sngags kyi 'dul ba'i thabs kyis bsgrub pa shes pa nyid
translated: The word “also” means that the mind is also embraced in the nature of method and wisdom.🔽Having entered into such an object, in order to delight the wisdom woman, all of the retinue enter into the body of the Vajra Holder.

original: kyis shes rab ma dga' bar mdzad do //
analyzed: kyis shes rab ma dga' bar mdzad do //
translated: This means that the Vajra Holder, by knowing the method of accomplishing the Secret Mantra discipline, delights the wisdom woman.

original: bud med la ni skye bo phal po che 'dod chags phal pa dang ldan pas kyang dga' bar byas so //
analyzed: bud med la ni skye bo phal po che 'dod chags phal pa dang ldan pas kyang dga' bar byas so //
translated: Women are delighted by ordinary men, because they are endowed with ordinary passion.

original: des kyang 'dir de dag mngon no //
analyzed: des kyang 'dir de dag mngon no //
translated: And here, they are manifest.

original: gzhan dag ni gzhan du 'chad de 'di skad du rtsa ba las gsungs pa'i tshig dang po yis ni gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa bskyed pa'i phyir zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gzhan du 'chad de 'di skad du rtsa ba las gsungs pa'i tshig dang po yis ni gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa bskyed pa'i phyir zhes 'chad do //
translated: Others explain it differently, saying that the first line of the root text states that the creation of Rūpavajrā and so forth is for the sake of delighting the ordinary men and women.

original: de dag ni rdo rje 'dzin pa de gzugs la sogs pa ni skye ba med cing /
analyzed: de dag ni rdo rje 'dzin pa de gzugs la sogs pa ni skye ba med cing /
translated: But that is not logical, because Rūpavajrā and so forth are not born from the body of Vajradhara,

original: phyi nang gi gzugs dang mi 'bral ba'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi nang gi gzugs dang mi 'bral ba'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: and because it is not logical that they are inseparable from external and internal form.

original: sems can rnams gzung pa'i don du yang nyid kyi sku bud med du sprul nas gtso bo mnyes par bya ba'i phyir sku las byung ba ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can rnams gzung pa'i don du yang nyid kyi sku bud med du sprul nas gtso bo mnyes par bya ba'i phyir sku las byung ba ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pas gsungs so //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, he emanates his body as a woman, and for the sake of pleasing the principal deity, he emerges from the body. This is stated by “then” and so forth.

original: de dag ni go sla bas so //
analyzed: de dag ni go sla bas so //
translated: These are easy to understand.

original: de la la la ni sangs rgyas spyan lta bu zhes bya ba ni de la sangs rgyas ni rnam par snang mdzad ces pa'i don du shes par bya'o ;
analyzed: de la la la ni sangs rgyas spyan lta bu zhes bya ba ni de la sangs rgyas ni rnam par snang mdzad ces pa'i don du shes par bya'o ;
translated: Buddha means Vairocana.

original: / de yang rang rang gi mdog dang ldan pa rnams te /
analyzed: / de yang rang rang gi mdog dang ldan pa rnams te /
translated: They have their own colors.

original: la la spyan lta bu la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: la la spyan lta bu la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Some are like the eye, etc.

original: la la ni m'a ma k'i la sogs pa rang rang gi rigs dang rjes su mthun pa'i gzugs dang / la la ni gos dkar mo lta bu mdog dmar mo dang ldan pa dang / la la sgrol ma lta bu mdog ser mo dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: la la ni m'a ma k'i la sogs pa rang rang gi rigs dang rjes su mthun pa'i gzugs dang / la la ni gos dkar mo lta bu mdog dmar mo dang ldan pa dang / la la sgrol ma lta bu mdog ser mo dang ldan pa dang /
translated: Some are like Mamaki, etc., with forms that accord with their own families. Some are like Pandaravasini, with a red color. Some are like Tara, with a yellow color.🔽Some are like Locana, with a green color.

original: la la ni reg gi ngo bo lta bu rang gi mdog ljang gu dang ldan pa dang / de dag la sogs pa rang rang gi gzugs dang mdog la sogs pa ji ltar sbyor ba lta bur phyung ste gnas pa dang 'jug par bya'o zhes 'grub po //
analyzed: la la ni reg gi ngo bo lta bu rang gi mdog ljang gu dang ldan pa dang / de dag la sogs pa rang rang gi gzugs dang mdog la sogs pa ji ltar sbyor ba lta bur phyung ste gnas pa dang 'jug par bya'o zhes 'grub po //
translated: One should understand that they are produced and enter in accordance with their own forms, colors, etc.

original: de yang 'di skad du le'u bco brgyad @43a * //
analyzed: de yang 'di skad du le'u bco brgyad @43a * //
translated: This is stated in the eighteenth chapter of the Shriparamādya Tantra:

original: pa las / 'dod chags chen po'i tshul gyis ni //
analyzed: pa las / 'dod chags chen po'i tshul gyis ni //
translated: The second chapter of the Padma Tantra says:

original: ye shes 'khor lo'i kun bsdus nas //
analyzed: ye shes 'khor lo'i kun bsdus nas //
translated: Having gathered the wheel of exalted wisdom🔽by the method of great passion,

original: bud med rnam dgu sprul nas kyang //🔽bsgrub bya'i lus la dgod par bya //
analyzed: bud med rnam dgu sprul nas kyang // bsgrub bya'i lus la dgod par bya //
translated: having emanated the nine women,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: one should place them in the body of the practitioner.

original: da ni rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i phyir gdul bya rnams kyi don du de nas de bzhin gshegs pa mi bskyod pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i phyir gdul bya rnams kyi don du de nas de bzhin gshegs pa mi bskyod pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the purity, it says “then the Tathagatas Akshobya and so forth” for the sake of the disciples.

original: de la bha ga ni sa bon gyi gnas yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de la bha ga ni sa bon gyi gnas yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: There, bhaga is the place of the seed,

original: de dag gi bzhugs gnas te bud med kyi bha ga nyid do //
analyzed: de dag gi bzhugs gnas te bud med kyi bha ga nyid do //
translated: and so it is the abode of those, the bhaga of the woman.

original: gang dang yang 'brel pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang dang yang 'brel pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is related to something,

original: gcig la du mar mngon no //
analyzed: gcig la du mar mngon no //
translated: the one is manifest as many.

original: gong du rgyal ba rnams bzhugs ba rang gi sgo rnam byas nas byang chub kyi sems zla ba lta bu gnas nas phyung ba ni dam tshig chen po ste dkyil 'khor ni de las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gong du rgyal ba rnams bzhugs ba rang gi sgo rnam byas nas byang chub kyi sems zla ba lta bu gnas nas phyung ba ni dam tshig chen po ste dkyil 'khor ni de las gyur pa'o //
translated: The abode of the victors above is made by one’s own door, and the moon-like bodhicitta is placed and emitted from there. The great commitment is the mandala that arises from that.

original: mnyam pa dang khyab pa dang rgyas pa'i phyir na gru bzhi ste gsal ba yang de'i ngo bo nyid kyang de bas gsal ba'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa dang khyab pa dang rgyas pa'i phyir na gru bzhi ste gsal ba yang de'i ngo bo nyid kyang de bas gsal ba'i ngo bo ste /
translated: It is the nature of light because it is the nature of clarity.

original: rten nyid sgrib pa med cing ye shes kyis thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten nyid sgrib pa med cing ye shes kyis thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the support itself, unobstructed by obscurations and unimpeded by intuition.

original: mdzes pa'i kha dog la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni kho na nyid thob pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: mdzes pa'i kha dog la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni kho na nyid thob pa'i phyir na /
translated: It is beautiful because it possesses beautiful colors, etc.🔽It is the moon because it is the source of the light rays of intuition that are the cause of the arising of the various intuitions of the bodhisattvas.

original: sna tshogs gzugs kyis kun du khyab //🔽ces pa ste til 'bru bzhin du'o //🔽de bzhin du 'og tu yang sbyar ro //🔽de kho na'i 'od zer dgag pa dang gtong pa dang gnyig ma yin pa rgyun 'bab chu bo bzhin du gnas pa nyid kyi phyir 'od zer 'phro ba mang po 'khrug pa ste gsal ba ni zla ba ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs kyis kun du khyab // ces pa ste til 'bru bzhin du'o // de bzhin du 'og tu yang sbyar ro // de kho na'i 'od zer dgag pa dang gtong pa dang gnyig ma yin pa rgyun 'bab chu bo bzhin du gnas pa nyid kyi phyir 'od zer 'phro ba mang po 'khrug pa ste gsal ba ni zla ba ste /
translated: It is the sun because it is the source of the light rays of intuition that are the cause of the arising of the various mundane intuitions.🔽It is the cloud because it is the source of the light rays of intuition that are the cause of the arising of the various mundane and supramundane intuitions.🔽It is the rain because it is the source of the light rays of intuition that are the cause of the arising of the various mundane and supramundane intuitions.🔽It is the lightning because it is the source of the light rays of intuition that are the cause of the arising of the various mundane and supramundane intuitions.

original: nyi ma dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir na sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: nyi ma dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir na sogs pa smos so //
translated: It is the vajra because it is the source of the light rays of intuition that are the cause of the arising of the various mundane and supramundane intuitions.🔽It is the tree because it is the source of the light rays of intuition that are the cause of the arising of the various mundane and supramundane intuitions.🔽It is the wish-granting jewel because it is the source of the light rays of intuition that are the cause of the arising of the various mundane and supramundane intuitions.🔽It is the wish-fulfilling tree because it is the source of the light rays of intuition that are the cause of the arising of the various mundane and supramundane intuitions.🔽It is the bird because it is the source of the light rays of intuition that are the cause of the arising of the various mundane and supramundane intuitions.🔽It is the river because it is the source of the light rays of intuition that are the cause of the arising of the various mundane and supramundane intuitions.🔽It is the bridge because it is the source of the light rays of intuition that are the cause of the arising of the various mundane and supramundane intuitions.🔽It is the vehicle because it is the source of the light rays of intuition that are the cause of the arising of the various mundane and sup

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi gnas ni chos kyi dbyings te thams cad kyi bdag nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa gnas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi gnas ni chos kyi dbyings te thams cad kyi bdag nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa gnas so //
translated: The abode of all the Tathagatas is the Dharma-element, and the Lord of all is the Vajra-Holder.

original: ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i dkyil 'khor 'di bskyed pa'i rim pa las 'ongs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i dkyil 'khor 'di bskyed pa'i rim pa las 'ongs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This mandala which arises from concentration is not produced from the stage of creation.

original: phyag rgya bzhi dang ldan pa las bskyed pa ltar snang ba dang po'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sbyor ba'i mos pa'i dbang las grub pa bstan to //
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhi dang ldan pa las bskyed pa ltar snang ba dang po'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sbyor ba'i mos pa'i dbang las grub pa bstan to //
translated: It is taught as being accomplished by the power of the imagination of the yoga of the first Vajra-Holder, who appears to be produced from the four seals.

original: las dang po pa la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis kyang /
analyzed: las dang po pa la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis kyang /
translated: Even the yogis who are beginners and so forth

original: rang gi nye bar len pa'i rkyen sa bon 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor 'di bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi nye bar len pa'i rkyen sa bon 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor 'di bsam par bya'o //
translated: should imagine this mandala which arises from the seed-syllable which is their own substantial cause.

original: de'i don ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i don ni bzhi ste /
translated: The meaning of this is fourfold:

original: las dang po ba'i rnal 'byor pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la dang por gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa dam pa'i mchod pa brtsams nas /
analyzed: las dang po ba'i rnal 'byor pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la dang por gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa dam pa'i mchod pa brtsams nas /
translated: The yogi who is a beginner, having first begun the excellent worship of all the Tathagatas with Rupavajrā and so forth,

original: de la rgyal ba rnams @43b rjes su chags par bya ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la rgyal ba rnams @43b rjes su chags par bya ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the victors is to be attached to that.

original: ma 'ongs pa rgyu nas grol bar bya ba'i don du dbyings kyi nang gi gzhal yas khang brtsegs pa'i dbus na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rgyu nas grol bar bya ba'i don du dbyings kyi nang gi gzhal yas khang brtsegs pa'i dbus na /
translated: For the purpose of liberating the future from the cause, in the center of the celestial mansion of the dhātu,🔽the seed that appears as the mere essence of the deity is the substantial cause.

original: lha'i ngo bo nyid tsam snang ba'i sa bon de ni nye bar len pa'i rkyen yin pas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: lha'i ngo bo nyid tsam snang ba'i sa bon de ni nye bar len pa'i rkyen yin pas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Since it is the substantial cause, it should be cultivated.

original: ye shes 'ga' zhig dbang du byas pa'i rnal 'byor pas ni rgyu'i mtshams kyi nges pa'i dbang gis nye bar len pa'i rkyen de nyid sngon du byas par rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes 'ga' zhig dbang du byas pa'i rnal 'byor pas ni rgyu'i mtshams kyi nges pa'i dbang gis nye bar len pa'i rkyen de nyid sngon du byas par rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Since the yogi/nī who has mastered some gnosis understands that substantial cause by the power of the certainty of the juncture of the cause.

original: de ni gong dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de ni gong dang 'brel to //
translated: That is connected to above.

original: ye shes rnams dbang thob pa'i rnal 'byor pas ni sa bon de'i mthu las rgyu dang rgyu can du snang ba shin tu chags pa goms pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: ye shes rnams dbang thob pa'i rnal 'byor pas ni sa bon de'i mthu las rgyu dang rgyu can du snang ba shin tu chags pa goms pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The yogi/nī who has mastered gnosis, by the power of being accustomed to the appearance of the cause and the causal entity from the power of that seed,

original: sa bon las yig 'bru gsum sbyar nas /
analyzed: sa bon las yig 'bru gsum sbyar nas /
translated: having combined the seed with the three syllables,

original: don dang sems la dgag pa dang gtong ba byas te /
analyzed: don dang sems la dgag pa dang gtong ba byas te /
translated: having blocked the object and the mind,

original: skur bsgom ba la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: skur bsgom ba la brten pa yin no //
translated: The yoga of the seed is based on the meditation of the seed.

original: ye shes lhun gyis grub pa'i rnal 'byor pas ni sa bon de'i mthu las a'a li k'a li goms pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: ye shes lhun gyis grub pa'i rnal 'byor pas ni sa bon de'i mthu las a'a li k'a li goms pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The yoga of the spontaneous gnosis is based on the meditation of the seed, and is based on the power of that seed.

original: 'khor lo'i rgyun shin tu phra ba las ma gtogs pa spangs te bsgoms nas don bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'khor lo'i rgyun shin tu phra ba las ma gtogs pa spangs te bsgoms nas don bya ba yin te /
translated: Having abandoned the cultivation of the extremely subtle wheel-continuum, one should perform the aims.

original: skad cig ma re re'i sbyor ba la brten pa brtags pa ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma re re'i sbyor ba la brten pa brtags pa ste /
translated: The yoga of the moment is based on the application of each moment.

original: de bzhi ni mtshams sbrel ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhi ni mtshams sbrel ba'o //
translated: Those four are the connections.

original: ha cang spros pa mi dgos kyi gtang ngo //
analyzed: ha cang spros pa mi dgos kyi gtang ngo //
translated: It is enough to examine them, and not to elaborate too much.

original: da ni slob ma rnams gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du 'jug cing dbang bskur ba'i don tsam gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: da ni slob ma rnams gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du 'jug cing dbang bskur ba'i don tsam gsungs pa ni /
translated: Now, just the meaning of the initiation of the disciples entering the secret mandala is stated:

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa rnams kyis bstan to //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa rnams kyis bstan to //
translated: Then, etc.

original: bdag po de zhes pa ni rig ma dang bcas pa'i dkyil 'khor du dam tshig chen po nyid rnam par gnas so ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag po de zhes pa ni rig ma dang bcas pa'i dkyil 'khor du dam tshig chen po nyid rnam par gnas so ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That lord is the great commitment itself abiding in the mandala with the knowledge woman.

original: des ni slob ma rnams kyang gzhug pa'i las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: des ni slob ma rnams kyang gzhug pa'i las su rig par bya'o //
translated: By that, the activity of entering the disciples should be understood.

original: 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa'i sgo nas zhus pa'ang de nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa'i sgo nas zhus pa'ang de nyid do //
translated: The result is the complete perfection of the meaning of the question.

original: de nas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rnams kyis ni dbang bskur ba'i don bstan to //
analyzed: de nas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rnams kyis ni dbang bskur ba'i don bstan to //
translated: Then, Akshobhya and so forth teach the meaning of the consecration.

original: de la de dag gi don ni go sla bas so //
analyzed: de la de dag gi don ni go sla bas so //
translated: There, the meaning of those is easy to understand.

original: zhugs pa ni de ma thag pa'i rim pas h'um dang rdo rje la sogs pa ni thugs te de kho na la'o //
analyzed: zhugs pa ni de ma thag pa'i rim pas h'um dang rdo rje la sogs pa ni thugs te de kho na la'o //
translated: The entry is the stage of the immediately preceding, the mind of enlightenment, the vajra, and so forth, which is the mind of enlightenment.

original: dbang bskur ba ni tha ma'i don la shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba ni tha ma'i don la shes par bya'o //
translated: The consecration is to be understood in the ultimate sense.

original: da ni sku gsal bar bstan pa'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo thams cad kyi bdag nyid du de rnams gcig par gyur pa ni tshig gi don ni gnyis kyis ston te /
analyzed: da ni sku gsal bar bstan pa'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo thams cad kyi bdag nyid du de rnams gcig par gyur pa ni tshig gi don ni gnyis kyis ston te /
translated: Now, the result of the teaching of the clear form is the identity of all things, which is the oneness of those. The meaning of the words is taught by two.

original: de la byang chub kyi sems rdo rje ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dang dbang phyug la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i @44a * //
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi sems rdo rje ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dang dbang phyug la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i @44a * //
translated: There, the vajra of the mind of enlightenment is emptiness, compassion, sovereignty, and so forth.

original: phyir ro // mi rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid brda 'am tha snyad dang bral ba'i don la rtse gcig pa gang gis byed pa de'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: phyir ro // mi rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid brda 'am tha snyad dang bral ba'i don la rtse gcig pa gang gis byed pa de'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The samādhi of that one who is one-pointedly focused on the meaning free from symbols or conventions, the nature of non-conceptualization, is the vajra.

original: rdo rje ni de dang ldan pa'i don te de la zhugs so //
analyzed: rdo rje ni de dang ldan pa'i don te de la zhugs so //
translated: Vajra means endowed with that meaning, and he entered that.

original: zhugs ma thag tu de'i stobs kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: zhugs ma thag tu de'i stobs kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Immediately upon entering, by the power of that, what is it like?

original: thams cad kyi bdag nyid dang / nam mkha'i dbyings 'di mnyam par gyur pa'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad kyi bdag nyid dang / nam mkha'i dbyings 'di mnyam par gyur pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the entire nature of this realm of space is equalized.

original: de'i yon tan ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i yon tan ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: His qualities are mentioned with “Then, etc.”

original: de la de nas ni byin gyis brlab cing dbang bskur ba'i de ma thag go //
analyzed: de la de nas ni byin gyis brlab cing dbang bskur ba'i de ma thag go //
translated: There, then means immediately after the consecration and empowerment.

original: bud med kyi chos dbyings kyi nang na gzhal med khang brtsegs pa'i dbus na gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bud med kyi chos dbyings kyi nang na gzhal med khang brtsegs pa'i dbus na gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the goddess abides in the middle of the palace in the interior of the realm of space,

original: nam mkha'i dbyings na gnas pa smos so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings na gnas pa smos so //
translated: she is said to abide in the realm of space.

original: byin gyis brlabs ni glo bur gyi dbang gis ni ma yin gyi de kho na nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa'i dbang sngon du thob pas lus ngag bde ba dang yid bde ba thob par gyur to zhes so /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs ni glo bur gyi dbang gis ni ma yin gyi de kho na nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa'i dbang sngon du thob pas lus ngag bde ba dang yid bde ba thob par gyur to zhes so /
translated: The consecration is not by the power of adventitious [factors], but by the power of having previously obtained the consecration that enters into reality, [the consecration] that is the attainment of the bliss of body and speech and the bliss of mind.

original: de lta ma yin na thar pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thar pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that [the consecration] would be liberation itself.

original: / de dag gi don ni /
analyzed: / de dag gi don ni /
translated: The meaning of that [verse] is as follows:

original: bcu drug cha shas sde pa las byung gang ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dbus //
analyzed: bcu drug cha shas sde pa las byung gang ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dbus //
translated: The moon mandala, filled with the parts of the sixteen [vowels], is in the middle.

original: zhes pa'i nges pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i nges pa gsungs so //
translated: This is the definitive statement.

original: sgra yi ge dang yig 'bru las gyur pa'i zla ba rnam pa gnyis zhu ba'i ngo bo 'dir bstan pa med kyang stong pa nyid dang snying rjes phye ba'i byang chub sems kyi ngo bo rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sgra yi ge dang yig 'bru las gyur pa'i zla ba rnam pa gnyis zhu ba'i ngo bo 'dir bstan pa med kyang stong pa nyid dang snying rjes phye ba'i byang chub sems kyi ngo bo rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Although the two kinds of moon, which are the result of the syllables and the letters, are not taught here as the essence of the melting [bliss], the essence of the bodhicitta divided into emptiness and compassion is the vajra-holder.

original: de dag gi don brtags pa'i skabs dbye'o //
analyzed: de dag gi don brtags pa'i skabs dbye'o //
translated: The occasion of investigating their meaning is opened.

original: a'a:la sogs pa rnams kyis stong pa nyid kyi che ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: a'a:la sogs pa rnams kyis stong pa nyid kyi che ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: The greatness of emptiness is taught by the syllables A and so forth.

original: de dngos po rnams so sor 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dngos po rnams so sor 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the individual negation of entities.

original: des na brgyud pa'i rim pas rgyu'i dngos po bstan pa la gzhan dag ni zlog ba'i sgo nas ston te /
analyzed: des na brgyud pa'i rim pas rgyu'i dngos po bstan pa la gzhan dag ni zlog ba'i sgo nas ston te /
translated: Therefore, the causal entity is taught by the sequence of the lineage, and others are taught by the door of negation.
