original: aa yig la sogs pa'i sngon du rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyis de rnams gsal ba ni des dngos po rnams rab tu 'gog pa'i thabs kyi zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: aa yig la sogs pa'i sngon du rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyis de rnams gsal ba ni des dngos po rnams rab tu 'gog pa'i thabs kyi zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rgyu yin te /
translated: The emptiness of the nature of the vowels such as a and so on is the cause of the moon maṇḍala, which is the method of the negation of those entities.

original: gzhan dag gi zla ba brtsigs par byas pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi rkyen du mi nus pas na ka la sogs par snang ba ni de las gyur pa'i zla ba gnyis pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi zla ba brtsigs par byas pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi rkyen du mi nus pas na ka la sogs par snang ba ni de las gyur pa'i zla ba gnyis pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Since the moon constructed by others is not able to be the condition of emptiness by nature, the appearance as ka and so on is the cause of the second moon.

original: byang chub kyi sems snying rje'i bdag nyid de ltar ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems snying rje'i bdag nyid de ltar ro //
translated: The bodhicitta is the nature of compassion.

original: de ltar na de'i stobs kyis 'khor lor gsang ba'i bdag nyid kyis sems can gyi don bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na de'i stobs kyis 'khor lor gsang ba'i bdag nyid kyis sems can gyi don bya ba yin te /
translated: Thus, by its power, the activity for the benefit of sentient beings is performed by the lord of the secret in the maṇḍala.

original: don gzhan mthong ba med pa'i phyir na 'di nyid mthong @44b par mngon no //
analyzed: don gzhan mthong ba med pa'i phyir na 'di nyid mthong @44b par mngon no //
translated: Since there is no seeing of any other object, it is evident that this is seeing.

original: aa dang ka la sogs pa gsal ba las byung ba zla ba gnyis las gzhan du gyur pa'i rnam pa ni tshig gsum gyis bstan te /
analyzed: aa dang ka la sogs pa gsal ba las byung ba zla ba gnyis las gzhan du gyur pa'i rnam pa ni tshig gsum gyis bstan te /
translated: The aspect that arises from the manifestation of a and ka, which is different from the two moons, is indicated by the three words:

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then the Blessed One, etc.

original: de nas ni zla ba gnyis kyi de ma thag go //🔽sku gsung thugs rdo rje ni /
analyzed: de nas ni zla ba gnyis kyi de ma thag go // sku gsung thugs rdo rje ni /
translated: Then means immediately after the two moons.

original: ye shes kyi ngo bor mi phyed pa'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi ngo bor mi phyed pa'i phyir na'o //
translated: Vajra of body, speech, and mind is because of being indivisible in the nature of gnosis.🔽Vajra holder is because of being the source of the sameness that is difficult to surpass for all of them.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid de kun gyis 'da' bar dka' ba'i mnyam pa nyid de las 'byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid de kun gyis 'da' bar dka' ba'i mnyam pa nyid de las 'byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa ste /
translated: He entered into the samadhi that arose from that,

original: brtags pa'i dngos po la sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: brtags pa'i dngos po la sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: one-pointedness of mind on an imagined object.

original: des ni gong gi don rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des ni gong gi don rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is said because it is the knowledge of the meaning above.

original: skyes bu'i gzugs kyang de chen po yang de nyid pas de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: skyes bu'i gzugs kyang de chen po yang de nyid pas de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The form of a person is also that, and it is great, so it is called that.

original: rig pa ni rgyud dang las dang lta ba'i rig pa ste /
analyzed: rig pa ni rgyud dang las dang lta ba'i rig pa ste /
translated: Knowledge is the knowledge of tantra, action, and view.

original: de de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na sngags kyi bdag po'ang de kho na'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na sngags kyi bdag po'ang de kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the Lord of the Mantra is just that.

original: des na byin gyis brlabs so zhes te /
analyzed: des na byin gyis brlabs so zhes te /
translated: Therefore, he is blessed.

original: de de rnams kyi rkyen no //
analyzed: de de rnams kyi rkyen no //
translated: He is the condition of those.

original: byin gyis brlabs ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das gong du snyoms par zhugs pa de nyid rdo rje gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir zhal gsum pa lta bu ni dbus dang g-yas g-yon nag po dang dkar po dang dmar po rnams rim bzhin no //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das gong du snyoms par zhugs pa de nyid rdo rje gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir zhal gsum pa lta bu ni dbus dang g-yas g-yon nag po dang dkar po dang dmar po rnams rim bzhin no //
translated: Immediately after the blessing, the Blessed One, who had previously entered into meditative concentration, has three faces because he is endowed with the three vajras, with the middle one being black, the right one white, and the left one red, respectively.

original: de lta bur kun gyis gzigs par gyur to zhes so //
analyzed: de lta bur kun gyis gzigs par gyur to zhes so //
translated: Thus, he is seen by all.

original: las dang po pas sems bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: las dang po pas sems bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: Beginning with the generation of the mind of enlightenment by the beginner,

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ye shes brnyes kyi bar du thabs kyi rim pa grangs med pas ngo bo nyid kyi sku grub nas /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ye shes brnyes kyi bar du thabs kyi rim pa grangs med pas ngo bo nyid kyi sku grub nas /
translated: up to the attainment of the vajra-like pristine consciousness, the stage of method is accomplished by means of countless methods.

original: de'i byin rlabs las thun mong du thun mong ba des gzugs sku rnam pa gnyis 'od kyi 'du 'phro ltar byung ste /
analyzed: de'i byin rlabs las thun mong du thun mong ba des gzugs sku rnam pa gnyis 'od kyi 'du 'phro ltar byung ste /
translated: From the blessing of that, the two kinds of form bodies arise like the radiance of light.

original: thams cad du bsam pa'i dbang gis snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: thams cad du bsam pa'i dbang gis snang bar gyur to //
translated: Everything appears by the power of thought.

original: khyad par du mngon par byang chub pa'i sku lta bu thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi sku de chos kyi 'byung gnas kyi dkyil na sa bon gyi tshul du bzhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: khyad par du mngon par byang chub pa'i sku lta bu thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi sku de chos kyi 'byung gnas kyi dkyil na sa bon gyi tshul du bzhugs pa yin te /
translated: In particular, that body of the nature of the uncommon essence, which is like the body of manifest enlightenment, abides in the form of a seed in the center of the source of phenomena.

original: des snod du rung zhing dbang bskur ba dang rgyu nas sangs rgyas par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des snod du rung zhing dbang bskur ba dang rgyu nas sangs rgyas par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because it is the cause for becoming a buddha after becoming a suitable vessel through initiation.

original: de nyid 'og min du longs spyod chen po'i skus 'khor rnams thugs ka nas byung ste ched du brjod pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'og min du longs spyod chen po'i skus 'khor rnams thugs ka nas byung ste ched du brjod pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: That very [body] arises from the heart of the retinue in the Akaniṣṭha great enjoyment body and utters the utterance.

original: de rnams ni mtshams 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni mtshams 'brel pa'o //
translated: Those are the connected [sections].

original: de yan chad du dang po'i las kyi rim pa gsungs nas /
analyzed: de yan chad du dang po'i las kyi rim pa gsungs nas /
translated: Up to this point, having explained the stages of the first action,

original: da ni gleng bslang ba gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni gleng bslang ba gsungs te /
translated: now the introduction is explained.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa mi bskyod pa la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa mi bskyod pa la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Then the tathāgatas Akṣobhya and so on are mentioned.

original: de la de nas ni gzigs par gyur pa'i de ma thag go //
analyzed: de la de nas ni gzigs par gyur pa'i de ma thag go //
translated: There, “then” is immediately after the vision.

original: @45a * // sems can mi bskyod pa'i rgyu can te /
analyzed: @45a * // sems can mi bskyod pa'i rgyu can te /
translated: Sentient beings are the cause of Akṣobhya.

original: des sa bon gyis bskyed pas 'dir mi bskyod pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: des sa bon gyis bskyed pas 'dir mi bskyod pa gzung ngo //
translated: Since it is generated by the seed, it is Akṣobhya here.

original: gzhan dag la yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: It should be stated for the others as well.

original: de rnams gzhan gyi mthu las byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams gzhan gyi mthu las byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: They do not arise from the power of others.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni gtso bo la gnag ldan pa de thams cad la de dang de ltar ro //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni gtso bo la gnag ldan pa de thams cad la de dang de ltar ro //
translated: The “etc.” refers to all of those, in that way, in the principal one and in the one endowed with the black.

original: 'og gi don brjod pa ni phyung bas so //
analyzed: 'og gi don brjod pa ni phyung bas so //
translated: The meaning below is stated by the extraction.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: rig pa'i dbyings las so //
analyzed: rig pa'i dbyings las so //
translated: From the sphere of awareness.

original: des ni ae ma ho zhes pa ni dam zhing ngo mtshar te /
analyzed: des ni ae ma ho zhes pa ni dam zhing ngo mtshar te /
translated: “Amazing!” is the pledge and the wonder.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: 'og gi don to //
analyzed: 'og gi don to //
translated: The meaning below.

original: bsam pa'i dbang gis gzugs sna tshogs par rab tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: bsam pa'i dbang gis gzugs sna tshogs par rab tu byung ba'o //
translated: It is the arising of various forms by the power of thought.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir sbas te gsang ba'o //🔽mi rtogs gnas med pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir sbas te gsang ba'o // mi rtogs gnas med pa'o //
translated: It is hidden and secret because it is not common.🔽It is not realized and has no location.

original: mi rtogs gnas med pa'o zhes pa /
analyzed: mi rtogs gnas med pa'o zhes pa /
translated: “It is not realized and has no location”

original: rigs pa ma yin pa'i dpag pa dang / mngon sum pas rtogs par dka' bas so //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin pa'i dpag pa dang / mngon sum pas rtogs par dka' bas so //
translated: means that it is difficult to realize by means of illogical inference and direct perception.

original: de dag ni skal ba dang ldan pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: de dag ni skal ba dang ldan pa ma yin pas so //
translated: Those are not fortunate.

original: de ni skal ba dang ldan pa'i dbang du byas te zhu ba sngon du gtong ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni skal ba dang ldan pa'i dbang du byas te zhu ba sngon du gtong ba'i don to //
translated: That is the meaning of the request that is put forward in terms of the fortunate ones.

original: de la 'ang gnyis te /
analyzed: de la 'ang gnyis te /
translated: That also has two parts:

original: sbyor ba dang / tshig go //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang / tshig go //
translated: the preparation and the words.

original: de dag ni de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pa rnams kyis bstan to //
analyzed: de dag ni de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pa rnams kyis bstan to //
translated: Those are taught by the passage beginning with “Then the Blessed One…”

original: gcig tu 'dus nas zhes pa tshul dang dgongs pa gcig tu gyur pa rnams so //
analyzed: gcig tu 'dus nas zhes pa tshul dang dgongs pa gcig tu gyur pa rnams so //
translated: “Having gathered together” means those who have become of one mind and one intention.

analyzed: byung ba ni gong gi sa bon no //

original: des ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: des ni 'di skad du /

analyzed: sgrub pa po gzhan lta ci smos zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de kho na nyid nyan pa'i skal pa dang ldan par mdzod cig ces bskul ba'i phyir /

translated: He entered the meditative stabilization called “Vajra-like” and arose from it.

original: de la dam tshig dgug pa ni phrag dog gi ste /
analyzed: de la dam tshig dgug pa ni phrag dog gi ste /
translated: The summoning of the commitments is jealousy.

original: de la 'ang gnyis te /
analyzed: de la 'ang gnyis te /

original: 'di dang pha rol gyi'o //
analyzed: 'di dang pha rol gyi'o //
translated: this-worldly and other-worldly.

original: de la 'di'i ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la sems khong nas 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'di'i ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la sems khong nas 'khrug pa'o //
translated: The this-worldly is the mental disturbance of the heart with regard to the good fortune of others.

original: pha rol gyi ni de dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: pha rol gyi ni de dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
translated: The other-worldly is the opposite of that.

original: de ni gnyis su med pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: de ni gnyis su med pa'i don yin te /
translated: That is the meaning of nonduality,

original: snying rje chen po las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rje chen po las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises from great compassion.

original: de ni tshe dpag med kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: de ni tshe dpag med kyi rgyu'o //
translated: That is the cause of Amitāyus.

original: rigs la sogs pa rnams ni sngon du brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa rnams ni sngon du brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: The families and so forth are as stated previously.

original: pradzny'a dhrika ces pa rnam shes rab tu gsal byed pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams gsungs te /
analyzed: pradzny'a dhrika ces pa rnam shes rab tu gsal byed pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams gsungs te /
translated: [The mantra] prajñādhṛk is the one that states the words “the one who illuminates consciousness” and so forth.

original: byams pa dang snying rje la sogs pa rnam par goms pa'i rab tu gsal bas byed pa'i rnam par shes pa gang bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi ngo bo de shes rab ces su bshad /

translated: The consciousness that is the agent, which is the essence of the gnosis of performance, is explained as “wisdom,” because it is very clear due to being thoroughly familiar with love, compassion, and so forth.

original: de 'dzin pas na 'du byed kyi sems kyi rnam par dag pa'i sems ni de skad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de 'dzin pas na 'du byed kyi sems kyi rnam par dag pa'i sems ni de skad ces gsungs so //
translated: Since it holds that, the mind of the pure mind of the compositional mind is said to be that.

original: de'i yon tan gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i yon tan gsungs pa /
translated: His qualities are stated:

original: de nas 'di phyung ma thag tu zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas 'di phyung ma thag tu zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, as soon as this was uttered, etc.

original: @48a * // bzhugs zhes pa dang / gong bzhin 'brel to //
analyzed: @48a * // bzhugs zhes pa dang / gong bzhin 'brel to //
translated: “Abiding” is connected as above.

original: thabs kyi zhes pa dang / tshul du zhes pa yang de dang de ltar ro //
analyzed: thabs kyi zhes pa dang / tshul du zhes pa yang de dang de ltar ro //
translated: “Method” and “manner” are also like that.

original: gzhan dag ni gong bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gong bzhin no //
translated: The others are as above.

original: de nyid kho na'i rig ma dang ldan pas na sbyor ba'i zhes so //
analyzed: de nyid kho na'i rig ma dang ldan pas na sbyor ba'i zhes so //
translated: Since he is endowed with the knowledge consort of reality itself, he is “united.”

original: zhal dbus dang g-yas g-yon gyi zhal ni ljang gu dang dkar po dang nag po ni gong ma bzhin rim pa bzhin sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhal dbus dang g-yas g-yon gyi zhal ni ljang gu dang dkar po dang nag po ni gong ma bzhin rim pa bzhin sbyar ro //
translated: The central face and the right and left faces are green, white, and black, respectively, as above.

original: da ni mjug bsdu ba gsungs pa ni zhe sdang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni mjug bsdu ba gsungs pa ni zhe sdang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the summary is stated: “Hatred, etc.”

original: 'dir nyon mongs pa lnga'i rigs la sogs pa 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir nyon mongs pa lnga'i rigs la sogs pa 'dod pa yin te /
translated: Here, the five afflictions are asserted to be the families, etc.

original: grol ba zhes pa de rnams rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grol ba zhes pa de rnams rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Liberation” is because of their purification.

original: 'dod pa yang de ste sgrub pa ni thabs te gnyi ga la snyeg go //
analyzed: 'dod pa yang de ste sgrub pa ni thabs te gnyi ga la snyeg go //
translated: “Desired” is that, and “accomplishment” is the means, both of which are sought.

original: de dag gi don ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de dag gi don ni 'di skad du /
translated: The meaning of those is as follows.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can dang / rigs ldan ma gtogs pa 'di rnams kyis /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can dang / rigs ldan ma gtogs pa 'di rnams kyis /
translated: Except for the one who has the nature of method and wisdom and the one who has the family, these

analyzed: zhe sdang la sogs pa'i dngos po de dang de las gyur pa don nyid kyis 'grub par byed do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: accomplish the very purpose of those things that are hatred, etc.

analyzed: lha mo rnams dbyung ba bstan pa'i phyir de nas yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: de la rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid mnyes pa'i dam tshig ni m'a ma k'is so //
analyzed: de la rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid mnyes pa'i dam tshig ni m'a ma k'is so //
translated: There, the pledge of pleasing Vajradhara is by Māmakī.

original: de la bzhugs te phyung ngo zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de la bzhugs te phyung ngo zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: It is connected with “residing there, he brought forth.”

original: dve sha ra ti ni de la phan tshun thug pa ni /
analyzed: dve sha ra ti ni de la phan tshun thug pa ni /
translated: Dveṣa-rāṭ

original: zhe sdang zhes ni bstan pa yin //
analyzed: zhe sdang zhes ni bstan pa yin //
translated: is taught to be “hatred” due to mutual contact.

original: zhes te / gang phan tshun thug pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bor /
analyzed: zhes te / gang phan tshun thug pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bor /
translated: That is, in the essence of the nondual gnosis of mutual contact,🔽that is hatred,

original: de ni zhe sdang ste /
analyzed: de ni zhe sdang ste /
translated: dveṣa.

original: dve sha'o // rnam pa gcig tu ni /
analyzed: dve sha'o // rnam pa gcig tu ni /
translated: In one aspect,

original: dbang bskur ba'i dus su m'a ma k'i bsgoms nas rdo rje dang padmor thug pa ni dvesha'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i dus su m'a ma k'i bsgoms nas rdo rje dang padmor thug pa ni dvesha'o //
translated: at the time of empowerment, having meditated on Māmakī, the contact of the vajra and lotus is dveṣa.

original: de las gyur pa gsungs pa ni de nas de zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de las gyur pa gsungs pa ni de nas de zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The arising from that is stated by “then that” and so forth.

original: bud med kyi gzugs 'dzin pa ni mi bskyod pa nyid de /
analyzed: bud med kyi gzugs 'dzin pa ni mi bskyod pa nyid de /
translated: The form of a woman is Akṣobhya himself.

original: mkha'i nang gi grva gang la m'a ma k'i la sogs pa gnas pa'i grva rnams te /
analyzed: mkha'i nang gi grva gang la m'a ma k'i la sogs pa gnas pa'i grva rnams te /
translated: The corners of the sky are the corners where Māmakī and so forth reside.

original: 'di ni me mtshams kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di ni me mtshams kho na ste /
translated: This is the southeast corner itself.

original: de la gnas so ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la gnas so ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the meaning of “resides there.”

original: spyan ma bstan pa'i phyir de nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: spyan ma bstan pa'i phyir de nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach Locanā, “then that” and so forth is stated.

original: de la mnyes par byed pa zhes pa ni spyan ma ste /
analyzed: de la mnyes par byed pa zhes pa ni spyan ma ste /
translated: There, “pleasing” is Locanā.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: rnam par snang mdzad de nyid la'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad de nyid la'o //
translated: In the very Vairocana.

original: gzhan dag ni sngon du byas pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni sngon du byas pa ste /
translated: The others are done previously.

original: go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: Since they are easy to understand, they are not explained.

original: mo ha ra ti zhes pa /
analyzed: mo ha ra ti zhes pa /
translated: Moharatî

original: gnyis med chos kyi ye shes la //
analyzed: gnyis med chos kyi ye shes la //
translated: In the nondual gnosis of the Dharma,

original: phyi rol nga rgyal rmongs zhes pa //
analyzed: phyi rol nga rgyal rmongs zhes pa //
translated: delusion is the pride of the external self.

original: zhes te / chos nyid kyis gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo rnams la gang nga rgyal gyi ngo bo nyid du rmongs pa de gti mug phyogs med pa ni mo ha zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes te / chos nyid kyis gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo rnams la gang nga rgyal gyi ngo bo nyid du rmongs pa de gti mug phyogs med pa ni mo ha zhes gsungs so //
translated: In the nature of the nondual gnosis of reality, delusion is the nature of pride itself. That is the nonpartisan delusion, which is called moha.

original: @48b rnam pa gcig tu dbang bskur ba'i dus su /
analyzed: @48b rnam pa gcig tu dbang bskur ba'i dus su /
translated: In one way, at the time of consecration,

original: tshigs su bcad pa dang mthun par spyan ma bsgoms nas /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa dang mthun par spyan ma bsgoms nas /
translated: having meditated on Locanâ in accordance with the verse,

original: rig ma 'khyud pa la sogs pa bsgoms na mo ha zhe'o //
analyzed: rig ma 'khyud pa la sogs pa bsgoms na mo ha zhe'o //
translated: meditating on the embrace of the knowledge woman, etc. is moha.

original: lho'i grva zhes pa ni bden bral gyi'o //
analyzed: lho'i grva zhes pa ni bden bral gyi'o //
translated: The south corner is that of the Rakshasas.

original: gos dkar mo gsungs pa ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gos dkar mo gsungs pa ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Pândarâ is declared in the words beginning with “then. ”

original: de la chags par byed pa ni gos dkar mo ste /
analyzed: de la chags par byed pa ni gos dkar mo ste /
translated: There, the one who causes passion is Pândarâ,

original: snang ba mtha' yas nyid la de de dang 'dra bas so //
analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas nyid la de de dang 'dra bas so //
translated: because she is similar to Amitâbha.

original: gzhan la'ang de bzhin sbyar ro //🔽r'a ga ra ti ni /
analyzed: gzhan la'ang de bzhin sbyar ro // r'a ga ra ti ni /
translated: Apply the same to the others.🔽Rāgārati

original: mtshan nyid 'dod chags kun zhen pa //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'dod chags kun zhen pa //
translated: is the nature of attachment to the characteristic.

original: zhes te / gang mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid de kho na 'dod chags de ni r'a ga zhes so ;
analyzed: zhes te / gang mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid de kho na 'dod chags de ni r'a ga zhes so ;
translated: That which is the nature of the nondual nature of the bearer of the characteristic is just attachment, and that is rāga.

original: / rnam pa gcig tu na bde ba chen po'i mtshan nyid la chags nas zhal sbyor ba la sogs pa 'dod chags so //
analyzed: / rnam pa gcig tu na bde ba chen po'i mtshan nyid la chags nas zhal sbyor ba la sogs pa 'dod chags so //
translated: In one way, having attachment to the characteristic of great bliss, it is attachment to the union, and so on.

original: nub kyi grvar zhes ba rlung gi mtshams so //
analyzed: nub kyi grvar zhes ba rlung gi mtshams so //
translated: In the western corner means in the southwest.

original: sgrol ma bstan pa'i phyir de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sgrol ma bstan pa'i phyir de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: In order to teach Tārā, it says “then” and so on.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa ni gdon mi za bar grub pa'o //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa ni gdon mi za bar grub pa'o //
translated: There, the tathāgata is certainly accomplished.

original: slu ba rdo rje zhes pa bdag po dang 'dra bas de nyid la chags par byed pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: slu ba rdo rje zhes pa bdag po dang 'dra bas de nyid la chags par byed pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The one called “the deceiving vajra” is like the lord, and that is the nature of attachment.

original: mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje ste /
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje ste /
translated: It is a vajra because it is indivisible.

original: de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te 'di byung ngo zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te 'di byung ngo zhes 'brel to //
translated: Having entered into such a samādhi, this arose.

original: 'di dag ni gong du snyegs so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni gong du snyegs so //
translated: These are to be understood as above.

original: badzra ra ti ni /
analyzed: badzra ra ti ni /
translated: vajra ratna

original: ye shes 'di ni rdo rje'o //
analyzed: ye shes 'di ni rdo rje'o //
translated: This knowledge is the vajra.

original: zhes te / de la gang de nyid dbyer med pa'i ngo bo ye shes de ni badzra zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes te / de la gang de nyid dbyer med pa'i ngo bo ye shes de ni badzra zhes gsungs so //
translated: There, that knowledge which is the nature of the indivisibility of those [vajra and ratna] is called vajra.

original: de bzhin la mtha' na ra ti'i sgra sbyor bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin la mtha' na ra ti'i sgra sbyor bar shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the word ratna is applied at the end in the same way.

original: rnam pa gcig tu sgrol ma bsgoms nas /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu sgrol ma bsgoms nas /
translated: In one aspect, having meditated on Tara,

original: byang chub kyi bde ba rig pa ni rdo rje'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi bde ba rig pa ni rdo rje'o //
translated: the knowledge of the bliss of enlightenment is the vajra.

original: de las gyur pa ni de phyung ma thag tu zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de las gyur pa ni de phyung ma thag tu zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: That which arises from that is the one who has just emerged, and so forth.

original: gyur te bzhugs so shes pa dang 'brel to ;
analyzed: gyur te bzhugs so shes pa dang 'brel to ;
translated: Having arisen, she abides—this is connected with the knowledge.

original: / byang phyogs kyi grva zhes pa dbang ldan gyi mtshams so //
analyzed: / byang phyogs kyi grva zhes pa dbang ldan gyi mtshams so //
translated: The northeast corner is the northeast.

original: btsun mo'i mchog phun sum tshogs pa ni /
analyzed: btsun mo'i mchog phun sum tshogs pa ni /
translated: The supreme queen is the perfection of women.

original: bud med bde mchog phun sum tshogs pa zhes ba ste /
analyzed: bud med bde mchog phun sum tshogs pa zhes ba ste /
translated: The perfection of supreme bliss is the perfection of women.

original: mo ha ra ti la sogs pa de dag kho na mchog gi bde ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir na bde ba'i mchog ste /
analyzed: mo ha ra ti la sogs pa de dag kho na mchog gi bde ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir na bde ba'i mchog ste /
translated: Those very ones, such as moha ratna, are supreme bliss because they are the cause of supreme bliss.

original: de nyid phun sum tshogs par gsungs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid phun sum tshogs par gsungs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are said to be perfect just as they are.

original: de dag gi don bshad pa ni mi dgos kyis btang ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi don bshad pa ni mi dgos kyis btang ngo //
translated: The meaning of those is not necessary to explain; let it go.

original: de dag gi sngags rnams ni spyan drangs pa'i don te /
analyzed: de dag gi sngags rnams ni spyan drangs pa'i don te /
translated: Their mantras are for the purpose of summoning,

original: de'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi lha nyid du mngon no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi lha nyid du mngon no //
translated: and therefore they are recognized as the deities of the maṇḍala.

original: de dag gi khro bo rnams dbyung ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de dag gi khro bo rnams dbyung ba gsungs pa /
translated: The wrathful ones of those are taught to emerge.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽de la 'khor @49a * //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o // de la 'khor @49a * //
translated: Then, etc.

original: lo zhes pa sa bon las gyur pa ste /
analyzed: lo zhes pa sa bon las gyur pa ste /
translated: There, the wheel is arisen from the seed.

original: de ltar gang gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs nas byung ngo zhes so //
analyzed: de ltar gang gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs nas byung ngo zhes so //
translated: Having entered into that samādhi, he emerged.

original: de'i dkyil 'khor ni sku'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: de'i dkyil 'khor ni sku'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: His maṇḍala is the maṇḍala of body,

original: rnam par snang mdzad du mngon no //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad du mngon no //
translated: and he is recognized as Vairocana.

original: khro bo zhes pa ni ngang gis dang shugs kyis khro ba dang kho bor bcos ba dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: khro bo zhes pa ni ngang gis dang shugs kyis khro ba dang kho bor bcos ba dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Wrathful is naturally and spontaneously wrathful, and is endowed with a fabricated self.

original: rig ma dang ldan pa las gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rig ma dang ldan pa las gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it arises from the knowledge consort,

original: de nyid byin gyis rlob pa'i zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid byin gyis rlob pa'i zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: it is the consecration of that.

original: de bzhin sbyar te gzhan dag ni go sla bas so //
analyzed: de bzhin sbyar te gzhan dag ni go sla bas so //
translated: The others are easy to understand.

original: ya m'anta krita ces pa /
analyzed: ya m'anta krita ces pa /
translated: YAMĀNTAKRĪT

original: rnam par mi 'jig bdag nyid chos //
analyzed: rnam par mi 'jig bdag nyid chos //
translated: The Dharma is the nature of non-destruction.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi gsungs te /
translated: And so on, he spoke these four lines.

original: lus tshor ba sems dang chos rnams kyi du ma med pa la sogs pa'i yul rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis mi skye ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: lus tshor ba sems dang chos rnams kyi du ma med pa la sogs pa'i yul rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis mi skye ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: Because the objects of the body, feelings, mind, and dharmas are not multiple, and so on, and their nature is not inherently produced,

original: rnam par mi 'jig bdag nyid chos //
analyzed: rnam par mi 'jig bdag nyid chos //
translated: The Dharma is the nature of non-destruction.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: This is what is said.

original: kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kho na 'jig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽de yang dngos po kun zhes pa lus la sogs pa rnams kyi 'jig pa med pa'i dam tshig ste /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kho na 'jig pa nyid kyi phyir ro // de yang dngos po kun zhes pa lus la sogs pa rnams kyi 'jig pa med pa'i dam tshig ste /
translated: Because only the imagined nature is destroyed.

original: lus la sogs pa la gtogs pa'i du ma med pa nyid las ji ltar sbyar bar bya ba'i yul la dad pa rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin de ni ya m'anta krita do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa la gtogs pa'i du ma med pa nyid las ji ltar sbyar bar bya ba'i yul la dad pa rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin de ni ya m'anta krita do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, the pledge of the non-destruction of all things, the body and so on, is from the non-multiplicity belonging to the body and so on. The object to which one should apply oneself is the nature of pure faith. That is Yamāntakṛt.

original: de ci'i phyir phyin ci log pa ni gshin rje'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir phyin ci log pa ni gshin rje'o //
translated: Why is that? The inverted is Yama.

original: de'i mthar phyin pa ni med pa zhes par mngon no//
analyzed: de'i mthar phyin pa ni med pa zhes par mngon no//
translated: The completion of that is clearly “non-existence.”

original: de las gyur pa ni phyung ma thag tu la sogs pa ste bzhugs so zhes so //
analyzed: de las gyur pa ni phyung ma thag tu la sogs pa ste bzhugs so zhes so //
translated: “Arisen from that” is “just arisen,” and so on, and “abides.”

original: bsnyengs par byed pa ni de kho na ste /
analyzed: bsnyengs par byed pa ni de kho na ste /
translated: “Terrifying” is just that,

original: sems can rnams 'dul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams 'dul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of subduing sentient beings.

original: de ni shar gyi sgor zhes so //
analyzed: de ni shar gyi sgor zhes so //
translated: That is the eastern door.

original: rnam par rgyal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rgyal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the Victorious One,

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says “then,” and so on.

original: de la mngon par byang chub pa zhes pa ni rang gi rigs kyi gtso bo mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: de la mngon par byang chub pa zhes pa ni rang gi rigs kyi gtso bo mi bskyod pa ste /
translated: There, “manifest enlightenment” is the chief of one’s own family, Akṣhobhya.

original: de nyid dbyer med pas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la'o //
analyzed: de nyid dbyer med pas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la'o //
translated: Since that is indivisible, it is the vajra-like meditative stabilization.

original: de'i dkyil 'khor ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor te mi bskyod par mngon no //
analyzed: de'i dkyil 'khor ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor te mi bskyod par mngon no //
translated: His maṇḍala is the mind maṇḍala, which is clearly Akṣhobhya.

original: gzhan dag ni gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gong ma bzhin no //
translated: The others are as before.

original: bradzny'anta krita ces pa /🔽rnam par mi shes bdag nyid chos //
analyzed: bradzny'anta krita ces pa / rnam par mi shes bdag nyid chos //
translated: He says “vajra-jñāna-kṛta,”

original: zhes pa la sogs pa bzhi gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa bzhi gsungs te /
translated: and so on, and the four verses beginning🔽“The nature of non-consciousness” and so on.

original: yi ge dam pas ngo bos rnam par dag pa nyid pas chos shin tu rgyas pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yi ge dam pas ngo bos rnam par dag pa nyid pas chos shin tu rgyas pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The supreme syllable is the nature of the pure essence itself, and so is not the nature of grasping the identity of the extremely vast Dharma.

original: de 'dra ba'i thams cad sems kyi dam tshig gang yin pa de ni pradzny'anta krita gtso zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i thams cad sems kyi dam tshig gang yin pa de ni pradzny'anta krita gtso zhes gsungs so //
translated: That pledge of mind, which is like that, is said to be the chief Prajñāntakṛt.

original: ci'i phyir 'byung ba'i skyon @49b med pa'i phyir dang / ma byung ba'i skyon mi skyed par byed pa dang / de ltar phan pa'i don ma skyes pa skyed par byed pa'i don dang / skyes pa gnas pa rnams la dad pa dang ldan pa gang /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'byung ba'i skyon @49b med pa'i phyir dang / ma byung ba'i skyon mi skyed par byed pa dang / de ltar phan pa'i don ma skyes pa skyed par byed pa'i don dang / skyes pa gnas pa rnams la dad pa dang ldan pa gang /
translated: Because of the absence of the fault of arising, because of the non-production of the fault of non-arising, and because of the production of the benefit of the non-arisen, and because of the faith in the abiding of the arisen,

original: brtson 'grus rnam pa bzhi po des rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo rgyal ba kho nas shes rab mthar phyin zhes te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rnam pa bzhi po des rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo rgyal ba kho nas shes rab mthar phyin zhes te /
translated: that Victor, whose nature is pure by means of those four kinds of effort, is said to have perfected wisdom.

original: de 'dra ba'i shes rab kyi skyon kho na mthar phyin pa'i tha tshig gi phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i shes rab kyi skyon kho na mthar phyin pa'i tha tshig gi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the meaning of the perfection of just that wisdom, which is like that.

original: de ni lho'i sgor zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ni lho'i sgor zhes pa'i don to //
translated: That is the meaning of the southern gate.

original: rta mgrin bstan pa'i phyir de nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rta mgrin bstan pa'i phyir de nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to explain Hayagriva, he states, “Then, etc.”

original: chos zhes pa snang ba mtha' yas kyi tshul gyis zhugs zhes so //
analyzed: chos zhes pa snang ba mtha' yas kyi tshul gyis zhugs zhes so //
translated: “ Dharma” means that he is engaged in the manner of Amitabha.

original: gang la zhe na mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams 'byung ba'i phyir rin po che 'byung gnas de la'o //
analyzed: gang la zhe na mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams 'byung ba'i phyir rin po che 'byung gnas de la'o //
translated: Where? In the source of jewels, because the qualities of the superknowledges, etc. arise.

original: dkyil 'khor ni gsung gi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ni gsung gi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The mandala is the mandala of speech.

original: snang ba mtha' yas yin pa nyid kyi phyir na 'dod chags 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas yin pa nyid kyi phyir na 'dod chags 'chang ba'o //
translated: He is the bearer of passion because he is Amitabha.

original: gzhan ni sngon du byas so //
analyzed: gzhan ni sngon du byas so //
translated: The rest has been done previously.

original: padm'anta krita ces pa ni /
analyzed: padm'anta krita ces pa ni /
translated: Padmantaka means

original: brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid chos zhes pa la sogs pa rnams gsungs te /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid chos zhes pa la sogs pa rnams gsungs te /
translated: “the inexpressible nature of dharma,” etc.

original: don dam par de kho na nyid la gdags par mi nus pa'i phyir na tshogs thams cad brjod du med do //
analyzed: don dam par de kho na nyid la gdags par mi nus pa'i phyir na tshogs thams cad brjod du med do //
translated: All the assemblies are inexpressible because ultimately they cannot be designated in reality.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na ming dang gzugs blo zhes te ming la sogs par so sor snang ba'i blo yi ngo bo med de don dam par yul la ngo bo med do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na ming dang gzugs blo zhes te ming la sogs par so sor snang ba'i blo yi ngo bo med de don dam par yul la ngo bo med do //
translated: Therefore, the nature of the mind that appears as the individual objects of name and form does not exist, because ultimately the object does not exist.

original: de 'dra ba'i chos thams cad kyi dam tshig gang yin pa padm'anta krita gtso zhes so //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i chos thams cad kyi dam tshig gang yin pa padm'anta krita gtso zhes so //
translated: That is the pledge of all phenomena, which is the chief Padmantaka.

original: ci'i phyir brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid kyi phung po'i yul la bdun pa dang brod pa la sogs pa dran pa brtson 'grus dang sbyor ba'i rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa de nyid don dam pa'i chos la mos pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa la
analyzed: ci'i phyir brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid kyi phung po'i yul la bdun pa dang brod pa la sogs pa dran pa brtson 'grus dang sbyor ba'i rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa de nyid don dam pa'i chos la mos pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa la
translated: Why is it so? The yogi/nī who is endowed with mindfulness of the seven limbs, etc., in the object of the aggregates, which is the nature of the inexpressible, in order to generate the faith in the ultimate Dharma,

original: sogs pa'i yul dran pa 'di padma'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i yul dran pa 'di padma'o //
translated: is mindful of the object of aspiration, etc., which is the lotus.

original: de nyid 'dun pa la sogs pa de dag gi skyon kho na mthar phyin par byed pas padm'anta krita ces so //
analyzed: de nyid 'dun pa la sogs pa de dag gi skyon kho na mthar phyin par byed pas padm'anta krita ces so //
translated: That very one is Padmantaka, because he/she perfects the faults of those aspirations, etc.

original: de ni nub kyi skor zhe'o //
analyzed: de ni nub kyi skor zhe'o //
translated: That is the western circle.

analyzed: da ni las thams cad pas gsungs pa de nas zhes yir byin gyis rlob pa la sogs pa ste /

original: de la mi bskyod pa'i tshul gyis thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de la mi bskyod pa'i tshul gyis thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir /
translated: There, by the method of Akṣhobhya, because of being the nature of all,

analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes de nyid dbyer med pa'i rdo rje ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas phyung ngo zhes 'brel to //
translated: that very gnosis of the dharmadhātu, indivisible from him, enters into equipoise in the vajra samādhi and is emitted.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
translated: All tathāgatas are Vairochana and so forth.

analyzed: dkyil 'khor ni de rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi'o //
translated: The maṇḍala is their body, speech, and mind.

analyzed: de byin gyis rlob pa ni gong ma nyid kyis @50a * //
translated: That consecration is by the one above.🔽For the sake of the yogi/nī, those [deities] summon, induct, bind, and control their own actions.🔽The one who is addressed by the all-activity mantra is the one who is consecrated, and so forth.

analyzed: te ; de rnams kyis rnal 'byor pa'i don du rang rang gi las dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bsdam pa dang / bcing ba rnams so zhes so // bi ghanta krita ces pa ni /
translated: There, by the method of Akṣhobhya, because of being the nature of all,

analyzed: rnam par mi rtog bdag nyid chos //
translated: that very gnosis of the dharmadhātu, indivisible from him, enters into equipoise in the vajra samādhi and is emitted.🔽All tathāgatas are Vairochana and so forth.🔽The maṇḍala is their body, speech, and mind.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i shlo ka gcig gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i shlo ka gcig gsungs te /

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni rang bzhin kho nas zhi ba nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni rang bzhin kho nas zhi ba nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: Non-conceptuality is by nature just peace.

original: gzung ba la sogs pa'i rtog pa med pa /
analyzed: gzung ba la sogs pa'i rtog pa med pa /
translated: It is without the concepts of object, etc.

original: phung po lnga la sogs pa'i rdo rje kun gyi dam tshig mi 'da' ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de'i ngo bor bgegs mthar phyin zhes so //
analyzed: phung po lnga la sogs pa'i rdo rje kun gyi dam tshig mi 'da' ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de'i ngo bor bgegs mthar phyin zhes so //
translated: It is the nature of the commitment of all vajras, such as the five aggregates, etc.

original: ci'i phyir gong du gsungs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i chos rnams la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gong du gsungs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i chos rnams la /
translated: Why is it that the phenomena of conceptuality, which were mentioned above,

original: dran pa dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i rang gi sems rtse gcig pa'i ngo bo'i ting nge 'dzin /
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i rang gi sems rtse gcig pa'i ngo bo'i ting nge 'dzin /
translated: are the cause of the wisdom that observes the true reality, the samadhi of the single-pointed nature of one's mind, which is possessed by the yogi who has mindfulness?

original: yang dag pa'i de kho na nyid dmigs pa'i shes rab kyi rgyur gyur pa gang yin pa des rnam par dag pa ngo bo tha mi dad pa la sogs pa'i bgegs mthar phyin par byed bas na bighn'a ntra krita gtso zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: yang dag pa'i de kho na nyid dmigs pa'i shes rab kyi rgyur gyur pa gang yin pa des rnam par dag pa ngo bo tha mi dad pa la sogs pa'i bgegs mthar phyin par byed bas na bighn'a ntra krita gtso zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it is the cause of the wisdom that observes the true reality, it is the chief of the obstructions to the nature of non-differentiation, etc., which are pure.

original: / don de dag gi ha cang spros pa gzhag go //
analyzed: / don de dag gi ha cang spros pa gzhag go //
translated: I will not elaborate too much on these points.

original: gzhan dag ni gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gong ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as above.

original: de ni byang gi sgro zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang gi sgro zhes pa yin no //
translated: That is the northern needle.

original: de dag gi don ni 'di skad du brtson 'grus la sogs pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byas te de dag gis rang gi las su byed do //
analyzed: de dag gi don ni 'di skad du brtson 'grus la sogs pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byas te de dag gis rang gi las su byed do //
translated: The meaning of those is as follows: By means of effort and so forth, one should practice the applications of mindfulness and so forth, and by those, one should do one's own work.

original: des rnam par dag pa 'dir bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des rnam par dag pa 'dir bshad pa yin no //
translated: That is the explanation of the purification here.

original: de bzhi ka dam tshig sems dpa'o zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhi ka dam tshig sems dpa'o zhes so //
translated: Those four are the pledge beings.

original: sku gsung thugs ni gsang ba ste rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs ni gsang ba ste rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The secret of body, speech, and mind is the vajra holder.

original: 'dus pa yang de nyid do //
analyzed: 'dus pa yang de nyid do //
translated: The assembly is just that.

original: shin tu grub par byed pa'i phyir byin gyis rlob pa la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: shin tu grub par byed pa'i phyir byin gyis rlob pa la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Because of the accomplishment of that, the consecration and so forth are mentioned.

original: le'u dang po'i dang po'i don ji snyed pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: le'u dang po'i dang po'i don ji snyed pa rdzogs so /
translated: The meaning of the first of the first chapters is complete.

original: // / da ni sbyor ba dang po dad dkyil 'khor dbyung ba gsungs nas /
analyzed: // / da ni sbyor ba dang po dad dkyil 'khor dbyung ba gsungs nas /
translated: Now, after teaching the first application, the creation of the mandala,

original: don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems thun mong dang khyad par gsungs pa de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems thun mong dang khyad par gsungs pa de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: the teaching of the common and special ultimate awakening mind is from “Then” and so forth.

original: de nas ni dkyil 'khor dbyung ba'i de ma thag go //
analyzed: de nas ni dkyil 'khor dbyung ba'i de ma thag go //
translated: “Then” is immediately after the creation of the mandala.

original: sbyor pa ni mchod pa la sogs pa bya ste gsol to zhe'o //
analyzed: sbyor pa ni mchod pa la sogs pa bya ste gsol to zhe'o //
translated: The application is the offering, etc. , which is the supplication.

original: de'i dam tshig ni sku gsung thugs kyi mchog ces pa ste sku ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku /
analyzed: de'i dam tshig ni sku gsung thugs kyi mchog ces pa ste sku ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku /
translated: His commitment is the supreme of all bodies, speech, and minds. The body is the enjoyment body.

original: gsung ni sprul pa'i sku /
analyzed: gsung ni sprul pa'i sku /
translated: The speech is the emanation body.

original: thugs ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: thugs ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The mind is the reality body.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin yin pas kun gyi gsang ba ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin yin pas kun gyi gsang ba ste /
translated: Since he is the nature of those, he is the secret of all.

original: khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir mchog dang bla na med pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir mchog dang bla na med pa ste /
translated: Since he is distinguished, he is the supreme and unexcelled.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni bdag nyid kyi ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni bdag nyid kyi ste /
translated: The mind of enlightenment is one's own.

original: de kun gyi rgyu yin pa nyid kyi phyir @50b na snying po ste sa bon no //
analyzed: de kun gyi rgyu yin pa nyid kyi phyir @50b na snying po ste sa bon no //
translated: Since it is the cause of all, it is the essence, the seed.

original: de nas ni zhus pa'i de ma thag go //
analyzed: de nas ni zhus pa'i de ma thag go //
translated: Then is immediately after the request.

original: yongs su rtog pa ni the tshom med par zhus pa rnams mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa ni the tshom med par zhus pa rnams mkhyen pa ste /
translated: The thorough understanding is the knowledge of the questions without doubt.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: ji lta ba bzhin mkhyen pa dang / ji snyed pa mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin la thugs kyis she'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin mkhyen pa dang / ji snyed pa mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin la thugs kyis she'o //
translated: The mind knows the nature of the knowledge of the way things are and the knowledge of things in their extent.

original: khyed kyis zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o//
analyzed: khyed kyis zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o//
translated: You is the bodhisattvas.

original: sems lus lta bu dang zhes pa yul gyi rnam pa dang rang gi mtshan nyid med par gang du rtog pa'i sems dgag pa'o //
analyzed: sems lus lta bu dang zhes pa yul gyi rnam pa dang rang gi mtshan nyid med par gang du rtog pa'i sems dgag pa'o //
translated: The mind is like the body means that the mind which is imagined to be without the aspects of objects and its own characteristics is to be stopped.

original: lus sems dbyer med par bstan pa'i phyir rtog pas bskyed pa'i lus kyang dgag pa ste /
analyzed: lus sems dbyer med par bstan pa'i phyir rtog pas bskyed pa'i lus kyang dgag pa ste /
translated: The body is like the mind means that the body generated by imagination is to be stopped, in order to show that the body and mind are not different.

original: de'i phyir lus sems lta bu zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus sems lta bu zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, the body is like the mind.

original: dag sems lta bu dang / sems tshig brjod pa lta bu ni gong 'og gi tshul gyis ngag yid tha mi dad par bya ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dag sems lta bu dang / sems tshig brjod pa lta bu ni gong 'og gi tshul gyis ngag yid tha mi dad par bya ba bstan pa ste /
translated: The mind is like speech and speech is like the mind means that speech and mind are not different, as shown by the order of the above and below.

original: rtog pas bskyed pa dgag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pas bskyed pa dgag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the body generated by imagination is to be stopped.

original: des ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: des ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is what is meant.

original: lus ni gzugs kyi khams /
analyzed: lus ni gzugs kyi khams /
translated: The body is the form realm.

original: ngag dang yid ni 'dod pa dang gzugs med pa'i khams te rnam pa dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: ngag dang yid ni 'dod pa dang gzugs med pa'i khams te rnam pa dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: Speech and mind are the desire realm and the formless realm, with their aspects.

original: de ni longs spyod dang sprul pa dang chos kyi rang bzhin gnyis su med par sbyar nas skyes cig pa ste /
analyzed: de ni longs spyod dang sprul pa dang chos kyi rang bzhin gnyis su med par sbyar nas skyes cig pa ste /
translated: They are generated by the union of the two, enjoyment and emanation, which are the nature of phenomena.

original: de ni re re la yang sbyar bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni re re la yang sbyar bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is shown to be applied to each one.

original: zhu ba po rnams kyis bka' mnyan nas gsungs pa ni de nas zhes ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhu ba po rnams kyis bka' mnyan nas gsungs pa ni de nas zhes ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
translated: The petitioners, having listened, said, “Then,” etc.

original: de la gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bor de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje nam mkha' ltar sbyar nas smra so zhes pa ste brjod ces pa'i tha tshig go //🔽gzhan gyi ched du gleng ba ni spyan sngar 'dug nas brjod pa /
analyzed: de la gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bor de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje nam mkha' ltar sbyar nas smra so zhes pa ste brjod ces pa'i tha tshig go // gzhan gyi ched du gleng ba ni spyan sngar 'dug nas brjod pa /
translated: There, the vajra of all the Tathagatas, having been applied to the sky-like nondual intuition, was spoken, i.e., expressed, by the Lord.

original: ae ma ho zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ae ma ho zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The public discussion is expressed by sitting in front of the assembly and saying, “Emaho,” etc.

original: de ya mtshan che ba'i don te /
analyzed: de ya mtshan che ba'i don te /
translated: That is the meaning of “astonishment.”

original: gzung 'dzin gyis skye ba med pa'i don te /
analyzed: gzung 'dzin gyis skye ba med pa'i don te /
translated: It is the meaning of non-production by subject-object.

original: de'i tshul gyis dngos po'i ngo bo ni skye ba ste /
analyzed: de'i tshul gyis dngos po'i ngo bo ni skye ba ste /
translated: The nature of things is production in that way,

original: 'di ltar rab tu bsgrags zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rab tu bsgrags zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: and it is taught that it is thus proclaimed.

original: de ltar thun mong gi brjod nas khyad par du sangs rgyas drug rnams kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar thun mong gi brjod nas khyad par du sangs rgyas drug rnams kyis gsungs te /
translated: Having thus made the general statement, the six Buddhas in particular spoke:

original: khyed kyis sems zhes pa la brten nas thugs kyi rang bzhin rdo rje 'dzin pa'i byang chub kyi sems gsungs pa ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: khyed kyis sems zhes pa la brten nas thugs kyi rang bzhin rdo rje 'dzin pa'i byang chub kyi sems gsungs pa ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The enlightenment mind of the vajra holder, the nature of the mind, is taught in dependence on what is called “mind.”

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis byang chub pa'i tshul zhes chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes la snyoms par zhugs nas zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis byang chub pa'i tshul zhes chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes la snyoms par zhugs nas zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: The phrase “from that” and so forth is connected with “having entered into meditative equipoise on the pristine wisdom of the ultimate realm in the manner of enlightenment in the manner of the vajra holder.”

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase “the non-existence of things such as form” is connected with “the non-existence of things such as form.”

original: dngos po med par bsgom pa ni dngos po nyid @51a * //
analyzed: dngos po med par bsgom pa ni dngos po nyid @51a * //
translated: The phrase “the meditation on the non-existence of things” is connected with “the meditation on the very existence of things.”

original: yin no // gang gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po nyid bsgom par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: yin no // gang gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po nyid bsgom par bya'o zhe na /
translated: The phrase “the meditation on the very existence of things such as form” is connected with “the meditation on the very existence of things such as form.”

original: de yang kun du brtags pa nyid kyi phyir bsgom pa min zhes so //
analyzed: de yang kun du brtags pa nyid kyi phyir bsgom pa min zhes so //
translated: The phrase “that is not a meditation” is connected with “because it is an imputation.”

original: de ltar dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa gnyi ga ma yin pas /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa gnyi ga ma yin pas /
translated: Thus, since neither existence nor non-existence is the case,

original: bsgom pa dmigs su med pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: bsgom pa dmigs su med pa'o zhes so //
translated: “the meditation is not apprehended.”

original: de dag gi don ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de dag gi don ni 'di skad du /
translated: The meaning of those is as follows.

original: yod med kyi dngos po zhi ba dngos po nyid kun rdzob tu rten 'brel gyi ngo bo snang ba mi 'gog pa yin la /
analyzed: yod med kyi dngos po zhi ba dngos po nyid kun rdzob tu rten 'brel gyi ngo bo snang ba mi 'gog pa yin la /
translated: The pacification of existent and nonexistent things is the appearance of the nature of dependent origination itself as superficial reality, which is not negated.

original: de ltar yin pa nyid kyi sa yang dag par na dngos po gang du yang ma grub pa skyon rnam par dag pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin pa nyid kyi sa yang dag par na dngos po gang du yang ma grub pa skyon rnam par dag pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: And that being so, in reality nothing at all is established, and the faults are completely purified.

original: da ni sems lus lta bu zhes pa'i rim pa la brten nas rnam par snang mdzad kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni sems lus lta bu zhes pa'i rim pa la brten nas rnam par snang mdzad kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Now, based on the stage of the mind being like the body, Vairocana declares:

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, etc.

original: thugs kyi de ma thag tu sku'i rang bzhin ston pas de nas zhes smos so //
analyzed: thugs kyi de ma thag tu sku'i rang bzhin ston pas de nas zhes smos so //
translated: Immediately after the mind, the nature of the body is taught, so “then” is stated.

original: me long lta bu'i don gang gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid de ni mngon par rtogs pa la sogs pa ste de la'o //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i don gang gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid de ni mngon par rtogs pa la sogs pa ste de la'o //
translated: The meaning of the mirror, which is the nondual nature, is the realization, etc., and that is the object.

original: dngos po thams cad dang zhes pa gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad dang zhes pa gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: All things, etc., are form, etc.

original: log par rtogs pas gang zag la bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i kun du brtags so //
analyzed: log par rtogs pas gang zag la bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i kun du brtags so //
translated: The imagined is the apprehension of a self in the person, etc., by wrong conception.

original: de dang bral ba ni phyi rol pa ste de'i phung po lnga dang / khams bco brgyad dang / skye mched bcu gnyis su 'dod pa yin te /🔽de ni gzung 'dzin nyid pas /
analyzed: de dang bral ba ni phyi rol pa ste de'i phung po lnga dang / khams bco brgyad dang / skye mched bcu gnyis su 'dod pa yin te / de ni gzung 'dzin nyid pas /
translated: Those who are free from that are non-Buddhists, who assert the five aggregates, the eighteen elements, and the twelve sense spheres.

original: kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: That is the imagined characteristic, because it is the duality of the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: rnam par spangs pa des ni phung po la sogs pa'i chos la yang /
analyzed: rnam par spangs pa des ni phung po la sogs pa'i chos la yang /
translated: By abandoning that, the aggregates and so on are also

original: bdag med pa mnyam pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: bdag med pa mnyam pa nyid yin pas /
translated: equal in being selfless.

original: theg pa chen po'i khyad par du gsungs so //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i khyad par du gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be a special feature of the Mahāyāna.

original: de ni don dam par gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid du rang gi sems mi dmigs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ni don dam par gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid du rang gi sems mi dmigs pa'i tshe /
translated: That is asserted as the characteristic of the dependent in the ultimate, when one does not observe one’s mind.

original: 'dod pa yin te de rnam rig gi gzhung btsugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa yin te de rnam rig gi gzhung btsugs pa'o //
translated: That is the establishment of the Vijñapti treatise.

original: yang gzhan ma skyes khyad par gsungs pa thog ma nas ma skyes zhes pa ste /
analyzed: yang gzhan ma skyes khyad par gsungs pa thog ma nas ma skyes zhes pa ste /
translated: Again, another special feature is stated: “not arisen from the beginning.”

original: ltos pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes ma zhig pa ste /
analyzed: ltos pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes ma zhig pa ste /
translated: It is not arisen and not ceased by the nature of dependence.

original: dngos po nyid yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po nyid yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: It is the correct knowledge of things as they are.

original: de nyid khyad par du brtan por bya ba stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no zhes te dngos po med pa'i de nyid stong pa nyid do //🔽da ni mi bskyod pa'i gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid khyad par du brtan por bya ba stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no zhes te dngos po med pa'i de nyid stong pa nyid do // da ni mi bskyod pa'i gsungs pa ni /
translated: That very [emptiness] is the nature of emptiness, which is the special stability.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, the statement of Akṣhobhya is [the passage] beginning with “Then, Vajrapāṇi, having bowed to all the Buddhas, said this to Vajradhara, the Vanquishing Teacher:”

original: de la mi zad pa'i rdo rje ni 'phel 'grib med pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi zad pa'i rdo rje ni 'phel 'grib med pa'o //
translated: There, the “imperishable vajra” is without increase or decrease.

original: gang dbyer med pa'i stod pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: gang dbyer med pa'i stod pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: That which is indivisible is the wisdom of emptiness.

original: de la 'di nyid kyi tshul gyis so //
analyzed: de la 'di nyid kyi tshul gyis so //
translated: By that very method,

original: dngos po zhes pa @51b gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po zhes pa @51b gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: “entities” are forms and so forth.

original: de sgyu ma ltar yin pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de sgyu ma ltar yin pa nyid kyis /
translated: Since they are like illusions,

original: don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pas de'i phyir chos can snang ba'i ngo bo dang / chos nyid mi snang ba'i ngo bo yang rang bzhin gyis min pa ste /
analyzed: don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pas de'i phyir chos can snang ba'i ngo bo dang / chos nyid mi snang ba'i ngo bo yang rang bzhin gyis min pa ste /
translated: ultimately they are not essentially arisen. Therefore, the entity of the apparent phenomena and the entity of the non-apparent noumenon are not natural.

original: de ltar na ni shin tu med pa'i stong par thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na ni shin tu med pa'i stong par thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If that were so, it would follow that they are utterly nonexistent emptiness.

original: mi 'gyur te dmigs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo tsam zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mi 'gyur te dmigs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo tsam zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is not so, because it is the mere essence of non-apprehending intuition.

original: des na nam mkha' lta bur bdag med pa zhes pa smos so //
analyzed: des na nam mkha' lta bur bdag med pa zhes pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “like space, without self.”

original: de'i byang chub tshul 'di bstan pa'o zhes te /
analyzed: de'i byang chub tshul 'di bstan pa'o zhes te /
translated: This is the teaching of the method of enlightenment.

original: de kho na nyid las mi nyams pa'i don to //🔽'byung ldan gyis gsungs pa de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid las mi nyams pa'i don to // 'byung ldan gyis gsungs pa de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It means that one does not fall away from reality.

original: de la bdag med pa rdo rje ni /
analyzed: de la bdag med pa rdo rje ni /
translated: Vajragarbha speaks of this in the passage beginning with the words, “Then, Vajra-Insight, etc.”🔽There, the vajra of selflessness is the sameness of all things.

original: mnyam pa nyid du gang gyur pa de zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la dkon mchog dpal gyi tshul gyis so //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid du gang gyur pa de zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la dkon mchog dpal gyi tshul gyis so //
translated: The samadhi called “That” is the method of Ratnasambhava.

original: chos rnams zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phung po dang khams la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phung po dang khams la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Things” are the aggregates, elements, etc., which hold the characteristics.

original: de nyid spangs pa ni dbyig pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / gzugs su rung ba gzugs zhes bya ba dang / grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i 'jig pa'i ngang can la sogs pa des rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: de nyid spangs pa ni dbyig pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / gzugs su rung ba gzugs zhes bya ba dang / grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i 'jig pa'i ngang can la sogs pa des rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: Their reality is the contact of the union of the vajra and the lotus, the form of form, the nature of the destruction of the one taste of accomplishment and bliss, etc.

original: mnyam pa nyid ni bdag med pa'i chos te de las zhes so //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ni bdag med pa'i chos te de las zhes so //
translated: The sameness is the dharma of selflessness.

original: da ni snang ba mtha' yas gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni snang ba mtha' yas gsungs pa /
translated: Now, Amitābha is stated:

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, etc.

original: de la so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni kun gsal bas /
analyzed: de la so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni kun gsal bas /
translated: Therein, the wisdom of discernment is all-illuminating,

original: 'od zer 'bar ba yang yin la /
analyzed: 'od zer 'bar ba yang yin la /
translated: and so it is a blazing light ray.

original: gnyis su med par gang gyur pa de ni sgron ma dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: gnyis su med par gang gyur pa de ni sgron ma dang 'dra ste /
translated: That which is nondual is like a lamp,

original: sgron mas kyang mun pa bsal lo //
analyzed: sgron mas kyang mun pa bsal lo //
translated: and the lamp also clears away darkness.

original: 'bros so snyam du mi sems mod kyi /
analyzed: 'bros so snyam du mi sems mod kyi /
translated: It is not that the lamp thinks, “I will clear away the darkness and flee!”

original: ngang gis gsal bar byed pa dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: ngang gis gsal bar byed pa dang 'dra bar /
translated: Rather, it is like the natural illumination.

original: ye shes kyis kyang sems can gyi don la de dag de ltar ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyis kyang sems can gyi don la de dag de ltar ro //
translated: Likewise, the wisdom also benefits sentient beings.

original: de'i ting nge 'dzin la rigs gang yin pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: de'i ting nge 'dzin la rigs gang yin pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: In that samādhi, it is by the method of whatever family.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis thog ma nas yang dag par ma skyes pa'i chos phung po la sogs pa rnams la mtshan ma'i ngo bo med de /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis thog ma nas yang dag par ma skyes pa'i chos phung po la sogs pa rnams la mtshan ma'i ngo bo med de /
translated: By nature, the originally perfectly unarisen dharmas, such as the aggregates, do not have the nature of signs.

original: dmigs pa'i bsgom pa'ang de'i phyir med do zhes so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i bsgom pa'ang de'i phyir med do zhes so //
translated: Also, the cultivation of the object is not that, and therefore it does not exist.

original: de lta na ni 'o na ni thams cad du med par mtshungs so zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na ni thams cad du med par mtshungs so zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then all are the same in being nonexistent.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: nam mkha'i tshul du sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: nam mkha'i tshul du sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the method of space,

original: zhes pas shes bya la dmigs pa med pa nyid kyis dngos po ni rten dang brten pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: zhes pas shes bya la dmigs pa med pa nyid kyis dngos po ni rten dang brten pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: one should understand that the object of knowledge is devoid of the nature of the supported and the support,

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyis so //
translated: by the wisdom of discernment.

original: de na bsgrags zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de na bsgrags zhes pa'i don to //
translated: That is the meaning of “there.”

original: da ni don yod grub pa'i gsungs @52a * //
analyzed: da ni don yod grub pa'i gsungs @52a * //
translated: Now, the statement of Amoghasiddhi

original: pa ; de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: pa ; de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: is from “Then, the Tathāgata” and so on.

original: de la zil gyis gnon pa ni /
analyzed: de la zil gyis gnon pa ni /
translated: There, the subjugation

original: gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo don mthar phyin pa'i bya ba bsgrub pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo don mthar phyin pa'i bya ba bsgrub pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: is the aspect of accomplishing the activity of reaching the ultimate object, the nondual nature.

original: de la rigs gang yin pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: de la rigs gang yin pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: There, by the method of whatever family.

original: gzhan dag ni go sla bas ma bris so //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni go sla bas ma bris so //
translated: The others are easy to understand, so I will not write about them.

original: 'dir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos rnams rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ni da ltar ma yin gdod ma nas dag pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos rnams rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ni da ltar ma yin gdod ma nas dag pa ste /
translated: Here, the phenomena of saṃsāra and nirvāṇa are naturally luminous, not just now, but primordially pure.

original: de la yul gyi ngo bo byang chub kyang med cing yul can gyi rang bzhin rtog pa yang med do //
analyzed: de la yul gyi ngo bo byang chub kyang med cing yul can gyi rang bzhin rtog pa yang med do //
translated: There is no essence of an object, enlightenment, and there is no thought, the nature of a subject.

original: dper na nam mkha' bzhin zhes te ltag 'og tu snyoms so //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' bzhin zhes te ltag 'og tu snyoms so //
translated: For example, like space.

original: de dag ni dngos po nyid kyi rang bzhin mi dmigs pas yul dang thabs su tha mi dad de /
analyzed: de dag ni dngos po nyid kyi rang bzhin mi dmigs pas yul dang thabs su tha mi dad de /
translated: They are not different as objects and methods, because the nature of entities is not observed.

original: a'a li k'a li dag par bya //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li dag par bya // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Purify ālikāli.

original: de nas byams pa la sogs pa chos nyid thos nas ngo mtshar du gyur zhes pa ni gong du gsungs pa'i don nges par 'grel cing de la mchod pa brjod pa'i phyir de skad du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas byams pa la sogs pa chos nyid thos nas ngo mtshar du gyur zhes pa ni gong du gsungs pa'i don nges par 'grel cing de la mchod pa brjod pa'i phyir de skad du gsungs pa ste /
translated: Then, Maitreya and so on, having heard the suchness of phenomena, were amazed. This is said in order to explain the meaning of the above and to express worship to it.

original: ngo mtshar che ba dang sngon med pa myong ba mngon du byas nas ched du gleng ba ni dgos pa'i tshig brjod pa'o //
analyzed: ngo mtshar che ba dang sngon med pa myong ba mngon du byas nas ched du gleng ba ni dgos pa'i tshig brjod pa'o //
translated: Having actualized the amazing and unprecedented experience, the exclamation is the expression of the purpose.

original: 'di dag dbyer med yang dag don //
analyzed: 'di dag dbyer med yang dag don //
translated: These are the undifferentiable, utterly pure meaning,

original: mkha' dbyings sems dang tha mi dad //
analyzed: mkha' dbyings sems dang tha mi dad //
translated: the space element and mind undifferentiated,

original: ye shes rnams kyis rim bzhin bstod //
analyzed: ye shes rnams kyis rim bzhin bstod //
translated: praised in order by the wisdoms.

original: rdo rje gsum dang spyir gsungs so //🔽zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum dang spyir gsungs so // zhes pa yin no //
translated: The three vajras are mentioned in general.

original: de rnams kyi tshig gi don ni /
analyzed: de rnams kyi tshig gi don ni /
translated: The meaning of the words of that is as follows:

original: ae ma'o sangs rgyas zhes pa ste ched che ba'i don te rangs pa'i phyir yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: ae ma'o sangs rgyas zhes pa ste ched che ba'i don te rangs pa'i phyir yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: “Amazing Buddha” means “great” and also means “pleased. ”

original: de'i yang dag don ni yang dag kyang yin la don kyang yin pas de skad ces te drug gi don gyis de la'o //
analyzed: de'i yang dag don ni yang dag kyang yin la don kyang yin pas de skad ces te drug gi don gyis de la'o //
translated: “Its true meaning” is that which is both true and meaning, and that is the meaning of the six syllables.

original: nga dang bdag med pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: nga dang bdag med pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: “Selfless” is nonconceptual wisdom.

original: de las byung ba ni byang chub rdzogs par byed ces te dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni byang chub rdzogs par byed ces te dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis so //
translated: “Arisen from that” is “perfected enlightenment, ” by pure mundane wisdom.

original: de gang gi stobs she na /
analyzed: de gang gi stobs she na /
translated: By the power of what?

original: rnam par mi rtog ces te de la 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ces te de la 'dun pa'o //
translated: “Nonconceptuality” is aspiration for that.

original: de nyid kyi don dang 'du ba gsungs pa kun du bzang po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi don dang 'du ba gsungs pa kun du bzang po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of that is stated in “Samantabhadra” and so forth.

original: dag pa ni byang chub kyi sems te de dang tha mi dad pa'i don to //
analyzed: dag pa ni byang chub kyi sems te de dang tha mi dad pa'i don to //
translated: “Pure” is the thought of awakening, and the meaning is nondifferent from that.

original: ye shes dbang du gyur pa'i byang chub sems te /
analyzed: ye shes dbang du gyur pa'i byang chub sems te /
translated: The thought of awakening is under the power of wisdom.

original: le'u gnyis pa'i don rdzogs so /
analyzed: le'u gnyis pa'i don rdzogs so /
translated: The meaning of chapter two is complete.

original: // / de nas le'u gsum pas rdo rje bkod pa'i ting nge 'dzin brjod par gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / de nas le'u gsum pas rdo rje bkod pa'i ting nge 'dzin brjod par gsungs pa /
translated: Then, chapter three is said to express the vajra array samādhi.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of then and so forth is as follows.

original: de la 'dir 'phro ba'i sprin bkod pa zhes pa ni khyab pa dang 'byung ba dang @52b mang po 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'dir 'phro ba'i sprin bkod pa zhes pa ni khyab pa dang 'byung ba dang @52b mang po 'dus pa ste /
translated: Here, the array of the cloud of emanations is the pervasion, the arising, and the gathering of many.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi nang na 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi nang na 'dus pa'o //
translated: It is contained within the dharmadhātu.

original: de nyid rdo rje ste rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje ste rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: That itself is the vajra, which is the vajra holder.

original: de'i ting nge 'dzin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i ting nge 'dzin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of samādhi is that.

original: sngon du gnas byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags gsungs pa /
analyzed: sngon du gnas byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags gsungs pa /
translated: The mantra for the preliminary consecration of the place is stated:

original: aom zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: aom zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Oṃ and so forth.

original: de ni lha'i ngo bo nyid de de nyid sh'u n+ya t'a zhes stong pa nyid kyi'o ;
analyzed: de ni lha'i ngo bo nyid de de nyid sh'u n+ya t'a zhes stong pa nyid kyi'o ;
translated: That is the essence of the deity. That itself is śūnya, emptiness.

original: / dzny'a na ye shes so //
analyzed: / dzny'a na ye shes so //
translated: Jñāna is pristine consciousness.

original: de nyid badzra ni rdo rje ste /
analyzed: de nyid badzra ni rdo rje ste /
translated: That itself is vajra.

original: de'i sv'a bh'a ba rnam par dag pa de a'atma ko& ham zhes nga'am bdag yin no zhes so //
analyzed: de'i sv'a bh'a ba rnam par dag pa de a'atma ko& ham zhes nga'am bdag yin no zhes so //
translated: Its purity is svabhāva. That is ātmako 'haṃ, I am the self.

original: sngags de rnams ni bkra shis pa yin te stong pa nyid don gyis bkra shis ba dang / rdzogs pa sngags kyi bkra shis pa'o /
analyzed: sngags de rnams ni bkra shis pa yin te stong pa nyid don gyis bkra shis ba dang / rdzogs pa sngags kyi bkra shis pa'o /
translated: These mantras are auspicious, because they are auspicious by the meaning of emptiness, and auspicious by the perfection of mantra.

original: 'phags pa klu grub zhabs kyis kyang //
