analyzed: 'phags pa klu grub zhabs kyis kyang //
translated: Ārya Nāgārjuna also says:

original: dngos la stong zhing gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: dngos la stong zhing gzhan ma yin //
translated: Not empty of the entity, but not other.

original: de ma rtogs pa'i dngos kyang med //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de ma rtogs pa'i dngos kyang med // ces gsungs so //
translated: Without that non-apprehension, there is no entity.

original: 'di dag gi sgrub thabs ni thog mar snying rje'i mthu las skyes pa /
analyzed: 'di dag gi sgrub thabs ni thog mar snying rje'i mthu las skyes pa /
translated: The method of practice is as follows: First, one who is born from the power of compassion,

original: byang chub sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dang ldan pa /
translated: endowed with the thought of awakening,

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa dang bcas pa /
translated: possessing generosity and so forth,

original: thabs shes rab gnyis su med pa /
analyzed: thabs shes rab gnyis su med pa /
translated: nondual method and wisdom,

original: zab mo'i tshul la mos pa /
analyzed: zab mo'i tshul la mos pa /
translated: delighting in the profound way,

original: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i dkyil 'khor du cho ga bzhin du chu la sogs pa'i dbang rnams thob cing tshul dang ldan pas /
analyzed: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i dkyil 'khor du cho ga bzhin du chu la sogs pa'i dbang rnams thob cing tshul dang ldan pas /
translated: having obtained the empowerments of water and so forth in the maṇḍala of Śrī Guhyasamāja according to the rite, and endowed with the proper conduct,

original: ri la sogs pa gang yid du 'ong bar dri med chu tshogs la sogs pas dkyil 'khor byugs te /
analyzed: ri la sogs pa gang yid du 'ong bar dri med chu tshogs la sogs pas dkyil 'khor byugs te /
translated: should anoint the maṇḍala with pure water and so forth in a pleasing place such as a mountain,

original: me tog sna tshogs dgram par bya'o //
analyzed: me tog sna tshogs dgram par bya'o //
translated: and scatter various flowers.

original: dri chab kyis kyang phyogs mtshams gtong nas /
analyzed: dri chab kyis kyang phyogs mtshams gtong nas /
translated: Also, having determined the directions with perfume,

original: de'i dbus su stan pa de ba la rdo rje skyil mo krung gis 'dug ste kun rdzob kyi byang chub sems bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su stan pa de ba la rdo rje skyil mo krung gis 'dug ste kun rdzob kyi byang chub sems bsgom par bya'o //
translated: in the center of that, on a comfortable seat, one should sit in the vajra posture and cultivate conventional awakening mind.

original: de yang rnam par thar pa'i sogs snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la h'um mthing gas til 'bru bzhin du khyab pas gnyis su med pa'i lhas gang bar dmigs te /
analyzed: de yang rnam par thar pa'i sogs snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la h'um mthing gas til 'bru bzhin du khyab pas gnyis su med pa'i lhas gang bar dmigs te /
translated: Moreover, on a sun maṇḍala at the heart, one should visualize a blue hūṃ, filling it like sesame seeds, filled with nondual deities.

original: h'um de las gdugs dang rgyal mtshan dang / rin po che dang / lha bshos dang / spyan ma la sogs pa mchod pa rnams spros te /
analyzed: h'um de las gdugs dang rgyal mtshan dang / rin po che dang / lha bshos dang / spyan ma la sogs pa mchod pa rnams spros te /
translated: From that hūṃ, one should emanate parasols, victory banners, jewels, bali offerings, and the offerings of Locanā, and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod nas bdag nyid re re'i mdun du 'dug ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod nas bdag nyid re re'i mdun du 'dug ste /
translated: Having made offerings to the tathāgatas, one should sit in front of each of them.

original: yan lag lngas gtugs te phyag byed par mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag lngas gtugs te phyag byed par mngon du bya'o //
translated: One should manifest prostrations with the five limbs.

original: des thog ma med pa'i sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: des thog ma med pa'i sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: With that, one should confess misdeeds and so on from beginningless time.

original: de nas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / dge slong dang / rnal 'byor pas dge ba'i rtsa ba ci spyod pa la phrag dog mi skye ste dge @53a * //🔽ba'i rtsa ba sngo bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / dge slong dang / rnal 'byor pas dge ba'i rtsa ba ci spyod pa la phrag dog mi skye ste dge @53a * // ba'i rtsa ba sngo bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should not be jealous of the roots of virtue of the Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, monks, and yogis, but should rejoice in their roots of virtue.

original: de nas dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should cultivate going for refuge to the Three Jewels.

original: des smon pa byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa dang lam brten par bya'o //
analyzed: des smon pa byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa dang lam brten par bya'o //
translated: Through that, one should cultivate the aspiration thought of enlightenment and rely on the path.

original: 'gro pa'i don du 'jug pa dang bcas pa'i byang chub kyi sems te /
analyzed: 'gro pa'i don du 'jug pa dang bcas pa'i byang chub kyi sems te /
translated: The thought of enlightenment is the entrance for the sake of migrating beings.

original: don dam pa'i sems bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i sems bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate the ultimate thought of enlightenment.

original: stong pa nyid ni chos thams cad gzung 'dzin dang bral ba'o //🔽de'i rnam pa'i ye shes gzhan gyis mi skye pa'i phyir na de de bzhin du mchan ma med do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni chos thams cad gzung 'dzin dang bral ba'o // de'i rnam pa'i ye shes gzhan gyis mi skye pa'i phyir na de de bzhin du mchan ma med do //
translated: Emptiness is the freedom of all phenomena from subject and object.🔽Since the intuition of that aspect is not produced by another, it is signless in that way.

original: ye shes tsam ma gtogs pa rtog pa med pas mos pa med de gang du yang smon pa med do //
analyzed: ye shes tsam ma gtogs pa rtog pa med pas mos pa med de gang du yang smon pa med do //
translated: Since it is non-conceptual except for mere intuition, it is wishless, not wishing for anything.

original: de ltar rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang ldan pa rang gi sems rang gis rig pa rmongs pa med pa mngon du byas te /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang ldan pa rang gi sems rang gis rig pa rmongs pa med pa mngon du byas te /
translated: Thus, having realized one's own mind, which is not deluded, and which is endowed with the three doors of liberation,

original: gong du gsungs pa'i sngags brjod pas stong pa chen por byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: gong du gsungs pa'i sngags brjod pas stong pa chen por byin gyis brlab po //
translated: one should bless it as great emptiness by reciting the mantra taught above.

original: des gsum gyi dang po de bzhin nyid bstan to //
analyzed: des gsum gyi dang po de bzhin nyid bstan to //
translated: By that, the first of the three, reality, is taught.

original: da ni gzhi'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom ste /
analyzed: da ni gzhi'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom ste /
translated: Now, one should cultivate the basic meditative stabilization.

original: dang por ram dmar po las me'i dkyil 'khor zur gsum bsgom mo //
analyzed: dang por ram dmar po las me'i dkyil 'khor zur gsum bsgom mo //
translated: First, one should meditate on a triangular fire maṇḍala from raṃ.

original: de nas lam ser po las dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor grva bzhir rtse gsum pa'i rdo rjes mtshan pa bsgom ste /
analyzed: de nas lam ser po las dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor grva bzhir rtse gsum pa'i rdo rjes mtshan pa bsgom ste /
translated: Then, one should meditate on a maṇḍala of great power from a yellow path marked with a three-pointed vajra in the four corners.

original: de nas h'um las khro bo'i rdo rje 'bar ba brtag go //
analyzed: de nas h'um las khro bo'i rdo rje 'bar ba brtag go //
translated: Then, one should imagine a blazing vajra from hūṃ.

original: rdo rje 'phros pa las sa gzhi rdo rje gyur pa dang / de las 'od dmar po 'phros pas phyogs bzhir rdo rje ra bar gyur par bsgom /
analyzed: rdo rje 'phros pa las sa gzhi rdo rje gyur pa dang / de las 'od dmar po 'phros pas phyogs bzhir rdo rje ra bar gyur par bsgom /
translated: From the vajra spreading out, the ground becomes vajra, and from that, red light radiates and one should meditate on the vajra fence in the four directions.

original: de las 'od stong du 'phros pas steng rdo rje'i dra bas g-yogs par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de las 'od stong du 'phros pas steng rdo rje'i dra bas g-yogs par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Light radiates from that and one should meditate on the upper part being covered by a vajra net.

original: de nas rdo rje gur thabs de'i steng du bam dkar po las chu'i dkyil 'khor zlum pos g-yogs par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje gur thabs de'i steng du bam dkar po las chu'i dkyil 'khor zlum pos g-yogs par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, on top of that method of the vajra tent, one should meditate on a white baṃ, which is covered by a round water maṇḍala.

original: de kun gyi nang du skad cig ma'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rdzogs pa chen po 'am /
analyzed: de kun gyi nang du skad cig ma'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rdzogs pa chen po 'am /
translated: Within all of that, one should meditate on the great perfection in an instant of concentration,

original: bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa ste yi ga 'bru tsam las sgom yang rung 'khor lo ser po rtsibs bcu la khro bo bcu bsgom pa dang / lha rnams kyi mdog dang phyag mtshan dang gnas la sogs pa rgyas par ni 'di nyid kyi gzhung las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa ste yi ga 'bru tsam las sgom yang rung 'khor lo ser po rtsibs bcu la khro bo bcu bsgom pa dang / lha rnams kyi mdog dang phyag mtshan dang gnas la sogs pa rgyas par ni 'di nyid kyi gzhung las blta bar bya'o //
translated: or one should meditate on the creation and completion stages, which are the ten wrathful ones on a yellow wheel with ten spokes, the colors, implements, locations, and so on of the deities, which should be learned from this very text.

original: de ltar de'i rim pas yan lag bzhi'i che 'bring gi rnam pa dang sbyor ba dang po nyid dang / dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi yig 'bru las spyan drang ba la sogs pa'i rim pa rgyas par ma bshad de gzhung nyid brtag go //
analyzed: de ltar de'i rim pas yan lag bzhi'i che 'bring gi rnam pa dang sbyor ba dang po nyid dang / dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi yig 'bru las spyan drang ba la sogs pa'i rim pa rgyas par ma bshad de gzhung nyid brtag go //
translated: Thus, in that sequence, the four branches are applied to the aspects of great, medium, and small, and the extensive sequence of the invitation and so forth from the syllables of the supreme conqueror mandala is not explained here; one should examine the text itself.

original: de tsam ni bla ma'i man ngag go //
analyzed: de tsam ni bla ma'i man ngag go //
translated: That much is the guru's intimate instruction.

original: da ni rten gyi @53b dkyil 'khor bstan pa'i phyir nam mkha'i dbyings zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni rten gyi @53b dkyil 'khor bstan pa'i phyir nam mkha'i dbyings zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to explain the supporting mandala, [the text] says the realm of space, and so on.

original: de la dbyings ni chos kyi dbyings so //🔽de'i zhes so //🔽yi ge bh'um dang 'khor lo las gyur pa'i rnam par snang mdzad rin po che'i dbu rgyan can de las gyur pa'i gzhal yas khang ni sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: de la dbyings ni chos kyi dbyings so // de'i zhes so // yi ge bh'um dang 'khor lo las gyur pa'i rnam par snang mdzad rin po che'i dbu rgyan can de las gyur pa'i gzhal yas khang ni sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor te /
translated: There, the realm is the dharmadhatu.🔽That refers to the wheel and the syllable bhrum.

original: de'i zhes so //
analyzed: de'i zhes so //
translated: Vairocana, who is adorned with a jeweled crown, arises from that. The immeasurable palace that arises from that is the mandala of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas nyid rnams 'bar ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid rnams 'bar ba ste /
translated: That refers to the buddhas.🔽Blazing means the light rays that arise from that.

original: de dang mnyam pa'i 'od gang las byung ba de de ltar ro //
analyzed: de dang mnyam pa'i 'od gang las byung ba de de ltar ro //
translated: Equal to that means the light rays that arise from that.

original: de'i phyir // 'od zer sna lngas kun du khyab //
analyzed: de'i phyir // 'od zer sna lngas kun du khyab //
translated: it is pervaded by five-colored light.

original: ces so // kun nas yongs su zlum po zhes pa ni spros pa dang bral ba nyid kyis phyi rol gyi mtha' zhes pa ste /
analyzed: ces so // kun nas yongs su zlum po zhes pa ni spros pa dang bral ba nyid kyis phyi rol gyi mtha' zhes pa ste /
translated: Completely round means that it is free from conceptual elaborations, and so is the outer limit.

original: dbus ni gru bzhi kho na'o //🔽'dod par bya ba yin pas na 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: dbus ni gru bzhi kho na'o // 'dod par bya ba yin pas na 'dod pa ste /
translated: The center is square.

original: de nyid rnam par dag pa nyid kyis goms pas na yon tan zhes te gzugs la sogs pa lnga'i sangs rgyas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par dag pa nyid kyis goms pas na yon tan zhes te gzugs la sogs pa lnga'i sangs rgyas zhes pa'o //
translated: Since it is to be desired, it is desire, and since it is purified by meditation on that, it is quality, that is, the five buddhas of form and so on.

original: pog me la sogs pa mchod pa rnam pa lngas kyang brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: pog me la sogs pa mchod pa rnam pa lngas kyang brgyan pa'o //
translated: It is also adorned with the five offerings of incense and so on.

original: de ni rten gyi rang bzhin no ;
analyzed: de ni rten gyi rang bzhin no ;
translated: That is the nature of the support.

original: / mdor na zhes pa gnas kyi mtshan nyid bsgoms nas shi'o //
analyzed: / mdor na zhes pa gnas kyi mtshan nyid bsgoms nas shi'o //
translated: Having meditated on the characteristics of the place, one dies.

original: da ni sangs rgyas drug rnams kyi rang bzhin dang sku mdog bstan pa'i phyir gzugs zhes pa la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: da ni sangs rgyas drug rnams kyi rang bzhin dang sku mdog bstan pa'i phyir gzugs zhes pa la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Now, in order to teach the nature and color of the six buddhas, [the Bhagavān] declares form and so on.

original: de la gzugs ni rgyal pa'i ste de dbus kyi gdan la bsgom par bya'o zhes te /
analyzed: de la gzugs ni rgyal pa'i ste de dbus kyi gdan la bsgom par bya'o zhes te /
translated: There, form is the king, and it should be meditated on in the center of that seat.

original: yid kyis sam ;
analyzed: yid kyis sam ;
translated: Mentally,

original: rdul tshon gyis te de ni gtso bo kho na'i gzugs la 'khor rnams ni phyag mtshan la sogs pa yang 'gal ba med ces gsungs /
analyzed: rdul tshon gyis te de ni gtso bo kho na'i gzugs la 'khor rnams ni phyag mtshan la sogs pa yang 'gal ba med ces gsungs /
translated: The sand mandala is the form of the principal deity alone, but it is not contradictory for the retinue to be hand implements and so forth.

original: 'dir ni 'di ltar yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'di ltar yin te /
translated: Here it is like this:

original: dngos su brjod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos su brjod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is explicitly stated.

original: skur gyur pa nyid kyi phyir na phyag rgya che zhes so //
analyzed: skur gyur pa nyid kyi phyir na phyag rgya che zhes so //
translated: Because it is the body, it is the great seal.

original: sku gsungs thugs kyis mtshan zhes snang mdzad do //
analyzed: sku gsungs thugs kyis mtshan zhes snang mdzad do //
translated: Vairocana is the sign of body, speech, and mind.

original: de rnams kyis byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: Those are the blessings.

original: de ni phyi ma la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni phyi ma la yang shes par bya'o //
translated: That should be understood in the future.

original: 'am zhes pa'i sgra ni snang mdzad dang rdo rje 'dzin gang rung zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'am zhes pa'i sgra ni snang mdzad dang rdo rje 'dzin gang rung zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The word “or” means either Vairocana or Vajradhara.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje zhes pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje zhes pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Vajra of body, speech, and mind is Vajradhara.

original: de mdog la sogs pa dang ldan par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de mdog la sogs pa dang ldan par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on him endowed with color and so forth.

original: gcig tu sbyor ba ni snang mdzad dang rdo rje 'dzin de dang de gcig tu sbyor ba gang yin pa des so //
analyzed: gcig tu sbyor ba ni snang mdzad dang rdo rje 'dzin de dang de gcig tu sbyor ba gang yin pa des so //
translated: The single yoga is that which is the single yoga of Vairocana and Vajradhara.

original: dzny'a na zhes pa ni tshogs dag pa'i rang bzhin lha dang lha mo so sor snang bar sbyor ba zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dzny'a na zhes pa ni tshogs dag pa'i rang bzhin lha dang lha mo so sor snang bar sbyor ba zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Jñāna means the appearance of each individual god and goddess, the nature of the pure assembly.

original: de ltag 'og tu sbyar bar ro //
analyzed: de ltag 'og tu sbyar bar ro //
translated: That is the connection between the two.

original: bar skabs dag ni go sla bas so //
analyzed: bar skabs dag ni go sla bas so //
translated: The middle part is easy to understand.

original: @54a * // da ni mi bskyod pa'i mdog la sogs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: @54a * // da ni mi bskyod pa'i mdog la sogs pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the colors of Akṣobhya and so forth are taught,

original: aindra n'i la'i kha dog 'dra //
analyzed: aindra n'i la'i kha dog 'dra //
translated: beginning with The color of indranīla.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: And so forth.

original: sku dang dbus kyi zhal sngon por bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: sku dang dbus kyi zhal sngon por bsgom pa ste /
translated: The body and the central face are meditated on as blue.

original: g-yas dang g-yon gyi zhal ni gzhi'i le'u nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yon gyi zhal ni gzhi'i le'u nyid du bstan to //
translated: The right and left faces are taught in the chapter on the ground.

original: de 'dul pa'i dbang gis te de ni phyi ma la yang sbyar ro //🔽shel dang dung 'dra zhes pa la sogs pas ni //
analyzed: de 'dul pa'i dbang gis te de ni phyi ma la yang sbyar ro // shel dang dung 'dra zhes pa la sogs pas ni //
translated: That is the color of the body of Vairocana.🔽The color of the body of Ratnasaṃbhava is taught by like crystal and conch, and so forth.

original: snang mdzad kyi sku mdog dang phyag mtshan bstan te /🔽de la thor tshugs cod pa na ni kun la sbyar te /
analyzed: snang mdzad kyi sku mdog dang phyag mtshan bstan te / de la thor tshugs cod pa na ni kun la sbyar te /
translated: The color of the body of Amoghasiddhi is taught by like a cloud, and so forth.🔽 The color of the body of Amitābha is taught by like fire, and so forth.🔽 The color of the body of Akṣobhya is taught by like indranīla, and so forth.🔽 The color of the body of Vairocana is taught by like crystal and conch, and so forth.🔽 The color of the body of Ratnasaṃbhava is taught by like a cloud, and so forth.🔽 The color of the body of Amoghasiddhi is taught by like fire, and so forth.🔽 The color of the body of Amitābha is taught by like indranīla, and so forth.🔽 The color of the body of Akṣobhya is taught by like a cloud, and so forth.🔽 The color of the body of Amoghasiddhi is taught by like fire, and so forth.🔽 The color of the body of Amitābha is taught by like indranīla, and so forth.🔽 The color of the body of Akṣobhya is taught by like a cloud, and so forth.🔽 The color of the body of Amoghasiddhi is taught by like crystal and conch, and so forth.🔽 The color of the body of Ratnasaṃbhava is taught by like fire, and so forth.

original: de rnams kyang 'bar ba'i ral pa dbu rgyan gyi mchog la rin po che sna tshogs 'bar bas brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang 'bar ba'i ral pa dbu rgyan gyi mchog la rin po che sna tshogs 'bar bas brgyan pa'o //
translated: The color of the body of Amitābha is taught by like ind

original: rdo rje 'dzin nyid kyi snang mdzad kyi mdog dang mi bskyod pa'i phyag mtshan du 'brel ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin nyid kyi snang mdzad kyi mdog dang mi bskyod pa'i phyag mtshan du 'brel ba gsungs pa /
translated: The connection of the color of Vairocana himself, the Vajra-Holder, with the hand-symbol of Akshobhya is stated:

original: 'dzam bu na da'i gser 'od 'dra //🔽zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzam bu na da'i gser 'od 'dra // zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Like the light of Jambu River gold.

original: tshul ni gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshul ni gong ma bzhin no //
translated: The method is as above.🔽The color, etc. of Ratnasambhava is stated:

original: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi mdog la sogs pa ma ra ka ta zhes pa la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi mdog la sogs pa ma ra ka ta zhes pa la sogs pa'o//
translated: Marataka, etc.

original: padma r'a ga'i zhes pa la sogs pa ni snang ba mtha' yas kyi mdog la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: padma r'a ga'i zhes pa la sogs pa ni snang ba mtha' yas kyi mdog la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The color, etc. of Amitabha is stated: Padmaraga, etc.

original: don yod grub pa'i sku mdog la sogs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: don yod grub pa'i sku mdog la sogs pa gsungs pa /
translated: The color, etc. of Amoghasiddhi is stated:

original: 'od zer sna lnga'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'od zer sna lnga'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Five-colored light, etc.

original: da ni rang gi lha byin gyis brlabs pa'i sngags gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni rang gi lha byin gyis brlabs pa'i sngags gsungs pa /
translated: Now he states the mantra of self-consecration:

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, etc.

original: de la chos rnams kyi dbyings ni lus te /
analyzed: de la chos rnams kyi dbyings ni lus te /
translated: There, the realm of phenomena is the body,

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal pa'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal pa'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: the emptiness of natural luminosity.

original: ngo bo nyid ces 'brel to //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ces 'brel to //
translated: The intrinsic nature is stated.

original: da ni bying rgod kyi skyon spang pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bying rgod kyi skyon spang pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to abandon the faults of dullness and agitation,

original: phra mo'i don gsungs pa rin chen la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phra mo'i don gsungs pa rin chen la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of subtle is stated as “jewel” and so forth.

original: de ni lha rnams kyi yig 'bru ste tshad ni yungs 'bru tsam mo //
analyzed: de ni lha rnams kyi yig 'bru ste tshad ni yungs 'bru tsam mo //
translated: That is the syllable of the deities, the size of a mustard seed.

original: mchog nyid kyi phyir na rin chen te /
analyzed: mchog nyid kyi phyir na rin chen te /
translated: Because of being supreme, it is a jewel.

original: de gang du zhe na padma'i sna rtser zhes te mtshan ma mthong ma thag tu spro bas na brtan par zhes so //
analyzed: de gang du zhe na padma'i sna rtser zhes te mtshan ma mthong ma thag tu spro bas na brtan par zhes so //
translated: Where is that? At the tip of the lotus, that is, at the tip of the sexual organ of the mother.🔽The aspect of emanating is “buddhas” and so forth.

original: 'phro ba'i rnam pa ni sangs rgyas zhes pa la sogs pa ste mchog rab ni sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: 'phro ba'i rnam pa ni sangs rgyas zhes pa la sogs pa ste mchog rab ni sangs rgyas so //
translated: Supreme is buddha.

original: de'i zhes so //
analyzed: de'i zhes so //
translated: That is the syllable.

original: yig 'bru kho nar ma zad de phyag mtshan yang spro ba'i phyir rdo rje 'khor lo la sogs pa'o //🔽sprin chen ni dbugs rang gi phyag mtshan gyi gzugs lha'i dngos po gong bu'i tshul gyis rang rdo rje las phyung ste /
analyzed: yig 'bru kho nar ma zad de phyag mtshan yang spro ba'i phyir rdo rje 'khor lo la sogs pa'o // sprin chen ni dbugs rang gi phyag mtshan gyi gzugs lha'i dngos po gong bu'i tshul gyis rang rdo rje las phyung ste /
translated: Not only the syllable, but also the insignia are emanated, such as the vajra, wheel, and so forth.🔽The great cloud is one’s own insignia in the form of a sphere in the aspect of a deity.

original: lha mo'i sna rtse la zhes so //
analyzed: lha mo'i sna rtse la zhes so //
translated: It is extracted from the vajra and placed at the tip of the nose of the goddess.

original: de dag srog dang rtsol pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: de dag srog dang rtsol pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: Those are by way of the life and exertion.

original: de @54b dag gi gdan ni nam mkha' zhes pa la sogs pa ste nam mkha' zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi nang gi gzhal yas khang brtsegs pa'i dbus su gnas par zhes so //
analyzed: de @54b dag gi gdan ni nam mkha' zhes pa la sogs pa ste nam mkha' zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi nang gi gzhal yas khang brtsegs pa'i dbus su gnas par zhes so //
translated: Their seats are the sky, etc. The sky is the celestial mansion in the middle of the realm of reality.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni zla ba ste dbyings kyi dbus su'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni zla ba ste dbyings kyi dbus su'o //
translated: The moon disk is the moon in the middle of the realm of reality.

original: de nyid gsal ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid gsal ba ste /
translated: That is the clear light.

original: de yang dbus su rnam par snang mdzad nyid bsgom pa'i phyir 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor zhes so //
analyzed: de yang dbus su rnam par snang mdzad nyid bsgom pa'i phyir 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor zhes so //
translated: And in the middle of that, one should meditate on Vairocana himself, so it is the mandala of the wheel.

original: 'dir rnam par snang mdzad kyi gdan gsal pa'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa'i sgras /
analyzed: 'dir rnam par snang mdzad kyi gdan gsal pa'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa'i sgras /
translated: Here, the seat of Vairocana is the clear light mandala.

original: zla pa'i dkyil 'khor yin par 'dod pa'i dbang gis snang ba mtha' yas la sogs pa bzhi'i ni shugs kyis gdan nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: zla pa'i dkyil 'khor yin par 'dod pa'i dbang gis snang ba mtha' yas la sogs pa bzhi'i ni shugs kyis gdan nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor du shes par bya ste /
translated: By the power of asserting that it is the moon mandala, one should understand that the four, Amitābha, etc., have the sun mandala as their seat by implication.

original: bzhi'i le'u las kyang /🔽gsal ba la sogs dkyil 'khor ldan //
analyzed: bzhi'i le'u las kyang / gsal ba la sogs dkyil 'khor ldan //
translated: And in the chapter on the four, it says:

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Endowed with the mandala of the clear light, etc.

original: gzhan dag ni mtshon pa tsam ste kun gyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni mtshon pa tsam ste kun gyi'o //
translated: The others are just illustrations, for all.

original: zhes smra'o // nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la padma'i dkyil 'khor zhes te /
analyzed: zhes smra'o // nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la padma'i dkyil 'khor zhes te /
translated: The sun mandala is the lotus mandala.

original: snang ba mtha' yas kyi dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas kyi dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the mandala of Amitābha.

original: gdan de nyid la sku gsung thugs kyi rim pas mi bskyod pa bsgom pa ni rdo rje bsgom pas zhes so //
analyzed: gdan de nyid la sku gsung thugs kyi rim pas mi bskyod pa bsgom pa ni rdo rje bsgom pas zhes so //
translated: On that very seat, meditating on Akṣobhya by way of the stages of body, speech, and mind is “meditating on the vajra.”

original: rin chen dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan de nyi ma'i gdan la lha'i dngos po la brtson pa'i rnal 'byor pas bsgom par bya zhes pa'i don de ltag 'og tu yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rin chen dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan de nyi ma'i gdan la lha'i dngos po la brtson pa'i rnal 'byor pas bsgom par bya zhes pa'i don de ltag 'og tu yang sbyar ro //
translated: The jewel mandala is Ratnasaṃbhava. On the sun seat, the yogī/nī who is intent on the divine nature should meditate. The meaning is like that.

original: sku'i snang mdzad la sogs pa bzhi dang 'brel pa'i sku mdog rnams dang sbyor pa'i dkyil 'khor rang gi ljang gu ngang 'od zer sna lnga'o //
analyzed: sku'i snang mdzad la sogs pa bzhi dang 'brel pa'i sku mdog rnams dang sbyor pa'i dkyil 'khor rang gi ljang gu ngang 'od zer sna lnga'o //
translated: The colors associated with the four, beginning with Vairocana of the body, are connected with the mandala of one’s own green light rays.

original: de yang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa ste gdon mi bra ba zhes so //
analyzed: de yang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa ste gdon mi bra ba zhes so //
translated: Moreover, one should meditate on the sun mandala.

original: gang ldan pa de dang dbyer med pa gsungs pa 'di dag ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang ldan pa de dang dbyer med pa gsungs pa 'di dag ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The indivisibility of those is stated with “these” and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba ni sku gsung thugs bsgom pa'i bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba ni sku gsung thugs bsgom pa'i bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: One becomes a Buddha by the nature of the meditation on Body, Speech, and Mind.

original: grub pa nyid gang snyam pa la thams cad mkhyen pa zhes te tshul don la 'jug pas de nyid thob pa'o zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: grub pa nyid gang snyam pa la thams cad mkhyen pa zhes te tshul don la 'jug pas de nyid thob pa'o zhes pa yin no //
translated: What is attainment? It is omniscience, the attainment of that very state by the entry into the meaning of the method.

original: rdo rje bskor ba ni sngon du byas so //
analyzed: rdo rje bskor ba ni sngon du byas so //
translated: The vajra-circle is the preliminary.

original: le'u gsum pa'i don rdzogs so /
analyzed: le'u gsum pa'i don rdzogs so /
translated: The meaning of the third chapter is complete.

original: // / da ni le'u bzhi pas /
analyzed: // / da ni le'u bzhi pas /
translated: Now, in the fourth chapter,

original: gzugs brnyan gyi dkyil 'khor bya bar gsungs pa de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi dkyil 'khor bya bar gsungs pa de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: it is said that one should perform the mandala of the image. Thus, then and so forth.

original: de la sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor zhu pa'i phyir yang 'dus zhes pa ni ched che ba ste 'das pa bsdu'o //🔽bstod @55a * //
analyzed: de la sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor zhu pa'i phyir yang 'dus zhes pa ni ched che ba ste 'das pa bsdu'o // bstod @55a * //
translated: There, in order to request the mandala of Body, Speech, and Mind, again assembled is the greatness, including the past.

original: pa ni phyag 'tshal bar 'os pa dang / don la rag las pa dang / bshad par gsol pas bstod pa ste /
analyzed: pa ni phyag 'tshal bar 'os pa dang / don la rag las pa dang / bshad par gsol pas bstod pa ste /
translated: The praise is the praise by the worthiness of homage, the dependence on the meaning, and the request to explain.

original: dkyil 'khor bri ba la 'dis bstod nas gsol ba gdab pa ces pa ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bri ba la 'dis bstod nas gsol ba gdab pa ces pa ste /
translated: It is said that having praised the drawing of the mandala, one should make a request.

original: rnal 'byor bas tshul de ltar shes so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor bas tshul de ltar shes so //
translated: The yogi should know this method.

original: tshigs bcad pa zhis ni spyir zhus pa dang ; sku gsung thugs rnams kyi dkyil 'khor zhus pa ste rim pa bzhin du spyar ro //
analyzed: tshigs bcad pa zhis ni spyir zhus pa dang ; sku gsung thugs rnams kyi dkyil 'khor zhus pa ste rim pa bzhin du spyar ro //
translated: The first verse is the general request, and the request for the maṇḍalas of body, speech, and mind, respectively.

original: de la kun zhi ba zhes pa don ngo bo nyid kyis zhi ba dang / snying rje'i don gyis zhi ba'o //
analyzed: de la kun zhi ba zhes pa don ngo bo nyid kyis zhi ba dang / snying rje'i don gyis zhi ba'o //
translated: There, “peace of all” is peace by the nature of the object and peace by the meaning of compassion.

original: sangs rgyas sras bo mchog gi gnas nyid kyi phyir kun gyi gnas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras bo mchog gi gnas nyid kyi phyir kun gyi gnas so //
translated: “ Abode of all” is the abode of the supreme sons of the buddhas.

original: chos kun bdag med ces pa ni nyan thos la sogs pas gang zag dang phyogs gcig / chos la bdag med mod kyi de las mchog go //
analyzed: chos kun bdag med ces pa ni nyan thos la sogs pas gang zag dang phyogs gcig / chos la bdag med mod kyi de las mchog go //
translated: “ All phenomena are selfless” means that although the śrāvakas and so on have the selflessness of persons and a part of the selflessness of phenomena, this is supreme.

original: dam pa ni gya nom pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa ni gya nom pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: “ Sublime” has the aspect of “excellent” and so on.

original: de dag ni 'og gi don te ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag ni 'og gi don te ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: Those are the meanings below, to be applied as appropriate.

original: gzhan dag ni go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni go sla'o //
translated: The others are easy to understand.

original: zhus pa'i de ma thag tu gsungs pa ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhus pa'i de ma thag tu gsungs pa ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The reply immediately following the request is “Then, Vajrapāṇi,” and so on.

original: de la gnas zhes pa rigs lnga la sogs pa kun gyi rten zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la gnas zhes pa rigs lnga la sogs pa kun gyi rten zhes pa'i don to //
translated: There, “abode” means the support of all, such as the five families, and so on.

original: de nyid ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor zhes te /
analyzed: de nyid ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor zhes te /
translated: That is the maṇḍala of mind.

original: de ni gsal pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: de ni gsal pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: That is the nature of clarity.

original: thugs kyi rim pas sku dang gsung gi rim pa zhes par bya'o zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: thugs kyi rim pas sku dang gsung gi rim pa zhes par bya'o zhes dgongs so //
translated: The thought is that it should be called the stage of mind, and the stage of body and speech.

original: da ni cho ga dang ldan pa nyid kyis sku la sogs pa'i ngo bo gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni cho ga dang ldan pa nyid kyis sku la sogs pa'i ngo bo gsungs pa /
translated: Now, he teaches the nature of body and so forth by means of the ritual.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams kyi dkyil 'khor zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams kyi dkyil 'khor zhes pa'o //
translated: The mandala of body, speech, and mind.

original: de nyid sems kyi rdo rje ni de kho na nyid dang 'dra ba'i rdo rje nyi ma'i gdan la bri ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid sems kyi rdo rje ni de kho na nyid dang 'dra ba'i rdo rje nyi ma'i gdan la bri ba yin te /
translated: The mind-vajra is drawn on the seat of the sun, which is like reality itself.

original: 'dir thugs gtso bo nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽lus dang ngag sems zhes pa la sogs pas ni ma mthong zhing rmongs pa'i don du /
analyzed: 'dir thugs gtso bo nyid kyi phyir ro // lus dang ngag sems zhes pa la sogs pas ni ma mthong zhing rmongs pa'i don du /
translated: Here, the mind is primary.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi thig gdab pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi thig gdab pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: By “body, speech, mind, and so forth,” he teaches the drawing of the mandala lines and so forth for the purpose of those who have not seen and are confused.🔽“

original: rab bsgoms pa'i shes rab can gyis zhes pa sku la sogs pa'i lha'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rab bsgoms pa'i shes rab can gyis zhes pa sku la sogs pa'i lha'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The one who has well-cultivated wisdom” is the one who abides in the samadhi of the deities of body and so forth.

original: des cho ga dang ldan par thig gdab pa ni mtshon pa tsam ste gzhan dag kyang bya bar gsungs so //
analyzed: des cho ga dang ldan par thig gdab pa ni mtshon pa tsam ste gzhan dag kyang bya bar gsungs so //
translated: He teaches that the one who has the ritual should draw the lines, and that the others should also be done.

original: de la sar ba rab tu gtsang //
analyzed: de la sar ba rab tu gtsang //
translated: It is said to be very clean.

original: zhes pa gzhan la btab pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa gzhan la btab pa yin no //
translated: This is said to be for others.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi nyis 'gyur gyis ring thung dang sgo'i nyi shu'i chas spom phrar bya ba'i phyir tshang ma'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi nyis 'gyur gyis ring thung dang sgo'i nyi shu'i chas spom phrar bya ba'i phyir tshang ma'o //
translated: The length is twice the mandala, and the width is one-twentieth of the door.

original: mdzes pa ni shes rab mas legs par bkal pas mnyam pa dang 'jur mdud med pa'o /
analyzed: mdzes pa ni shes rab mas legs par bkal pas mnyam pa dang 'jur mdud med pa'o /
translated: Beautiful means even and without knots, well-woven by the wisdom woman.

original: @55b de yi khru ni bcu gnyis zhes pa rig ma'i lo grangs kyi tshad bstan pa tsam ste /
analyzed: @55b de yi khru ni bcu gnyis zhes pa rig ma'i lo grangs kyi tshad bstan pa tsam ste /
translated: The twelve cubits are merely an indication of the age of the knowledge woman.

original: ma nges pa nyi ma yin no //
analyzed: ma nges pa nyi ma yin no //
translated: The uncertain age is the sun.

original: lung las kyang /
analyzed: lung las kyang /
translated: It is also said in the scriptures:

original: shin tu phral sbyangs pa yis //
analyzed: shin tu phral sbyangs pa yis //
translated: By the very subtle training,

original: bsam yas dag la'ang de bzhin bya //🔽rig pas dpag pa tsam du'o //
analyzed: bsam yas dag la'ang de bzhin bya // rig pas dpag pa tsam du'o //
translated: it is the same for the inconceivable pure ones.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is merely an approximation by knowledge.

original: rnam par thar pa bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar ba brgyad la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir sgo bzhi zhes pa la sogs pa sta /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar ba brgyad la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir sgo bzhi zhes pa la sogs pa sta /
translated: The four doors and so forth are called doors because they possess the four liberations, the four immeasurables, the eight liberations, and so forth.

original: rta babs dang them skad dang tvar ma bzhi la sogs pas kyang mdzes par bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: rta babs dang them skad dang tvar ma bzhi la sogs pas kyang mdzes par bya bar mngon no //
translated: It is also beautified by the four doors, the four porticos, the four cornices, and so forth.

original: 'khor lo ni rab tu zlum zhes pa mu khyud zlum por bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'khor lo ni rab tu zlum zhes pa mu khyud zlum por bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The wheel is “very round,” which means that it is a circular rim.

original: de yang phyag rgya dgod pa ni rang rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya dgong pa ste /
analyzed: de yang phyag rgya dgod pa ni rang rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya dgong pa ste /
translated: As for the placement of the seals, one should place one’s own pledge seal.

original: zhal la sogs pa ni dgod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhal la sogs pa ni dgod par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not place the face and so forth.

original: de'i dbus rdo rje zhes pa thugs kyi rnam par dag pa'i rdo rje mi bskyod pa'i phyag mtshan rang gi gdan la bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus rdo rje zhes pa thugs kyi rnam par dag pa'i rdo rje mi bskyod pa'i phyag mtshan rang gi gdan la bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the middle of that, one should draw the vajra, which is the vajra of the purity of mind, the hand implement of Akṣobhya, on one’s own seat.

original: 'dir btsun mo rnams lhan cig tu sku'i ngo bor dgod par mi bya ste de mthong na dpya par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir btsun mo rnams lhan cig tu sku'i ngo bor dgod par mi bya ste de mthong na dpya par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here one should not place the queens together in the nature of the body, because if they were seen, they would be taxed.

original: de yang sam gra ha las /
analyzed: de yang sam gra ha las /
translated: In this regard, the Saṃgraha says:

original: mu stegs rnams la phan don du //
analyzed: mu stegs rnams la phan don du //
translated: For the benefit of the tīrthikas,

original: sangs rgyas bcun mo rab tu gsang //🔽zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcun mo rab tu gsang //🔽zhes gsungs la /
translated: the buddhas keep the queens very secret.

original: da ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan rnams kyang rang rang gi tshul dang mthun par zla ba dang nyi ma'i gdan la bri bar bya ba ni /
analyzed: da ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan rnams kyang rang rang gi tshul dang mthun par zla ba dang nyi ma'i gdan la bri bar bya ba ni /
translated: Now, the emblems of Vairocana and so on are also to be drawn on moon and sun seats in accordance with their respective styles.

original: 'khor lo chen po'i shar phyogs su //
analyzed: 'khor lo chen po'i shar phyogs su //
translated: In the east of the great wheel🔽,

original: zhes brtsams nas /
analyzed: zhes brtsams nas /
translated: having begun,

original: nan tan du ni mchod par bya //
analyzed: nan tan du ni mchod par bya //
translated: one should make offerings with earnest effort.🔽This is taught by the words ending with

original: zhes pa'i mthar thug pa'i tshig rnams kyis bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pa'i mthar thug pa'i tshig rnams kyis bstan to //
translated: The words that follow this line indicate the ultimate.🔽🔽

original: de la lus dang ngag sems mchod pa yis //
analyzed: de la lus dang ngag sems mchod pa yis //
translated: There, with the offering of body, speech, and mind🔽,

original: zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yi ge gsum gyis dbyung ba'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yi ge gsum gyis dbyung ba'i bya ba'o //
translated: the activity of emitting with the three syllables, which are the nature of body and so on, is performed.

original: des ni gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan me long dang / pi wang la sogs pa yang rang gi gnas ji lta ba bzhin zi bar bya'o //
analyzed: des ni gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan me long dang / pi wang la sogs pa yang rang gi gnas ji lta ba bzhin zi bar bya'o //
translated: By that, the emblems of Rūpavajrā and so on, such as the mirror, the lute, and so on, are also to be placed in their respective places.

original: de nas ni 'dod pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa drug dang / sa'i snying po la sogs pa phyung pa'i sngags med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de nas ni 'dod pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa drug dang / sa'i snying po la sogs pa phyung pa'i sngags med pa'i phyir na /
translated: Then, since the six beginning with Kāmarāja and the six beginning with Kṣitigarbha do not have the mantra for emitting,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi lha ma yin par mngon no //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi lha ma yin par mngon no //
translated: it is clear that they are not deities of the maṇḍala.

original: gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo drug 'byung ba las gyur pa des nan tan du mchod pa bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo drug 'byung ba las gyur pa des nan tan du mchod pa bya ba'o //
translated: The six goddesses, beginning with Rūpavajrā, arise from that, and one should worship them with effort.

original: da ni ri mo'i dkyil 'khor yid kyis sam rdul tshon gyis bris te /
analyzed: da ni ri mo'i dkyil 'khor yid kyis sam rdul tshon gyis bris te /
translated: Now, having drawn the maṇḍala with chalk or with colored powders,

original: bsgrub pa 'am dbang bskur pa gsungs @56a * //
analyzed: bsgrub pa 'am dbang bskur pa gsungs @56a * //
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares the means of accomplishment and consecration:

original: pa ; bud med ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: pa ; bud med ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “The woman,” and so on.

original: 'dir de dag gi don ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'dir de dag gi don ni 'di skad du /
translated: Here, the meaning of that is as follows:

original: rig ma gzugs dang lang tsho dang / yon tan dang ldan pa de las spyad na /
analyzed: rig ma gzugs dang lang tsho dang / yon tan dang ldan pa de las spyad na /
translated: Having practiced with that knowledge woman who is endowed with form, youth, and good qualities,

original: byang chub kyi sems ye shes su brtags te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ye shes su brtags te /
translated: the bodhicitta is imagined to be the gnosis.

original: rdo rjes padma phye bas bdag la sangs rgyas thim nas /
analyzed: rdo rjes padma phye bas bdag la sangs rgyas thim nas /
translated: The buddhas dissolve into oneself by the vajra opening the lotus.

original: brtan por byas te padma la gnas pa'i rang bzhin sbyor bas spro'o //
analyzed: brtan por byas te padma la gnas pa'i rang bzhin sbyor bas spro'o //
translated: Having stabilized that, one should emit the nature that abides in the lotus through union.

original: de nas rang gi mtshan brjod nas /
analyzed: de nas rang gi mtshan brjod nas /
translated: Then, having uttered one’s name,

original: bdag gis 'khor lo'i sbyor ba spro bar bya ste /
analyzed: bdag gis 'khor lo'i sbyor ba spro bar bya ste /
translated: “I will emit the union of the wheel.”

original: rdo rje dang padma'i sgras sangs rgyas rnams bskul nas dkyil 'khor du spyan drangs te /
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma'i sgras sangs rgyas rnams bskul nas dkyil 'khor du spyan drangs te /
translated: Having invoked the buddhas with the words “vajra” and “lotus,” one should invite them into the maṇḍala.

original: bgegs bskrad cing bsrungs te /
analyzed: bgegs bskrad cing bsrungs te /
translated: One should drive away the obstructors and guard.

original: so sor mchod yon phul te bstod nas /
analyzed: so sor mchod yon phul te bstod nas /
translated: Having offered a libation to each and praised,

original: sgo bzhi'i sgo srung gis las rnams byas nas nye bar bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: sgo bzhi'i sgo srung gis las rnams byas nas nye bar bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: the door guardians of the four doors should perform the activities and accomplish the near attainment.

original: byin gyis brlab cing mchod pa la sogs pa brtags nas sems can rnams kyi don grub par mdzod ces gsol ba gdab po zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab cing mchod pa la sogs pa brtags nas sems can rnams kyi don grub par mdzod ces gsol ba gdab po zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Having imagined the consecration, offerings, and so forth, one should request, “Please accomplish the welfare of sentient beings.”

original: sku dang gsung gtso bor gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor ni le'u bcu drug pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sku dang gsung gtso bor gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor ni le'u bcu drug pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: The maṇḍala that is primary for body and speech should be understood from chapter 16.

original: de dag gi don zhib tu ni le'u bcu gnyis pa'i yan lag bzhi'i skabs nas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi don zhib tu ni le'u bcu gnyis pa'i yan lag bzhi'i skabs nas shes par bya'o //
translated: Their meaning should be understood in detail in the section of the four limbs of chapter 12.

original: le'u bzhi pa'i don rdzogs so /
analyzed: le'u bzhi pa'i don rdzogs so /
translated: The meaning of chapter 4 is complete.🔽The Explanation of the Distinctive Practice

original: // / bsgrub pa'i khyad par la sogs pa gsungs pa de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: // / bsgrub pa'i khyad par la sogs pa gsungs pa de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o ;
translated: Now, the distinctive practice and so on are mentioned in the following.

original: / de la de nas ni ri mo'i dkyil 'khor gyi de ma thag go //
analyzed: / de la de nas ni ri mo'i dkyil 'khor gyi de ma thag go //
translated: Now means immediately after the maṇḍala of the painting.

original: rgyal po zhes pa rdo rje 'dzin pa ste //
analyzed: rgyal po zhes pa rdo rje 'dzin pa ste //
translated: The king is the vajra holder.

original: de sku gsung thugs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de sku gsung thugs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He possesses body, speech, and mind.

original: gnas kyi dbang phyug kun mchog gis //
analyzed: gnas kyi dbang phyug kun mchog gis //
translated: the best of all lords of the holy places

original: zhes pa'i tshig gnyis ni mi gnas pa mtha' gnyis las 'das pa'i mchog dang / mtha' gnyis la dbang sgyur pa'i don dang / tshogs gnyis rdzogs pa'i mchog dang / spyod ba kun gyi mchog dang / chos don rig pa'i mchog ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig gnyis ni mi gnas pa mtha' gnyis las 'das pa'i mchog dang / mtha' gnyis la dbang sgyur pa'i don dang / tshogs gnyis rdzogs pa'i mchog dang / spyod ba kun gyi mchog dang / chos don rig pa'i mchog ste /
translated: refer to the best of the non-abiding transcendence of the two extremes, the meaning of mastery over the two extremes, the best of the perfection of the two stores, the best of all practices, and the best of the knowledge of the meaning of the Dharma.

original: don de lnga dkyus dang rim par sbyar ro //
analyzed: don de lnga dkyus dang rim par sbyar ro //
translated: These five meanings are to be applied to the text and the sequence.

original: thams cad la spyod ba'i phyir spyod pa kun zhes te /
analyzed: thams cad la spyod ba'i phyir spyod pa kun zhes te /
translated: All practices means that one practices everything.

original: de bas na mchog gi chos kyang de /
analyzed: de bas na mchog gi chos kyang de /
translated: Therefore, the Dharma is the best.

original: 'on kyang de nyid pas mchog gi chos don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de nyid pas mchog gi chos don zhes bya'o //
translated: However, the meaning of the Dharma is the best by being the reality.

original: de kho na nyid la the tshom med pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog don zhes te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid la the tshom med pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog don zhes te /
translated: The meaning of non-conceptuality is because there is no doubt about reality.

original: de las byung ba ni 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug gi rigs can rnams de kho na nyid dang ldan pas 'grub par byed ces pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug gi rigs can rnams de kho na nyid dang ldan pas 'grub par byed ces pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: Arising from that means that those of the types of desire, hatred, and ignorance accomplish it by possessing reality.

original: rigs kyi nges pa sun @56b dbyung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs kyi nges pa sun @56b dbyung ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the determination of the type,

original: rigs ngan sme sha can la sogs //🔽zhes pa rnams te /
analyzed: rigs ngan sme sha can la sogs // zhes pa rnams te /
translated: The low-caste, the outcaste, and so on.

original: de la rigs ngan ba ni blang dor med pa'i dka' thub kyi bzod pa dang / re dogs med pa'i dka' thub kyi bzod pa dang / rigs kyi rlo ma sems med pa'i dka' thub kyi bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de la rigs ngan ba ni blang dor med pa'i dka' thub kyi bzod pa dang / re dogs med pa'i dka' thub kyi bzod pa dang / rigs kyi rlo ma sems med pa'i dka' thub kyi bzod pa'o //
translated: Among them, the low-caste are those who have the patience of the austerity of not accepting or rejecting, the patience of the austerity of not hoping or fearing, and the patience of the austerity of not thinking about the mind of lineage.

original: sme sha ni phyin ci log gi rtog pa spang ba dang / gsang chen rdzas kyi sme sha dang / mngon shes bsgrub pa'i sme sha can no //
analyzed: sme sha ni phyin ci log gi rtog pa spang ba dang / gsang chen rdzas kyi sme sha dang / mngon shes bsgrub pa'i sme sha can no //
translated: The outcaste is the one who abandons mistaken concepts, the outcaste of the great secret substance, and the outcaste who accomplishes clairvoyance.

original: sogs zhes pa rgyal rigs la sogs pa gang dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sogs zhes pa rgyal rigs la sogs pa gang dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The and so on includes those who possess the caste of a king and so on.

original: de dag gi don ni 'di skad du /🔽rigs ngan pa kha lo bde /
analyzed: de dag gi don ni 'di skad du / rigs ngan pa kha lo bde /
translated: The meaning of those is as follows.🔽The low-caste are easy to guide.

original: sme sha can rtul phod ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sme sha can rtul phod ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: The outcaste is courageous.

original: gsod pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig gsum ni rgyud 'di la mkhas pa dang / skal ba 'dir sbyangs pa dang / las kyi sgrub pa 'di la goms pas 'grub kyi phal gyis mi 'grub par mngon no //
analyzed: gsod pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig gsum ni rgyud 'di la mkhas pa dang / skal ba 'dir sbyangs pa dang / las kyi sgrub pa 'di la goms pas 'grub kyi phal gyis mi 'grub par mngon no //
translated: The three words beginning with killing indicate that this tantra is accomplished by those who are skilled in this tantra, those who have trained in this fortune, and those who are familiar with this practice of action, but not by ordinary people.

original: mtshams med ces pa 'bras bu'i ming brtags te /
analyzed: mtshams med ces pa 'bras bu'i ming brtags te /
translated: The term “immediate” is a designation of the result.🔽The five are the killing of one’s mother, father, or an arhat, causing a schism in the saṅgha, and injuring a buddha.

original: pha ma bsad pa la sogs pa lnga dang / sogs kyis mi dge ba bcu'o //
analyzed: pha ma bsad pa la sogs pa lnga dang / sogs kyis mi dge ba bcu'o //
translated: The “etc.” includes the ten unwholesome actions.

original: des kyang 'grub ce'o //
analyzed: des kyang 'grub ce'o //
translated: Even by those, one will succeed.

original: mi 'grub pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'grub pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is it that will not succeed?

original: snying nas slob dpon smod pa dag /
analyzed: snying nas slob dpon smod pa dag /
translated: Those who revile the master from the heart,

original: ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so forth.

original: 'dir slob dpon ni sngags pa ste 'di nyid las phyogs bcu dus gsum sangs rgyas pas /🔽slob dpon gyi pa spu'i bu ga gcig 'phags so zhes so //
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon ni sngags pa ste 'di nyid las phyogs bcu dus gsum sangs rgyas pas / slob dpon gyi pa spu'i bu ga gcig 'phags so zhes so //
translated: Here, the master is the mantrin, because in this very [tantra] it says, “The master is superior to the buddhas of the ten directions and three times.”

original: des ni bla ma khur pas 'grub po zhes mngon no //
analyzed: des ni bla ma khur pas 'grub po zhes mngon no //
translated: Therefore, it is clear that one will succeed by carrying the guru on one’s head.

original: srog gcod ba'i zhes pa rnams /
analyzed: srog gcod ba'i zhes pa rnams /
translated: The “etc.” includes the ten unwholesome actions.

original: yang dag par bdag dang bdag gi la sogs pa yul dang yul can rnams med de /
analyzed: yang dag par bdag dang bdag gi la sogs pa yul dang yul can rnams med de /
translated: The objects and subjects, such as self and mine, are utterly nonexistent.

original: de rnams kyi don ni lung las /
analyzed: de rnams kyi don ni lung las /
translated: The meaning of those is stated in the scriptures:

original: srog med srog bcad du med //
analyzed: srog med srog bcad du med //
translated: There is no life, no killing.

original: ces pa nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: ces pa nas brtsams nas /
translated: Beginning from here,

original: chags mchog rgyal po yin zhes pa'i mtha'i bar du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chags mchog rgyal po yin zhes pa'i mtha'i bar du rig par bya'o //
translated: one should understand up to the end, “The supreme attachment is the king.”

original: ma dang srid mo bu mo la //
analyzed: ma dang srid mo bu mo la //
translated: To one’s mother, sister, or daughter,

original: zhes pa / 'das pa dang da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i gzung sa ma rim bzhin te /
analyzed: zhes pa / 'das pa dang da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i gzung sa ma rim bzhin te /
translated: the three times of the past, present, and future are in order.

original: yum la spyod pa'i 'dod pas ni //
analyzed: yum la spyod pa'i 'dod pas ni //
translated: The one who practices with the mother

original: gong ma rnams ni mnyes byas na //
analyzed: gong ma rnams ni mnyes byas na //
translated: pleases the higher ones.

original: zhe'o // gtso bo'i yum zhes ba spyan ma la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhe'o // gtso bo'i yum zhes ba spyan ma la sogs pa ste /
translated: The principal mother is Locanā and so forth.

original: rang gi bud med de'i bdag nyid la spod pa'i cho ga ji lta bas so //
analyzed: rang gi bud med de'i bdag nyid la spod pa'i cho ga ji lta bas so //
translated: One should practice with one’s own woman, whose nature is that of the mother.

original: de gang gis bya ba ni /
analyzed: de gang gis bya ba ni /
translated: By whom is that done?

original: mi rtog blo can gyis zhes te /
analyzed: mi rtog blo can gyis zhes te /
translated: By the one with a nonconceptual mind.

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum gyis rnam pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i mkhas pas shes pa yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum gyis rnam pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i mkhas pas shes pa yin no //
translated: The wise one who possesses the gnosis of nonduality through the three samādhis should know it.

original: de ni gong du yang sbyar @57a * //
analyzed: de ni gong du yang sbyar @57a * //
translated: That is also applied above.

original: ro ; / da ni ji ltar 'dod pa'i sngon du ma gtogs pa'i nyan pa po rnams ngan song du lhung ngo zhes bsams nas glan ka brtsal ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: ro ; / da ni ji ltar 'dod pa'i sngon du ma gtogs pa'i nyan pa po rnams ngan song du lhung ngo zhes bsams nas glan ka brtsal ba gsungs pa /
translated: Now, thinking that the listeners who were not included before desire this, and seeking an opportunity, he says,

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Then,” and so forth.

original: de la ngo mtshar ba ni ma thos pa'i chos dang / rdzas kyi mtshan nyid dang / bsgrub pa'i gzungs dang / phas pham pa'i chos bzhi la ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: de la ngo mtshar ba ni ma thos pa'i chos dang / rdzas kyi mtshan nyid dang / bsgrub pa'i gzungs dang / phas pham pa'i chos bzhi la ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: The amazing is the Dharma that has not been heard, the characteristics of substance, the dhāraṇī of practice, and the four defeats.

original: ngo mtshar che bar gleng ba'i glan ka spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo mtshar che bar gleng ba'i glan ka spang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to abandon the opportunity for criticism of the amazing,

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says “then” and so on.

original: mi shes pa'i chos nyid kyis shin tu thob par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir na mthong zhes so //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i chos nyid kyis shin tu thob par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir na mthong zhes so //
translated: Since the nature of the unknown is extremely difficult to attain, it is said to be seen.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ye shes dang ldan pa'i chos nyid 'di rnam par mi rtog pa'i don gang yin pa de las byung zhes pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ye shes dang ldan pa'i chos nyid 'di rnam par mi rtog pa'i don gang yin pa de las byung zhes pa'o //
translated: This nature endowed with the wisdom of emptiness is said to arise from the meaning of nonconceptuality.

original: de'i phyir gong gi rnam par mi rtog pa las byung ba zhes pa gzhan du yang sbyor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gong gi rnam par mi rtog pa las byung ba zhes pa gzhan du yang sbyor bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the above “arising from nonconceptuality” should be applied elsewhere as well.

original: zab mo'i don la 'jigs par mthong nas /
analyzed: zab mo'i don la 'jigs par mthong nas /
translated: Seeing fear in the profound meaning,

original: rgyal ba ni de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba ni de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: the Victorious One says “then” and so on.

original: de la nam mkha' dang mnyam pa ni de dang 'dra pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la nam mkha' dang mnyam pa ni de dang 'dra pa'i don to //
translated: There, “equal to space” means having the same meaning.

original: de nyid gnyis su med de /
analyzed: de nyid gnyis su med de /
translated: That is nondual,

original: mi phyed pa'i phyir na rdo rje ye shes kyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i phyir na rdo rje ye shes kyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes 'brel to //
translated: because it is indivisible, he entered into the meditative concentration of the vajra intuition.

original: des bstod nas rang rang gi stan la gnas par gsungs pa zhugs ma thag tu zhes te /
analyzed: des bstod nas rang rang gi stan la gnas par gsungs pa zhugs ma thag tu zhes te /
translated: Having praised him, they sat down on their respective seats.

original: gnas par gyur to zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: gnas par gyur to zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: Having entered, they became situated.

original: don de nyid kyis rangs par gyur te mchod par brjod pa ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: don de nyid kyis rangs par gyur te mchod par brjod pa ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Delighted by that very meaning, they expressed their worship with “Then, ” and so forth.

original: ae ma ho chos ae ma'o chos zhes pa ngo mtshar ba'i dbang gis sngags tshig gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ae ma ho chos ae ma'o chos zhes pa ngo mtshar ba'i dbang gis sngags tshig gsungs pa'o //
translated: “Amazing Dharma! Amazing Dharma!” is the statement of the mantra words by the power of amazement.

original: de nas 'byung ba zhes pa /
analyzed: de nas 'byung ba zhes pa /
translated: Then, the arising

original: dpe ji bzhin pa'i ngo bo yin yang ;
analyzed: dpe ji bzhin pa'i ngo bo yin yang ;
translated: is the nature just like the example,

original: mtshams med pa la sogs pa dang / gzungs dang phas pham pa'i chos dang gsum 'byung pa'i zhes ngo mtshar te /
analyzed: mtshams med pa la sogs pa dang / gzungs dang phas pham pa'i chos dang gsum 'byung pa'i zhes ngo mtshar te /
translated: but it is amazing that the three arise: the five heinous crimes, and so forth, the dhāraṇī, and the grounds of defeat.

original: de'i phyir chos zhes pa gsum brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos zhes pa gsum brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the three Dharmas are stated.

original: des ni slob dpon gyi phyogs snga ma la gnod pa byas so //
analyzed: des ni slob dpon gyi phyogs snga ma la gnod pa byas so //
translated: That refutes the opponent’s position.

original: rnam par mi 'gyur zhes pa /
analyzed: rnam par mi 'gyur zhes pa /
translated: “Unchanging” means

original: ye shes gyis ngang can de la dngos po'i snang ba med ces so //
analyzed: ye shes gyis ngang can de la dngos po'i snang ba med ces so //
translated: that in that state of gnosis, the appearance of entities does not exist.

original: dbyings zhes pa rgyu'i don to //
analyzed: dbyings zhes pa rgyu'i don to //
translated: “Dhatu” means the meaning of cause.

original: sku las rab tu byung zhes pa'i tshigs gsum gyi sa ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku dang / yi ge med pa'i gsung dang / mi rtog pa'i thugs de'i bdag nyid ces so //
analyzed: sku las rab tu byung zhes pa'i tshigs gsum gyi sa ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku dang / yi ge med pa'i gsung dang / mi rtog pa'i thugs de'i bdag nyid ces so //
translated: The three lines beginning “arising from the body” mean that it is the nature of the essence body, the speech of the absence of syllables, and the mind of nonconceptuality.

original: sngags thams cad kyi mchog ces pa @57b gnyis su med pa'i don te /
analyzed: sngags thams cad kyi mchog ces pa @57b gnyis su med pa'i don te /
translated: “The supreme of all mantras” means the meaning of nonduality.

original: sngags kyi spyod pa ni spyod pa'i mchog go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sngags kyi spyod pa ni spyod pa'i mchog go zhes gsungs so //
translated: The conduct of mantra is the supreme conduct.

original: le'u lnga pa'i don rdzogs so /
analyzed: le'u lnga pa'i don rdzogs so /
translated: The meaning of chapter five is complete.

original: // / da ni sku gsung thugs byin gyis rlob pa'i sngags dang / bsgrub pa dang / phra mo'i don rnams bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / da ni sku gsung thugs byin gyis rlob pa'i sngags dang / bsgrub pa dang / phra mo'i don rnams bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the mantras, the practice, and the meaning of the subtle for the consecration of body, speech, and mind,

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it says “then,” and so on.

original: da ni mi bskyod pa zhes bya ba ni thugs nyid kyi phyir ston pa por gsungs so //
analyzed: da ni mi bskyod pa zhes bya ba ni thugs nyid kyi phyir ston pa por gsungs so //
translated: Now, “Akshobhya” is said to be the teacher because of being the mind itself.

original: gsang ba ni rdo rje gsum nyid do //
analyzed: gsang ba ni rdo rje gsum nyid do //
translated: “Secret” is the three vajras.

original: de ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa ste /
translated: That is the aspect of emptiness.

original: de la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: de la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: Having entered into union with that,

original: phyi ma dang 'brel to //
analyzed: phyi ma dang 'brel to //
translated: he is connected with the future.

original: thugs byin gyis rlob pa'i zhes pa snying ga'i zla ba las ral pa'i dbu rgyan can thugs kyi rdo rje ste /
analyzed: thugs byin gyis rlob pa'i zhes pa snying ga'i zla ba las ral pa'i dbu rgyan can thugs kyi rdo rje ste /
translated: The consecration of the mind is the vajra of the mind, which is the crest-jewel on the moon at the heart.

original: de'i byin gyis rlob pa'i sngags zhes so //
analyzed: de'i byin gyis rlob pa'i sngags zhes so //
translated: The consecration mantra of that is the consecration of the mind.

original: des phyi ma la yang tshig rnam par bsgyur nas sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: des phyi ma la yang tshig rnam par bsgyur nas sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: By that, the future should be connected with the words transformed.

original: rdul dang bral pa'i don ni me long lta bu'i rnam pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la snang mdzad kyi tshul gyis so //
analyzed: rdul dang bral pa'i don ni me long lta bu'i rnam pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la snang mdzad kyi tshul gyis so //
translated: The meaning of being free from dust is the vajra-like samadhi, which has the aspect of the mirror-like [wisdom].

original: so sor rtog pa'i rnam pa ni mi gnyis pa'i rdo rje zhes pa ste /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i rnam pa ni mi gnyis pa'i rdo rje zhes pa ste /
translated: The aspect of discrimination is the non-dual vajra.

original: de la tshe dpag tu med pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: de la tshe dpag tu med pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: In that, he is in the manner of Amitayus.

original: de dag gi thabs kyis thabs su shes pa /
analyzed: de dag gi thabs kyis thabs su shes pa /
translated: The knowledge of the method by those methods is the method.

original: rang gi lha mo dang 'dra bar snying po'i rig ma sprul te /
analyzed: rang gi lha mo dang 'dra bar snying po'i rig ma sprul te /
translated: Having emanated the essence-knowledge-woman, who is like one's own goddess,

original: de'i mgo dang gsang ba la sogs par de kho na nyid shes pa sa aom la sogs pa zla pa'i dkyil 'khor la bkod de /
analyzed: de'i mgo dang gsang ba la sogs par de kho na nyid shes pa sa aom la sogs pa zla pa'i dkyil 'khor la bkod de /
translated: In the head, secret place, etc. of that [deity], one should visualize the moon mandala with the syllable om, etc.

original: de las gyur pa rnams gnas su bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gyur pa rnams gnas su bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the deities arisen from that in their respective places.

original: de'i gsang bar h'um las gyur pa'i padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bsams te /
analyzed: de'i gsang bar h'um las gyur pa'i padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bsams te /
translated: In the secret place of that [deity], one should visualize an eight-petaled lotus arisen from the syllable hūṃ.

original: de dang lhan cig tu bde bar gshegs pa rnams shin tu chags par bgyi zhes so //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu bde bar gshegs pa rnams shin tu chags par bgyi zhes so //
translated: Together with that, one should arouse intense passion in the Sugatas.

original: de kho na rjes su chags pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de kho na rjes su chags pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: That is the nature of passion.

original: rdo rje sgron ma ni mnyam pa nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sgron ma ni mnyam pa nyid kyi'o //
translated: The vajra lamp is for the sameness [aspect].

original: gdon mi za ba zhes pa ni bya ba nan tan gyi'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za ba zhes pa ni bya ba nan tan gyi'o //
translated: The inevitable is for the performance [aspect].

original: gong du rjes su chags pa'i mthu las dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad dmigs te /
analyzed: gong du rjes su chags pa'i mthu las dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad dmigs te /
translated: Above, one should visualize all the deities of the mandala through the power of passion.

original: phyi nang gi mchod pa 'phros pas mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi nang gi mchod pa 'phros pas mchod par bya'o //
translated: One should make offerings by emanating outer and inner offerings.

original: zhes mdor bsdus so //
analyzed: zhes mdor bsdus so //
translated: That is the brief [explanation].

original: da ni sku la sogs pa'i byin gyis lus ngag yid rlob par byed pa bde bar gshegs pa bskul ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni sku la sogs pa'i byin gyis lus ngag yid rlob par byed pa bde bar gshegs pa bskul ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, the consecration of body, speech, and mind by the consecration of body, etc. , is stated by the invocation of the Sugatas, etc. , “Then” and so forth.

original: sngags la dmigs pa'i zhes pa lha'i dkyil 'khor la ting nge 'dzin dmigs pa ni nges pa'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: sngags la dmigs pa'i zhes pa lha'i dkyil 'khor la ting nge 'dzin dmigs pa ni nges pa'i bsam gtan no //
translated: “ Focused on the mantra” means that the focus of the meditative concentration on the deity maṇḍala is the definite meditative concentration.

original: de'i lus zhes pa bsam gtan de'i tshul gyi sa bon las byung ba lha mo'i 'od @58a * //
analyzed: de'i lus zhes pa bsam gtan de'i tshul gyi sa bon las byung ba lha mo'i 'od @58a * //
translated: “ Its body” means that the deity goddess arises from the seed of that meditative concentration.

original: zer zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zer zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “rays” is light.

original: ngag gis zhes pa badzra dhrik la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: ngag gis zhes pa badzra dhrik la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: “ By speech” means by vajradhātvīśvarī, etc.🔽“ The mantras” means the mantras of Vajradhātvīśvarī, etc.

original: sngags rnams kyi phyag rgya chen por gsal ba ni yid kyis zhes so //🔽de lta na yang blos dbye bar mi bya ste /🔽de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: sngags rnams kyi phyag rgya chen por gsal ba ni yid kyis zhes so // de lta na yang blos dbye bar mi bya ste / de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: “ The great seal” means the great seal of the deity.🔽“ Manifesting” means appearing.

original: sems la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ By the mind” means by the mind of the deity.🔽“ In that way” means in the way that has been stated.🔽“ One should not differentiate” means that one should not differentiate the mind of the deity.🔽“ One should not differentiate” means that one should not differentiate the mind of the deity.

original: sbyor ba rnam pa gsum zhes pa sku la sogs pa'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba rnam pa gsum zhes pa sku la sogs pa'i rnam pas so //
translated: “ The three kinds of yoga” means the yoga of body, etc.

original: lus la sogs pa sku la sogs par dmigs na de'i ngo bo nyid ni dmigs su med do //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa sku la sogs par dmigs na de'i ngo bo nyid ni dmigs su med do //
translated: If the body and so forth are observed as the body and so forth, their very essence is not observed.

original: de'i phyir na sngags kyi lus su shes te /
analyzed: de'i phyir na sngags kyi lus su shes te /
translated: Therefore, one should know the body as the mantra body.

original: dbyer med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis /
analyzed: dbyer med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis /
translated: By the very essence of inseparability,

original: byang chub med cing bsgom pa'ang med //
