original: sangs rgyas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Buddha, and so on.

original: de la sangs rgyas ni snang mdzad nyid do //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas ni snang mdzad nyid do //
translated: Therein, Buddha is Vairocana himself.

original: chos zhes pa snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: chos zhes pa snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: Dharma is Amitābha.

original: mi bskyod pa ni rdo rje zhes te /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa ni rdo rje zhes te /
translated: Aksobhya is Vajra.

original: de dag gi rjes su dran pa ni 'dris pa'i dngos po mi brjed pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rjes su dran pa ni 'dris pa'i dngos po mi brjed pa ste /
translated: Recollection of them is not forgetting the familiar thing,

original: sems kyis mngon par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyis mngon par brjod pa'o //
translated: which is mental expression.

original: rigs ni gcig dang gsum dang lnga rnams kyi don bsgom pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rigs ni gcig dang gsum dang lnga rnams kyi don bsgom pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Family means the sense of meditating on the one, the three, and the five.

original: khro bo ni gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: khro bo ni gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Wrathful means the form of Yamantaka and so forth.

original: lha'i zhes pa /
analyzed: lha'i zhes pa /
translated: Divine means

original: rnam pa gzhan bsgoms nas thob pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan bsgoms nas thob pa'i don to //
translated: the sense of attaining by meditating on another aspect.

original: bud med ni bsgrub pa ni mo'i gzungs ma mtshan dang ldan pa la /
analyzed: bud med ni bsgrub pa ni mo'i gzungs ma mtshan dang ldan pa la /
translated: Woman means the accomplishment of the qualified knowledge consort.

original: sku gsung thugs kyis byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyis byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: Empowerment means the empowerment of body, speech, and mind.

original: gang du zhe na gnas gsum mo //
analyzed: gang du zhe na gnas gsum mo //
translated: Where? In the three places.

original: mchod pa brtsams pa ni sbyor pa'i cho ga gang yin pas so //
analyzed: mchod pa brtsams pa ni sbyor pa'i cho ga gang yin pas so //
translated: The performance of worship is the ritual action of union.

original: btsun mo spyan la sogs pa ni rang gi rig ma la'o //
analyzed: btsun mo spyan la sogs pa ni rang gi rig ma la'o //
translated: Queen means the eyes and so forth of one's knowledge consort.

original: de'i sbyor ba'i cho gas 'grub pa ni bsnyen pa'o //🔽rdo rje dang padma gnyis h'um las @60a * //
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba'i cho gas 'grub pa ni bsnyen pa'o // rdo rje dang padma gnyis h'um las @60a * //
translated: The accomplishment by the ritual action of union is the approach.

original: yongs su bskyed pa la /
analyzed: yongs su bskyed pa la /
translated: The two, the vajra and the lotus, are fully generated from hūṃ.

original: aom ni sa bon gyi rkyen no //
analyzed: aom ni sa bon gyi rkyen no //
translated: The seed condition is oṃ.

original: de la yi ge phat mdog ser pos byang chub sems 'byung ba dgag pa'i las khyad par gyi ngo bos bskyod pa de ni bde ba chen po des sgrub par byed pas na sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de la yi ge phat mdog ser pos byang chub sems 'byung ba dgag pa'i las khyad par gyi ngo bos bskyod pa de ni bde ba chen po des sgrub par byed pas na sgrub pa'o //
translated: In that, the yellow-colored syllable PHAṬ has the function of stopping the arising of bodhicitta, and that is the special nature of the movement. Since that is accomplished by that great bliss, it is the “accomplishment.”

original: rdo rje padmo zhes pa gsang pa'i rdo rje padma la lhan cig tu zhugs pa'i de ma thag gang yang dag par rig pa de ni nye pa'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje padmo zhes pa gsang pa'i rdo rje padma la lhan cig tu zhugs pa'i de ma thag gang yang dag par rig pa de ni nye pa'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: The “vajra lotus” is the secret vajra and lotus. The perfect knowledge that is immediately present in their union is the “near accomplishment.”

original: 'bar bcas zhes pa gang bde ba chen po 'byung ba de ni sgrub pa chen po'o //
analyzed: 'bar bcas zhes pa gang bde ba chen po 'byung ba de ni sgrub pa chen po'o //
translated: “With flame” is that which arises as great bliss. That is the “great accomplishment.”

original: de dag gi ni tshig gi snyan dngags la mkhas pa nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: de dag gi ni tshig gi snyan dngags la mkhas pa nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: Since they are skilled in the poetry of words,

original: tshigs bcad sdebs pa'i ngor shugs kyis smras pa ni ma yin gyi don nyid de ltar yin no //
analyzed: tshigs bcad sdebs pa'i ngor shugs kyis smras pa ni ma yin gyi don nyid de ltar yin no //
translated: it is not that they are spoken by the force of the arrangement of the verses; the meaning is just like that.

original: da ni gong du gsungs pa'i rjes su dran pa rnam pa bcu drug tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid du ma bstan pa'i phyir /🔽de la zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni gong du gsungs pa'i rjes su dran pa rnam pa bcu drug tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid du ma bstan pa'i phyir /🔽de la zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the definition of the sixteen aspects of the aforementioned recollections,🔽it is said, “Therein, the recollection of the buddhas is the essence of the buddhas, the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses.”

original: de la sangs rgyas zhes pa snang mdzad de /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas zhes pa snang mdzad de /
translated: Buddha is Vairocana.

original: yum gyi bha ga la yab rang gi ling+ga gzhag go //
analyzed: yum gyi bha ga la yab rang gi ling+ga gzhag go //
translated: The father places his liṅga in the bhaga of the mother.

original: de'i khyad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i khyad par gsungs pa /
translated: The special feature is stated:

original: gzugs ni zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs ni zhes pa ste /
translated: Form and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams thim pa la sogs pa rnams sngon du byas te rang gi rig ma'i gsang pa'i sna rtse la sa bon bskyed pa'i /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams thim pa la sogs pa rnams sngon du byas te rang gi rig ma'i gsang pa'i sna rtse la sa bon bskyed pa'i /
translated: Having performed the dissolution and so on of the tathāgatas, one should generate the seed at the tip of the secret organ of one's knowledge consort.

original: aom las gyur pa'i 'khor lo'i lte ba la rnam par snang mdzad gtso bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: aom las gyur pa'i 'khor lo'i lte ba la rnam par snang mdzad gtso bor gyur pa'o //
translated: From the oṃ, the wheel arises, and in the center of the wheel, Vairocana is the principal one.

original: de'i ba spu'i bu gnas spro zhes pa mtshon pa tsam ste bsdu ba yang bdag gis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i ba spu'i bu gnas spro zhes pa mtshon pa tsam ste bsdu ba yang bdag gis shes par bya'o //
translated: The phrase the emanation of the pores is merely an illustration; one should understand the gathering as well.

original: slar bsdu ba'i dus su mchod pa rnams spro ste /
analyzed: slar bsdu ba'i dus su mchod pa rnams spro ste /
translated: At the time of gathering back, one emanates the offerings.

original: mchod pa la sogs pa rnams bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mchod pa la sogs pa rnams bya ba yin no //
translated: One should perform the offerings and so on.

original: de dag ni 'og ma rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'og ma rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: These should be applied to the following as well.

original: dam tshig rjes su dran pa zhes pa lha'i rab tu dbye ba ste /
analyzed: dam tshig rjes su dran pa zhes pa lha'i rab tu dbye ba ste /
translated: The recollection of the commitments is the classification of the deities.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid bsgoms nas lha rnams thim par bya'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid bsgoms nas lha rnams thim par bya'o //
translated: Having meditated on the nature of method and wisdom, the deities should be caused to dissolve.

original: de nyid las dbye ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid las dbye ba ni /
translated: The divisions of that are:

original: dkyil 'khor rjes su dran pa ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rjes su dran pa ste /
translated: the recollection of the mandala,🔽and the recollection of sentient beings.

original: bdag gi khu ba bdag gi khu ba bdag ces pa ni dbyung zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: bdag gi khu ba bdag gi khu ba bdag ces pa ni dbyung zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: One’s own semen, one’s own semen, one’s own, is connected with “emit.”

original: des bskyed pa'i dkyil 'khor yang dbyung bar bya zhes dkyil 'khor gzhan dang gzhan du spro pa'i bdag nyid rnams ni zlum po'i tshul zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: des bskyed pa'i dkyil 'khor yang dbyung bar bya zhes dkyil 'khor gzhan dang gzhan du spro pa'i bdag nyid rnams ni zlum po'i tshul zhes pa yin no //
translated: The mandala generated by that should also be emitted. The nature of the emanations into other and other mandalas is the mode of the circle.

original: gong du sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams bsgom zhes pa las dbye ba ni sku rjes su @60b dran pa la sogs pa gsum gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gong du sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams bsgom zhes pa las dbye ba ni sku rjes su @60b dran pa la sogs pa gsum gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: From “having meditated on the body, speech, and mind above,” the division is the nature of the three, the recollection of the body, and so on.

original: sku gang yin pa de ni rnam par dag pa'i gzugs la sogs pas rab tu rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: sku gang yin pa de ni rnam par dag pa'i gzugs la sogs pas rab tu rgyas pa'o //
translated: The body is the expansion of pure form and so on.

original: phyi ma dang yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: phyi ma dang yang sbyar ro //
translated: It is also connected with the latter.

original: thugs las rab tu dbye ba ni sems can rjes su dran pa yin no //
analyzed: thugs las rab tu dbye ba ni sems can rjes su dran pa yin no //
translated: The division of the mind is the recollection of sentient beings.

original: sku la sogs pa'i rjes su dran pa dbye bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i rjes su dran pa dbye bar gsungs pa /
translated: is taught as a division.

original: de la sngags zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la sngags zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therein, the “mantra” is the body, etc.

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin ni sku la sogs pa rnams te /🔽de rnams kyi rjes su dran pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin ni sku la sogs pa rnams te / de rnams kyi rjes su dran pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: The nature of form is the body, etc.

original: sngags kyi bdag nyid kyi /
analyzed: sngags kyi bdag nyid kyi /
translated: The cultivation of the recollection of those is the recollection of the mantra.🔽The body of the one who has the vajra nature of the mantra

original: rdo rje can gyi sku gang yin pa de ni byin gyis brlab pa'i tshigs bcad dang / sngags rnams kyis bsgom pa ni gsungs zhes te /
analyzed: rdo rje can gyi sku gang yin pa de ni byin gyis brlab pa'i tshigs bcad dang / sngags rnams kyis bsgom pa ni gsungs zhes te /
translated: is taught as the meditation of the verses of consecration and the mantras.

original: de yang sku yis zhes pa rnam pa'i ste /
analyzed: de yang sku yis zhes pa rnam pa'i ste /
translated: Moreover, “by the body” is the aspect.

original: des bsgom pas zhes so //
analyzed: des bsgom pas zhes so //
translated: The meditation by that is said.

original: de 'dra zhes pa'i sku 'gyur zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de 'dra zhes pa'i sku 'gyur zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The body like that is transformed.

original: gong ma rnams la yang rnam par bsgyur nas sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gong ma rnams la yang rnam par bsgyur nas sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply this to the above as well, having changed the form.

original: de la dam tshig ces pa smos pa ni dam tshig rjes su dran pa nyid 'dir dbye'o //
analyzed: de la dam tshig ces pa smos pa ni dam tshig rjes su dran pa nyid 'dir dbye'o //
translated: Therein, the mention of “commitment” is the recollection of the commitment itself, which is divided here.

original: khu ba phyung ste cho ga bzhin //
analyzed: khu ba phyung ste cho ga bzhin //
translated: Having emitted the seminal essence, one should drink it according to the rite.

original: zhes pa rang rang gi rig ma dang ldan pa la sbyor pa'i cho gas btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa rang rang gi rig ma dang ldan pa la sbyor pa'i cho gas btung bar bya'o //
translated: One should drink it by the rite of union with one’s own knowledge woman.

original: de sus dgos she na /
analyzed: de sus dgos she na /
translated: Who needs that?

original: 'bras bu 'dod pas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dod pas so //
translated: One who desires the result.

original: thugs las dbye ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: thugs las dbye ba gsungs pa /
translated: The division of the mind is stated

original: de la shes rab kyi zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: beginning with “There, the wisdom . . .”

original: ma skyes pa zhes pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis te /
analyzed: ma skyes pa zhes pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis te /
translated: “Unborn” means by nature,

original: yul dang yul can gyi rang bzhin kyang med la /
analyzed: yul dang yul can gyi rang bzhin kyang med la /
translated: and there is no object and subject,

original: khams kyang med cing 'byung ba lnga yang med do //
analyzed: khams kyang med cing 'byung ba lnga yang med do //
translated: and there are no elements and no five elements.

original: de la ma skyes pa zhes pa thugs kyis dbye ba ste /
analyzed: de la ma skyes pa zhes pa thugs kyis dbye ba ste /
translated: There, “unborn” is the division of the mind.

original: gnyis med ces pa yang dag par gnyis su snang ba'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa can med de /
analyzed: gnyis med ces pa yang dag par gnyis su snang ba'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa can med de /
translated: “Nondual” means that there is no conceptual consciousness that is a correct appearance of duality,

original: nam mkha' bzhin du dbyer med pa kho na nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du dbyer med pa kho na nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is only the indivisibility of reality, like space.

original: zhe sdang gi rigs zhes pa la sogs pa ni rigs bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi rigs zhes pa la sogs pa ni rigs bsgom pa ste /
translated: “The family of anger” and so forth is the meditation on the family.

original: bud med sngags kyis mtshan pa la rigs gang yin pa'i sbyor ba bya ste /
analyzed: bud med sngags kyis mtshan pa la rigs gang yin pa'i sbyor ba bya ste /
translated: One should practice with a woman marked with the mantra of the family.

original: de'i khu pa sa mchod pas sku gsung thugs kyi 'bras bu tshe 'di la zhes te /
analyzed: de'i khu pa sa mchod pas sku gsung thugs kyi 'bras bu tshe 'di la zhes te /
translated: By worshipping with her menstrual discharge, the result of body, speech, and mind is in this life.

original: gnyis su med pa'i sgo nas lam nye bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i sgo nas lam nye bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: The path is taught in terms of non-duality.

original: de rnams ni rigs rjes su dran pa las dbye bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams ni rigs rjes su dran pa las dbye bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: These are taught as the divisions of the recollection of the family.

original: de'i byin rlabs gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i byin rlabs gsungs pa /
translated: The blessing of those is stated:

original: gang gzhan zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gzhan zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Whatever other” and so forth.

original: de la phra mo ni mi snang ba dang dzam bha la bsgrub pa dang / @61a * //
analyzed: de la phra mo ni mi snang ba dang dzam bha la bsgrub pa dang / @61a * //
translated: Therein, the subtle is the accomplishment of the invisible and Jambhala,

original: aanydza li sa mig mthong ba dang / rig 'dzin la sogs pa thun mong gi bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: aanydza li sa mig mthong ba dang / rig 'dzin la sogs pa thun mong gi bsgrub pa ste /
translated: the eye ointment of Anjana, and the common accomplishment of the knowledge-holders and so forth.

original: de rnams kyang mchog gi dngos grub gyi don gyis 'grub bo zhes mngon no //
analyzed: de rnams kyang mchog gi dngos grub gyi don gyis 'grub bo zhes mngon no //
translated: Those are also accomplished by the meaning of the supreme accomplishment, it is clear.

original: de dag rnams ni spros pa la sogs pa'i cho ga gang yin pas so //
analyzed: de dag rnams ni spros pa la sogs pa'i cho ga gang yin pas so //
translated: Those are whatever rites of elaboration and so forth there are.

original: le'u bdun pa'i don rdzogs so /
analyzed: le'u bdun pa'i don rdzogs so /
translated: The meaning of the seventh chapter is complete.

original: // / da ni bshang gci dam tshig gi le'u bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / da ni bshang gci dam tshig gi le'u bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the chapter on the commitments of feces and urine,

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te de la dbang phyug dam pa zhes pa stong pa nyid dang ldan pa ste de la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te de la dbang phyug dam pa zhes pa stong pa nyid dang ldan pa ste de la'o //
translated: it says “thereafter” and so forth. Therein, “the best of lords” is endowed with emptiness, and that is the meaning.

original: de nyid rdo rje rgyal po zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje rgyal po zhes pa nas /
translated: That is the vajra king,🔽up to the vajra vehicle.

original: rdo rje theg pa la'o zhes pa'i bar du mchod par brjod pa'i don bzhi dang sbyar te /
analyzed: rdo rje theg pa la'o zhes pa'i bar du mchod par brjod pa'i don bzhi dang sbyar te /
translated: The meaning of the four praises is applied:

original: rdo rje dbyings su sangs rgyas pa'i rgyal mchog mchod pa dang / dag pa mnyam pa'i mchod pa dang / thar lam rtogs pa'i mchod pa dang / shes rab spyan gyi tshogs kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i mchod pa dang bzhi ste /
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings su sangs rgyas pa'i rgyal mchog mchod pa dang / dag pa mnyam pa'i mchod pa dang / thar lam rtogs pa'i mchod pa dang / shes rab spyan gyi tshogs kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i mchod pa dang bzhi ste /
translated: the praise of the supreme victor who is enlightened in the vajra realm, the praise of the equality of purity, the praise of the realization of the path of liberation, and the praise of the wheel of the gaṇacakra of the eye of wisdom.

original: de rnams tshigs bcad bzhi dang / rim bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de rnams tshigs bcad bzhi dang / rim bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: Those are applied in order to the four verses.

original: zhus pa'i de ma thag len gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhus pa'i de ma thag len gsungs pa /
translated: The reply to the request is stated:

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, etc.

original: kun dbang ni dbang bskur ba'i don gyis rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid rin chen 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: kun dbang ni dbang bskur ba'i don gyis rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid rin chen 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The lord of all is the vajra holder himself, the jewel holder by the meaning of the consecration.

original: de'i mchod pa'i mchog ni gsang ba'i mchod pa la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: de'i mchod pa'i mchog ni gsang ba'i mchod pa la sogs pa'o ;
translated: His supreme praise is the secret praise, etc.

original: / sku gsung thugs rdo rje ltar mi phyed gsum gnas pa'o //
analyzed: / sku gsung thugs rdo rje ltar mi phyed gsum gnas pa'o //
translated: The three indestructible ones are the body, speech, and mind that abide like a vajra.

original: de nyid skal mchog go //
analyzed: de nyid skal mchog go //
translated: That itself is the supreme good fortune.

original: gang rigs dang ldan pas de'i na chung gzhon nu skal ba 'tsham pa'i gzungs ma mtshan dang ldan pa mngon du bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang rigs dang ldan pas de'i na chung gzhon nu skal ba 'tsham pa'i gzungs ma mtshan dang ldan pa mngon du bya ba ste /
translated: One who is suitable should manifest a qualified knowledge consort who is a young maiden appropriate for him.

original: de la rnyed nas byol song skye gnas brtag ces pa ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnyed nas byol song skye gnas brtag ces pa ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Having found her, how is one to examine the birth place of the animal?

original: byol song 'dul bya'i kha lo bslab pa bzhin du /
analyzed: byol song 'dul bya'i kha lo bslab pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as one trains the mouth of an animal to be tamed,

original: rig ma yang bud med kyi sgyu rtsal rtog pa med pa'i las la sogs pa bslab pa ste /
analyzed: rig ma yang bud med kyi sgyu rtsal rtog pa med pa'i las la sogs pa bslab pa ste /
translated: one trains the knowledge consort in the arts of a woman, such as the absence of conceptualization during intercourse.

original: don gyis mi 'byed pa yin no //
analyzed: don gyis mi 'byed pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that one does not discriminate.

original: dzny'a na pa ni de ltar mi 'thad de /
analyzed: dzny'a na pa ni de ltar mi 'thad de /
translated: Jñānapa does not agree with that.

original: lo grangs kyi tshad la nyung dang lhag na yang gzung bar bya'o zhes gsung ngo //
analyzed: lo grangs kyi tshad la nyung dang lhag na yang gzung bar bya'o zhes gsung ngo //
translated: He says that if the number of years is less or more, one should still accept her.

original: bsgrub pa brtsam pa'i gnas ni sa phyogs gtsang zhing zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bsgrub pa brtsam pa'i gnas ni sa phyogs gtsang zhing zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The place to begin the practice is a clean place, and so on.

original: de la dben pa ni gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: de la dben pa ni gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: There, secluded means not mixed with others.

original: yang na rgyal ba zhi ba'i gnas zhes pa zhabs kyis bcags pa'i ma h'a bo dhi'i gnas dang / mtshan ma rtags kyi gnas de'i @61b bi ling+ga dang / drag shul bsgrub pa'i gnas ru tra bsgral ba'i dur khrod du /
analyzed: yang na rgyal ba zhi ba'i gnas zhes pa zhabs kyis bcags pa'i ma h'a bo dhi'i gnas dang / mtshan ma rtags kyi gnas de'i @61b bi ling+ga dang / drag shul bsgrub pa'i gnas ru tra bsgral ba'i dur khrod du /
translated: Or else, the place of the Conqueror's abode of peace is the place of Mahabodhi, which is the place of the Conqueror's footsteps; the place of the signs of the marks is the place of the Vihāra; and the place of the practice of wrath is the charnel ground of the liberation of Rudra.

original: chu'am yang na bshad gcis byug pa ni phyi sa dang gcin sogs kyis byugs la bzhag ces pa'o //
analyzed: chu'am yang na bshad gcis byug pa ni phyi sa dang gcin sogs kyis byugs la bzhag ces pa'o //
translated: One should place the mandala in a place which is anointed with water and earth, that is, with excrement, urine, and so forth.

analyzed: bdag nyid mos pa'i lhar bsgoms te /

translated: One should imagine a sun mandala in the center of the heart, hips, below the navel, and in the center of the feet.

original: de'i rim bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i rim bzhin no //

analyzed: h'um la sogs pa btags te sa bon rang gi lhar bsgoms la rjes su chags pa la sogs pa cho ga tshang ba yin no //

analyzed: de ni ltag 'og tu yang sbyar ro //

original: rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rig par bya'o //

analyzed: de nyid bdag gi lus so //

analyzed: des kun nas mnar sems pa dang ldan pa rnams bsad na ni /

translated: Having generated the maṇḍala endowed with the principal deity, Akṣobhya, and the eighteen deities in the center of the maṇḍala of the family of the wheel, one sees all the things of the miserly, and having recited and emanated,

analyzed: nor dbrog pa la sogs par bya'o //

analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje gsum du bsgoms nas /

analyzed: phrogs ma thag pa gang dang ldan pa de rnams yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra ba la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who possess the very moment of theft become like a wish-fulfilling gem, and so forth.

original: rigs rgya mtsho zhes pa ni zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor pas kyang bya bar bstan no //
analyzed: rigs rgya mtsho zhes pa ni zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor pas kyang bya bar bstan no //
translated: The ocean of families is taught for the yogin of hatred and so forth.

original: da ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la sems khong nas 'khrug pa'i don du /🔽gzhan bstan pa'i phyir 'dod chags kyi rnal 'byor pa'i las gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la sems khong nas 'khrug pa'i don du / gzhan bstan pa'i phyir 'dod chags kyi rnal 'byor pa'i las gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to thoroughly agitate the mind for the sake of the excellence of others,

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: in order to teach the rite of the yogin of passion, [the Bhagavān] declares, beginning with, “Then, the rite of the yogin of passion,” and so forth.

original: de la 'dod chags thar par zhes pa ni so sor rtog pa'i rnam pas /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags thar par zhes pa ni so sor rtog pa'i rnam pas /
translated: There, “passion is liberation” is the discernment of individual aspects.

original: padma'i dkyil 'khor ni de'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: padma'i dkyil 'khor ni de'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor te /
translated: The “lotus maṇḍala” is the maṇḍala of that family.

original: de'i dbus su mtha' yas gtso bor gyur pa'i lha bco brgyad dang ldan pa'i dkyil 'khor bskyed nas 'dod chags kyi dngos po kun mthong nas bzlas pa la sogs pa kun byas te /
analyzed: de'i dbus su mtha' yas gtso bor gyur pa'i lha bco brgyad dang ldan pa'i dkyil 'khor bskyed nas 'dod chags kyi dngos po kun mthong nas bzlas pa la sogs pa kun byas te /
translated: Having generated the maṇḍala endowed with the eighteen deities, with Ananata as the principal deity, in the center of that, having seen all things of passion, one should perform all the recitations and so forth.

original: rjes su chags par bud med la spyad pa la sogs pa bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su chags par bud med la spyad pa la sogs pa bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should practice with a woman with whom one is in love.

original: yu ma rnams bud med lta bur sbyar ba byas nas de la dam tshig bzhi'i sbyor bas te /
analyzed: yu ma rnams bud med lta bur sbyar ba byas nas de la dam tshig bzhi'i sbyor bas te /
translated: Having applied the mothers to the women, one should practice with them by means of the four commitments.

original: phyag rgya bzhi dang ldan pas dus bzhi la sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhi dang ldan pas dus bzhi la sbyor ba ste /
translated: One should practice with the four seals in the four times.

original: yul du snang ba thams cad rig ma de ru bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: yul du snang ba thams cad rig ma de ru bsgom par bya ste /
translated: One should meditate on all appearances as objects as the knowledge-woman.

original: @63b de yang nam mkha' khams kyi bud med do //
analyzed: @63b de yang nam mkha' khams kyi bud med do //
translated: And she is the woman of the space realm.

original: zhes so // de dag gi gsang ba'i dbang po gnyis sbyar nas bud med la nye bar spyad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes so // de dag gi gsang ba'i dbang po gnyis sbyar nas bud med la nye bar spyad pa yin no //
translated: Having united the two secret organs, one should enjoy the woman.

original: 'dod chags kyi rigs nyid gzhan gyis kyang bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi rigs nyid gzhan gyis kyang bya bar bstan to //
translated: It is taught that one should also do it with another of the same type of passion.

original: de ltar lus kyi don gsum bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar lus kyi don gsum bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the three topics of the body,

original: ngag gi brdzun du smra ba'i rnam par dag pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir de nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ngag gi brdzun du smra ba'i rnam par dag pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir de nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: in order to teach the topic of the purification of verbal lying, he says “then” and so on.

original: de la rdo rje sngags zhes pa ni rnam par dag pa'i gsung dang ldan pa des sangs rgyas zhes pa las kyi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: de la rdo rje sngags zhes pa ni rnam par dag pa'i gsung dang ldan pa des sangs rgyas zhes pa las kyi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor te /
translated: The vajra speech is the one endowed with pure speech, and buddha is the mandala of the karma family.

original: de'i dbus su don yod grub pa gtso bor gyur pa lha bco brgyad dang ldan pa'i dkyil 'khor bskyed nas gang brdzun du smra ba'i dngos po mthong nas /
analyzed: de'i dbus su don yod grub pa gtso bor gyur pa lha bco brgyad dang ldan pa'i dkyil 'khor bskyed nas gang brdzun du smra ba'i dngos po mthong nas /
translated: Having generated the mandala endowed with the eighteen deities, with Amoghasiddhi as the principal one, in its center, one sees the thing that is lying,

original: yang bzlas pa la sogs pa bya ste /
analyzed: yang bzlas pa la sogs pa bya ste /
translated: and again one recites, and so forth.

original: rdo rje tshig gi brdzun bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje tshig gi brdzun bya bar bstan to //
translated: It is taught that one should lie with vajra speech.

original: de la rdo rje tshig ni gzhan gyi don du dkyil 'khor gyi ngang can gyis gang smras pa des so //
analyzed: de la rdo rje tshig ni gzhan gyi don du dkyil 'khor gyi ngang can gyis gang smras pa des so //
translated: Therein, vajra speech is that which is spoken by one who is in the state of the mandala for the sake of others.

original: bsgrub par bya zhes pa ni brdzun rnam par dag pa gsung dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyis dngos po nyid gang yin pa'i don bstan to //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya zhes pa ni brdzun rnam par dag pa gsung dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyis dngos po nyid gang yin pa'i don bstan to //
translated: The thing to be accomplished is the meaning that is taught by the nature of the object of pure lying speech.

original: dam tshig dgug pa'i rigs zhes pa /
analyzed: dam tshig dgug pa'i rigs zhes pa /
translated: The family of summoning by means of the pledge

original: de nyid gzhan gyis kyang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid gzhan gyis kyang shes par bya'o //
translated: is to be understood by others.

original: da ni ngag rtsub mo la sogs pa rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i phyir de nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni ngag rtsub mo la sogs pa rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i phyir de nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the purity of harsh speech and so forth, he says “then” and so forth.

original: de la rdo rje mi phyed ces pa ni sku la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o /
analyzed: de la rdo rje mi phyed ces pa ni sku la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o /
translated: There, “vajra” is the aspect of body and so forth.

original: de dang gang ldan pa des dam tshig ces pa /
analyzed: de dang gang ldan pa des dam tshig ces pa /
translated: “ He who has that” is “commitment,”🔽because he does not transgress.

original: mi 'da' ba nyid kyi phyir rin po che rigs kyi dkyil 'khor de'i dbus su dkon mchog dpal gtso bor gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor gong bzhin bskyed nas /🔽gang ngag rtsub mo la sogs pa dang ldan par mthong nas gong la bzhin bzlas pa la sogs pa byas te /
analyzed: mi 'da' ba nyid kyi phyir rin po che rigs kyi dkyil 'khor de'i dbus su dkon mchog dpal gtso bor gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor gong bzhin bskyed nas / gang ngag rtsub mo la sogs pa dang ldan par mthong nas gong la bzhin bzlas pa la sogs pa byas te /
translated: In the center of the maṇḍala of the Ratna family, having generated the maṇḍala with Ratnaprabhā as the principal deity as before,

original: de rnams la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: one should apply to those who are seen to have harsh speech and so forth, as before, the recitation and so forth.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni phra ma dang tshig kyal ba dag go //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni phra ma dang tshig kyal ba dag go //
translated: The word “and so forth” includes slander and idle speech.

original: de ltar lus kyi nyes pa gsum pa dang ngag gi nyes pas rnam par dag par gsungs nas /
analyzed: de ltar lus kyi nyes pa gsum pa dang ngag gi nyes pas rnam par dag par gsungs nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the purity of the three faults of body and the three faults of speech,

original: yid kyi nyes pa gsum rnam par dag pa ni lus dag pa nyid kyis zhes so //
analyzed: yid kyi nyes pa gsum rnam par dag pa ni lus dag pa nyid kyis zhes so //
translated: the purity of the three faults of mind is “by the purity of body.”

original: de nas ngo mtshar che ba la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /🔽de nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nas ngo mtshar che ba la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir / de nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Then, in order to show the wonder and so forth,🔽he says, “Then, the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, having heard this teaching of the Dharma, were amazed and astonished, and said this to the Lord of the Vajra of Secret Wisdom, the Bodhisattva, the great being, the Vajra-Holder: ‘It is wonderful, O Lord, that the Dharma-element is the cause of the arising of the Buddhas, the Lords, and that it is the cause of the arising of the world with its gods, humans, and Asuras.

original: yang gi sgra ni ched che ba ste /🔽ma 'ongs pa'i skyo bos don nyid shas @64a * //🔽par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni ched che ba ste / ma 'ongs pa'i skyo bos don nyid shas @64a * // par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ’ Then, the Lord of the Vajra of Secret Wisdom, the Bodhisattva, the great being, the Vajra-Holder, said this to the Bodhisattvas, the great beings: ‘It is just so, O Sons of the Victor, just so!

original: 'dir dam tshig rdo rje ni sa'i snying po gang yin pa dang / dpal zhes pa sgrib pa rnam par sel ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir dam tshig rdo rje ni sa'i snying po gang yin pa dang / dpal zhes pa sgrib pa rnam par sel ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Dharma-element is the cause of the arising of the Buddhas, the Lords, and it is the cause of the arising of the world with its gods, humans, and Asuras.

original: de rnams kyis smras so zhes 'brel to /🔽de ma thag tu lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: de rnams kyis smras so zhes 'brel to / de ma thag tu lan gsungs pa /
translated: ’ Then, the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, having heard this teaching of the Dharma, were amazed and astonished, and said this to the Lord of the Vajra of Secret Wisdom, the Bodhisattva, the great being, the Vajra-Holder: ‘It is wonderful, O Lord, that the Dharma-element is the cause of the arising of the Buddhas, the Lords, and that it is the cause of the arising of the world with its gods, humans, and Asuras.

original: de nas zhes pa rnams te rgyal ba rnams kyis bka' stsal to zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa rnams te rgyal ba rnams kyis bka' stsal to zhes 'brel to //
translated: ’ Then, the Lord of the Vajra of Secret Wisdom, the Bodhisattva, the great being, the Vajra-Holder, said this to the Bodhisattvas, the great beings: ‘It is just so, O Sons of the Victor, just so!

original: de'i gdams ngag gsungs pa rigs kyi bu zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽gdod chos 'chad do zhes pa ni don dang ldan pa nyid kyis de la'o //🔽de nas dga' ba'i mdangs kyis ngo mtshar ba ni /
analyzed: de'i gdams ngag gsungs pa rigs kyi bu zhes pa la sogs pa'o // gdod chos 'chad do zhes pa ni don dang ldan pa nyid kyis de la'o // de nas dga' ba'i mdangs kyis ngo mtshar ba ni /
translated: The Dharma-element is the cause of the arising of the Buddhas, the Lords, and it is the cause of the arising of the world with its gods, humans, and Asuras.

original: de nas byang chub ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas byang chub ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ’ Then, the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, having heard this teaching of the Dharma, were amazed and astonished, and said this to the Lord of the Vajra of Secret Wisdom, the Bodhisattva, the great being, the Vajra-Holder: ‘It is wonderful, O Lord, that the Dharma-element is the cause of the arising of the Buddhas, the Lords, and that it is the cause of the arising of the world with its gods

original: 'dir mnyam pa nyid kyi don de yin yang rnam par shes pas gzugs la sogs pa sna tshogs pa spros pa kun rdzob ste /
analyzed: 'dir mnyam pa nyid kyi don de yin yang rnam par shes pas gzugs la sogs pa sna tshogs pa spros pa kun rdzob ste /
translated: Here, that is the meaning of sameness, but the consciousness of form and so forth is the variety of elaborations, the superficial.

original: don dam pa de dang mi mthun pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: don dam pa de dang mi mthun pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because it is just not in accord with the ultimate.

original: bshad pa mtshar zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa mtshar zhes pa yin no //
translated: The explanation is “amazing.”

original: le'u dgu ba'i don rdzogs so /
analyzed: le'u dgu ba'i don rdzogs so /
translated: The meaning of chapter nine is complete.

original: // / da ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po bskul ba la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / da ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po bskul ba la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the invocation of the essence of all tathāgatas and so forth,

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares “thereupon” and so forth.

original: de la dam tshig chen po zhes pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de la dam tshig chen po zhes pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa ste /
translated: There, the “great commitment” is Vajradhara,

original: de la 'dun pa dang bcas te gsol to zhe'o //
analyzed: de la 'dun pa dang bcas te gsol to zhe'o //
translated: and he is entreated with longing.

original: de'i sngags kyi snying po ni h'um la sogs pa ste zhus pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sngags kyi snying po ni h'um la sogs pa ste zhus pa'o //
translated: The essence of his mantra is hūṃ and so forth.

original: zhus pa'i de ma thag gsungs pa de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽lus dang ngag dang sems rnams ni rnam par mi rtog ces pa /
analyzed: zhus pa'i de ma thag gsungs pa de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o // lus dang ngag dang sems rnams ni rnam par mi rtog ces pa /
translated: Immediately after the request, he declares “thereupon” and so forth.🔽“Body, speech, and mind are nonconceptual”

original: gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa med pa yin te /
translated: means that there is no conceptualization of subject and object.

original: mi dmigs pa dang mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa dang mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of non-apprehension and non-abiding.

original: gal te'o na ni ci yang med pa yin no zhe na ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: gal te'o na ni ci yang med pa yin no zhe na ni ma yin te ;
translated: If it is asked, “Is it nothing at all? ” it is not,

original: ye shes tsam gnas pa'i phyir rdo rjer bsgom zhes so //
analyzed: ye shes tsam gnas pa'i phyir rdo rjer bsgom zhes so //
translated: because of the abiding of mere intuition.

original: yang gsungs pa ni de nas zhes pa rnams te /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa ni de nas zhes pa rnams te /
translated: The further statement is from “Then, ” etc.

original: de la dag pa ni dri ma dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dag pa ni dri ma dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: There, “pure” is because of being free from stains.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i sngags kyi tshul ni snang mdzad chen po'i rnam par gang gyur pa de snyoms par zhugs nas zhes te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i sngags kyi tshul ni snang mdzad chen po'i rnam par gang gyur pa de snyoms par zhugs nas zhes te /
translated: The mantra method of the perfections is the one who has become the form of Great Illumination.

original: snang ba las 'das pa'i sngags tshig rnams te /
analyzed: snang ba las 'das pa'i sngags tshig rnams te /
translated: The mantra words that transcend appearance are

original: de ni thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid du mngon no //
analyzed: de ni thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid du mngon no //
translated: that. It is evident as the nature of method and wisdom.

original: gang zhi ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas bskul bas /
analyzed: gang zhi ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas bskul bas /
translated: By whom, through the door of peace, etc.,

original: de nas de'i las byed pa ni rig pa ste de rnams dang lhan cig spyod pa yod kyang /
analyzed: de nas de'i las byed pa ni rig pa ste de rnams dang lhan cig spyod pa yod kyang /
translated: is the urging. Then, the one who does the work of that is the awareness, and although there is the existence of the one who practices with them,

original: sngags kyi spyod pa med na mi 'grub pas @64b spyan ras kyi sa btsa' ba ste /
analyzed: sngags kyi spyod pa med na mi 'grub pas @64b spyan ras kyi sa btsa' ba ste /
translated: if there is no practice of the mantra, there is no accomplishment.

original: thugs rjes gzung ba'i phyir sngags bsdus pa gsungs pa'o //🔽sngags kyang de thams cad kyang de nyid pa ste /
analyzed: thugs rjes gzung ba'i phyir sngags bsdus pa gsungs pa'o // sngags kyang de thams cad kyang de nyid pa ste /
translated: In order to be taken into his compassion, he taught the concise mantra.

original: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The mantra is also that of all of them, of Akshobhya and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi snying po skul bar byed pa ni drag shul la sogs pa'i sgo nas sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi sngags rnam par dag pa gsungs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi snying po skul bar byed pa ni drag shul la sogs pa'i sgo nas sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi sngags rnam par dag pa gsungs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The essence of those is the inciter, the mantra of body, speech, and mind, which is taught by way of the wrathful and so forth.

original: de la tshig gi lam ni ljags te des gsungs so //
analyzed: de la tshig gi lam ni ljags te des gsungs so //
translated: The path of words is the tongue, and he spoke with it.

original: de'i mthu gsungs pa ni de nas 'di ni zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i mthu gsungs pa ni de nas 'di ni zhes pa ste /
translated: The power of that is taught: Then this,

original: gang ldan pa de brjod na der 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang ldan pa de brjod na der 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: which is to say, if one utters that which is endowed with it, then that will occur.

original: de nas h'um las gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyir /
analyzed: de nas h'um las gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyir /
translated: Then, from the HŪṀ, outside the mandala,

original: de nas phyag na rdo rje zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: de nas phyag na rdo rje zhes pa smos te /
translated: then Vajrapāṇi,

original: 'dir dkyil 'khor rdzogs pa bkod pa de'i dbus kyi gdan brtsegs ma la yi ge h'um las gyur pa'i rdo rje 'dzin rang gi gzugs su rab tu brtag go //
analyzed: 'dir dkyil 'khor rdzogs pa bkod pa de'i dbus kyi gdan brtsegs ma la yi ge h'um las gyur pa'i rdo rje 'dzin rang gi gzugs su rab tu brtag go //
translated: here, having arrayed the complete mandala, on the stacked up seat in the middle, from the letter HŪṀ, one should imagine Vajradhara in one's own form.

original: sku gsung thugs zhes pa ni rdo rje 'dzin nyid kyi sa bon h'um snying la rnal 'byor pa de yis bsgoms na der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs zhes pa ni rdo rje 'dzin nyid kyi sa bon h'um snying la rnal 'byor pa de yis bsgoms na der 'gyur ro //
translated: If the yogin meditates on the seed syllable of Vajradhara himself, namely HŪṀ, in his heart, he becomes that.

original: des ni sku nyid bsgom pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des ni sku nyid bsgom pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But he does not meditate on the Body itself.

original: de'i rang gi dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa gzhal yas khang du sprul pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rang gi dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa gzhal yas khang du sprul pa ste /
translated: His own maṇḍala is the emanation of Akṣhobhya and so on in the celestial palace.

original: rang sngags ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la sogs pa rang rang gi gtso bo'i snying po kho nas bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: rang sngags ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la sogs pa rang rang gi gtso bo'i snying po kho nas bskyed par bya'o //
translated: His own mantra is generated by the essence of each of the principal ones of the Tathāgata family and so on.

original: bskul ba'i sngags dang 'brel pa'i sku mdog la sogs pa bstan pa ni rang sngags skyes bu zhes pa ste /
analyzed: bskul ba'i sngags dang 'brel pa'i sku mdog la sogs pa bstan pa ni rang sngags skyes bu zhes pa ste /
translated: The teaching on the color of the body and so on in connection with the mantra of invocation is the person of the own mantra.

original: gtso bo rang rang gi sa bon kho nas rang rang gi dkyil 'khor du bsgoms nas /
analyzed: gtso bo rang rang gi sa bon kho nas rang rang gi dkyil 'khor du bsgoms nas /
translated: Having meditated on his own maṇḍala with his own seed syllable,

original: de dag gi snying ga dang mgo dang lce steng dang gsang ba ni gnas bzhi'o //
analyzed: de dag gi snying ga dang mgo dang lce steng dang gsang ba ni gnas bzhi'o //
translated: his heart, head, tongue, and secret place are the four places.

original: der sku mdog la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni gzugs kyi tshul te /
analyzed: der sku mdog la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni gzugs kyi tshul te /
translated: Endowed with color and so on there is the mode of the form.

original: de zhal gsum gyi tshul gyis dkar po la sogs pa kha dog kyang gsum du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de zhal gsum gyi tshul gyis dkar po la sogs pa kha dog kyang gsum du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on that as having three faces, and also as having three colors, white and so forth.

original: de la 'di ni zhes pa gong gi phyag rgya bzhi dang ldan pa'i sku gsung thugs so //
analyzed: de la 'di ni zhes pa gong gi phyag rgya bzhi dang ldan pa'i sku gsung thugs so //
translated: Here, that refers to the body, speech, and mind endowed with the four seals mentioned above.

original: snying ga'i dbus su zhes pa /
analyzed: snying ga'i dbus su zhes pa /
translated: In the middle of the heart means

original: rang rang gi gnas su zla ba dang rang rang gi phyag mtshan gyi dbus su /
analyzed: rang rang gi gnas su zla ba dang rang rang gi phyag mtshan gyi dbus su /
translated: in one's own place, in the middle of the moon and one's own hand implement.

original: sa bon las gyur pa'i phra mo'i dkyil 'khor ni bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor dang / de'i mdun du ye shes sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor yang bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: sa bon las gyur pa'i phra mo'i dkyil 'khor ni bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor dang / de'i mdun du ye shes sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor yang bsam par bya'o //
translated: The subtle maṇḍala arisen from the seed is one's own maṇḍala, and in front of that, one should imagine the maṇḍala of the gnosis being.

original: yi ge'i mchog ces @65a * //
analyzed: yi ge'i mchog ces @65a * //
translated: The supreme syllable

original: pa ; sa bon thams cad kyi mchog ni h'um ste /
analyzed: pa ; sa bon thams cad kyi mchog ni h'um ste /
translated: is the supreme of all seeds, hūṃ.

original: de'i rdo rje'i dbus su bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rdo rje'i dbus su bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that in the middle of the vajra.

original: gzhan la yang spyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan la yang spyar ro //
translated: One should apply this to the others as well.

original: phyag mtshan yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: phyag mtshan yang gsungs pa /
translated: The hand implements are also mentioned:

original: rdo rje chen po rtse lnga pa //
analyzed: rdo rje chen po rtse lnga pa //
translated: The great five-pronged vajra,

original: zhes pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhes pa rnams so //
translated: and so forth.

original: de la rtag tu zhes pa ni dus bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la rtag tu zhes pa ni dus bzhi'o //
translated: Here, always refers to the four times.

original: sbyor bas zhes pa ni ting 'dzin gsum la gang sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor bas zhes pa ni ting 'dzin gsum la gang sbyor ba'o //
translated: “By application” means by application to the three meditative concentrations.

original: kyo ba ni rdo rje lcags kyo'i khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: kyo ba ni rdo rje lcags kyo'i khyad par gyis so //
translated: “Goad” means by the particularity of the vajra hook.

original: rdo rje gsum ni sku la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum ni sku la sogs pa'o //
translated: The three vajras are the body, etc.

original: de nas ye shes sems dpa' de'i snying gar lcags kyos brdab ste dz'a la sogs pas bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ye shes sems dpa' de'i snying gar lcags kyos brdab ste dz'a la sogs pas bskul bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should goad the gnosis being at his heart with the hook, with “jaḥ,” etc.

original: gzhan dag kyang bskul ba ni 'khor lo zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang bskul ba ni 'khor lo zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Also goading the others is with “wheel,” etc.

original: rigs zhes pa ni gzhan la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rigs zhes pa ni gzhan la yang sbyar ro //
translated: “Family” is to be applied to the others.

original: de yang 'od zer gyi ngo bo'i rdo rje'i lcags kyos bskul bar bshad ces so //
analyzed: de yang 'od zer gyi ngo bo'i rdo rje'i lcags kyos bskul bar bshad ces so //
translated: And that is explained as goading with the hook of the nature of light rays.

original: sngags kyi che ba gsungs pa 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi che ba gsungs pa 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The greatness of the mantra is stated with “this,” etc.

original: de la rol mo zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa bsgrub pa'i yan lag dang ldan pa la rgyal ba rnams kyis gzigs pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i rol mo de las 'byung ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la rol mo zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa bsgrub pa'i yan lag dang ldan pa la rgyal ba rnams kyis gzigs pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i rol mo de las 'byung ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: There, “play” means that the victors see the yogi/nī endowed with the branches of practice, and the play of benefiting sentient beings arises from that.

original: de kho na gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de kho na gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify that reality,

original: de nas rgyal po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, the king, etc.

original: bka' stsal ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: bka' stsal ba dang 'brel to //
translated: This is connected with the statement.

original: de la sngags kyi skyes bu ni sa bon las gyur pa'i lha rnams so //
analyzed: de la sngags kyi skyes bu ni sa bon las gyur pa'i lha rnams so //
translated: There, the mantra being is the deities arisen from the seed.

original: de la rdo rje ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la rdo rje ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: There, the vajra is the vajra body, etc.

original: de'i ye shes sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de'i ye shes sems dpa'o //
translated: That is the gnosis being.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid du sbyar bas /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid du sbyar bas /
translated: By the union of the nature of means and insight,

original: dngos po thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa'i lha'i rang bzhin du'o ;
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa'i lha'i rang bzhin du'o ;
translated: all things are the nature of the deity, form, etc.

original: / de'i rig ma dbang phyug ces pa ni shes rab ma'o //
analyzed: / de'i rig ma dbang phyug ces pa ni shes rab ma'o //
translated: His knowledge woman is the lady, the wisdom woman.

original: lha mo'i gzugs brnyan la zhes te /
analyzed: lha mo'i gzugs brnyan la zhes te /
translated: In the reflection of the goddess,

original: dngos la'o // rdo rje dang padma gnyis sbyor bar bsgom zhing yab kyi dgyes pa yum la stobs pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: dngos la'o // rdo rje dang padma gnyis sbyor bar bsgom zhing yab kyi dgyes pa yum la stobs pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: in the real thing, one should meditate on the union of the vajra and lotus, and the father should bestow his joy on the mother, etc.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi dang can gyis bud med ji snyed pa lha mor sprul nas mi dbye bar spyad pa ni de nas zhes pa nas mtha'i bar du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi dang can gyis bud med ji snyed pa lha mor sprul nas mi dbye bar spyad pa ni de nas zhes pa nas mtha'i bar du rig par bya'o //
translated: The one who has the mandala should transform as many women as there are into goddesses, and practice without separation, from then on up to the end.

original: rdo rje gsum po zhes pa rnams kyis ni theg pa che ba'i tshul yang bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum po zhes pa rnams kyis ni theg pa che ba'i tshul yang bstan to //
translated: The words “three vajras” also teach the method of the Great Vehicle.

original: le'u bcu pa'i don rdzogs so /
analyzed: le'u bcu pa'i don rdzogs so /
translated: The meaning of the tenth chapter is complete.

original: // da ni sngags kyi dam tshig de kho na nyid /
analyzed: // da ni sngags kyi dam tshig de kho na nyid /
translated: Now, the reality of the mantra commitments,

original: rig pa'i skyes @65b bur gsungs pa ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rig pa'i skyes @65b bur gsungs pa ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: spoken by the knowledge born one, is stated by “then” and so forth.

original: de la rdo rje skyes bu zhes pa ni stong pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i sa bon las byung bas skyes bu mchog ces te /
analyzed: de la rdo rje skyes bu zhes pa ni stong pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i sa bon las byung bas skyes bu mchog ces te /
translated: There, the “vajra being” is the supreme being born from the seed syllables of the vajra body and so forth endowed with emptiness.

original: de nyid la zhugs te gsungs so zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de nyid la zhugs te gsungs so zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: It is connected with “entered into that and spoke.”

original: de la rdo rje yang yin la sngags kyang yin pas de skad ces bya ste sa bon no //
analyzed: de la rdo rje yang yin la sngags kyang yin pas de skad ces bya ste sa bon no //
translated: There, it is called that because it is both a vajra and a mantra, that is, a seed syllable.

original: de las byung ba ni rig pa'i skyes bu ste de ba sgrub par bya ba'i le'u 'di gsungs so zhes so //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni rig pa'i skyes bu ste de ba sgrub par bya ba'i le'u 'di gsungs so zhes so //
translated: The knowledge born being is born from that, and this chapter is spoken for the sake of accomplishing that.

original: de la rdo rje mchog gsum zhes pa /
analyzed: de la rdo rje mchog gsum zhes pa /
translated: There, the “three supreme vajras”

original: aom dang a'a:dang h'um ngo //
analyzed: aom dang a'a:dang h'um ngo //
translated: are the syllables oṃ, āḥ, and hūṃ.

original: phyag rgya chen po zhes pa sa bon gyi sngags rnams kyis mngon par rtogs pa'i lha bskyed nas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po zhes pa sa bon gyi sngags rnams kyis mngon par rtogs pa'i lha bskyed nas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The great seal is the generation and meditation on the deity of manifest realization by means of the seed mantras.

original: de'i ye shes rdo rje zhes pa ni rgyu yis dkyil 'khor gyi lha byin gyis brlabs zin pa dang / sems can rnams dkyil 'khor nas phyung nas so so'i zhing khams su dgod do //
analyzed: de'i ye shes rdo rje zhes pa ni rgyu yis dkyil 'khor gyi lha byin gyis brlabs zin pa dang / sems can rnams dkyil 'khor nas phyung nas so so'i zhing khams su dgod do //
translated: The wisdom-vajra is the consecration of the mandala deities by the cause, and the placement of sentient beings in their own buddhafields after they have been led out of the mandala.

original: de nas sbyor ba'i cho gas lhag pa'i sems las 'bru lngar bskyed de /
analyzed: de nas sbyor ba'i cho gas lhag pa'i sems las 'bru lngar bskyed de /
translated: Then, by the rite of union, one generates the five seed syllables from the mind of the deity.

original: ho aom aam h'um ho zhes rig ma'i padmar /
analyzed: ho aom aam h'um ho zhes rig ma'i padmar /
translated: Ho and om and aṃ and hūṃ and ho are in the lotus of the knowledge consort.

original: shes rab dang snying rje'i rang bzhin ho gnyis kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang snying rje'i rang bzhin ho gnyis kyi bar du'o //
translated: Between the two ho syllables, which are the nature of wisdom and compassion,

original: rjes su chags pas yi ge gsum zhu bar mthong ste /
analyzed: rjes su chags pas yi ge gsum zhu bar mthong ste /
translated: one sees the three syllables melt by passion.

original: de'i 'od kyis ho gnyis kyang zla bar zhu bar mthong nas /
analyzed: de'i 'od kyis ho gnyis kyang zla bar zhu bar mthong nas /
translated: The light of that causes the two ho syllables to melt into the moon,

original: de'i 'od kyi gong bur gyur te /
analyzed: de'i 'od kyi gong bur gyur te /
translated: and one sees that become a sphere of light.

original: de la gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi skur zhugs pa las /
analyzed: de la gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi skur zhugs pa las /
translated: That enters into the nondual dharma-body,🔽and one sees that become the form of the deity.

original: der ma zhugs par longs spyod pa'i skus don mdzod cig par tshad med pa bzhi las byung ba'i spyan ma la sogs pa bzhis dbyangs kyis bzhengs par bskul ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: der ma zhugs par longs spyod pa'i skus don mdzod cig par tshad med pa bzhi las byung ba'i spyan ma la sogs pa bzhis dbyangs kyis bzhengs par bskul ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Without entering there, one should request the enjoyment body to perform benefits with the four goddesses such as Lochana arisen from the four immeasurables, and so on.

original: sku'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni thabs dang shes rab kyi bar gyi sa bon gsum ste /
analyzed: sku'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni thabs dang shes rab kyi bar gyi sa bon gsum ste /
translated: The nature of the vajra body and so on is the three seed syllables of method and prajña.

original: aom la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: aom la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are Om and so on.

original: de la rdo rje kun las skyes //
analyzed: de la rdo rje kun las skyes //
translated: The vajra born from all vajras

original: zhes pa dang po rim pa dang bcas nas mtshams bcing ba'i phyir dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor padma'i grva bzhir rtse gsum pa'i rdo rjes mtshan pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa dang po rim pa dang bcas nas mtshams bcing ba'i phyir dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor padma'i grva bzhir rtse gsum pa'i rdo rjes mtshan pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: means that one should draw a three-pronged vajra marked with a lotus in each of the four corners of the mandala of great power in order to bind the boundaries, beginning with the first stage.

original: rdo rjes brgyan pa de ru yi ge bhr'um 'khor lo las byung ba dang de nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rjes brgyan pa de ru yi ge bhr'um 'khor lo las byung ba dang de nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on that vajra adorned with Bhur, arisen from the chakra, and meditate on that.

original: de'i don ni gsum ste dbang chen nas brtsams nas rdo rjer gyur pa dang de nas 'khor lor gyur pa dang / snang mdzad gzhal yas khang du gyur pa'o//
analyzed: de'i don ni gsum ste dbang chen nas brtsams nas rdo rjer gyur pa dang de nas 'khor lor gyur pa dang / snang mdzad gzhal yas khang du gyur pa'o//
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: Beginning with the great empowerment, one becomes a vajra, then a wheel, and then a Vairocana celestial mansion.

original: @66a * // de ltar de dag gi nang du h'um dkar po las chos kyi 'byung gnas ae gru gsum du bsgom /
analyzed: @66a * // de ltar de dag gi nang du h'um dkar po las chos kyi 'byung gnas ae gru gsum du bsgom /
translated: Thus, within those, one should meditate on a white hūṃ, which becomes a three-sided source of phenomena.

original: de'i nang du padma sna tshogs /
analyzed: de'i nang du padma sna tshogs /
translated: Within that, there is a multicolored lotus.

original: de'i steng du rdo rje rgya gram /
analyzed: de'i steng du rdo rje rgya gram /
translated: Upon that, there is a four-pronged vajra.

original: de'i steng du bhr'um las 'khor lo'i steng du bhr'um /
analyzed: de'i steng du bhr'um las 'khor lo'i steng du bhr'um /
translated: Upon that, there is a bhrūṃ, which becomes a wheel marked with bhrūṃ.

original: yang bhr'um dang 'khor lo gnyis las snang mdzad kyi skur gyur te yab yum zhu ba las /
analyzed: yang bhr'um dang 'khor lo gnyis las snang mdzad kyi skur gyur te yab yum zhu ba las /
translated: Again, from the bhrūṃ and the wheel, one becomes the form of Vairocana, which melts into the father and mother.

original: gzhal yas khang gru bzhi pa la sgo bzhi pa mug tig ha ra che chung dang / dra ba dra phyed la sogs pas brgyan pa'i nang du lha bcu dgu gdan sna tshogs padmo re bsam pa la sogs pa gzhung bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: gzhal yas khang gru bzhi pa la sgo bzhi pa mug tig ha ra che chung dang / dra ba dra phyed la sogs pas brgyan pa'i nang du lha bcu dgu gdan sna tshogs padmo re bsam pa la sogs pa gzhung bzhin du bya'o //
translated: From that, one should visualize the celestial mansion with four sides and four gates, adorned with small and large pearls, strings of pearls, and so on, with the nineteen deities on various seats and individual lotuses, and so on, in accordance with the treatise.

original: da ni zla ba la sogs pa'i gdan la yig 'bru gsum bsams nas zla bar bstan pa ni gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa rnams te /
analyzed: da ni zla ba la sogs pa'i gdan la yig 'bru gsum bsams nas zla bar bstan pa ni gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa rnams te /
translated: Now, having contemplated the three seed syllables on the moon and so on seats, the teaching on the moon is the “clear maṇḍala,” and so on.

original: de la gsal ba ni zla ba ste padmo dang ldan pa'i chos kyi dkyil 'khor dang / rdo rje rgya gram rnams la ye shes kyi sku las aom la sogs pa rnams rim bzhin spro ste bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la gsal ba ni zla ba ste padmo dang ldan pa'i chos kyi dkyil 'khor dang / rdo rje rgya gram rnams la ye shes kyi sku las aom la sogs pa rnams rim bzhin spro ste bzla bar bya'o //
translated: There, the “clear” is the moon, and one should emanate the oṃ and so on from the gnosis body onto the Dharma maṇḍala endowed with the lotus and the vajra cross and recite them.

original: 'og nas kyang gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa rnams kyis zla ba la sogs pa'i gdan gsal bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'og nas kyang gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa rnams kyis zla ba la sogs pa'i gdan gsal bar bstan to //
translated: Also, below, the “clear maṇḍala” and so on clarify the moon and so on seats.

original: gal te snang mdzad dang tshe dpag med pa dang / mi bskyod pa rnams rim bzhin du mi phyed pa dang / mi rmugs pa dang / chos bdag med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gal te snang mdzad dang tshe dpag med pa dang / mi bskyod pa rnams rim bzhin du mi phyed pa dang / mi rmugs pa dang / chos bdag med pa'i phyir na /
translated: If Vairocana, Amitābha, and Akṣobhya are, respectively, non-division, non-confusion, and the selflessness of phenomena,

original: de dag gi gdan kha cig tu dkrugs pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi gdan kha cig tu dkrugs pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: then their seats are mixed up in some places.

original: kun la mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun la mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not so, because it would follow that they are the same for all.

original: yang gal te dbyer med pa'i phyir mi bskyod pa la sogs pa la aom la sogs pa dkrugs te bsgoms pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yang gal te dbyer med pa'i phyir mi bskyod pa la sogs pa la aom la sogs pa dkrugs te bsgoms pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Again, if it is asked, “Is it that Akṣobhya and so on are meditated on by mixing the oṃ and so on because they are inseparable?”

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be endless.

original: de'i gnas bhr'um gyis zhes pa rgyu dang po ste /
analyzed: de'i gnas bhr'um gyis zhes pa rgyu dang po ste /
translated: The first cause is “its place is bhrūṃ,”

original: bhr'um las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bhr'um las gyur pa'o //
translated: which is the transformation of bhrūṃ.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi sa bon gsum ni snying po ste rdo rje sems dpa' yab yum gyi rang bzhin dang ldan pa aom ni zhes pa rnams te /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi sa bon gsum ni snying po ste rdo rje sems dpa' yab yum gyi rang bzhin dang ldan pa aom ni zhes pa rnams te /
translated: The three seed syllables of method and wisdom are the essence, endowed with the nature of Vajrasattva and Vajragarvā.

original: sku la sogs pa bskyed pa'i sa bon yin pas mnyes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa bskyed pa'i sa bon yin pas mnyes par byed pa'o //
translated: Since they are the seed syllables that generate the body and so on, they are the pleasing.

original: de ni stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi cha dang gang ldan pa rdo rje ste /
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi cha dang gang ldan pa rdo rje ste /
translated: That is the vajra that is endowed with the aspect of the gnosis of emptiness.

original: de las rgyu dang 'bras bu ni sa bon dang sa bon las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de las rgyu dang 'bras bu ni sa bon dang sa bon las gyur pa'o //
translated: The cause and result from that are the seed and the transformation of the seed.

original: rdo rje gsum bsgom pa'i dam tshig sems dpas ye shes sems dpa' yang rdzogs par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum bsgom pa'i dam tshig sems dpas ye shes sems dpa' yang rdzogs par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: The pledge being who meditates on the three vajras also becomes the perfect gnosis being.

original: de dag gi @66b gnas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de dag gi @66b gnas gsungs pa /
translated: The location of those is stated:

original: dben zhing zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dben zhing zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The isolated and so forth.

original: de la sbyor ba ni thabs kyi ngo bo rdo rje'i sku dang zhes pa ni 'bras bu'i do bo'o //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba ni thabs kyi ngo bo rdo rje'i sku dang zhes pa ni 'bras bu'i do bo'o //
translated: There, the application is the essence of the means, the vajra body and so forth, which is the essence of the result.

original: zla ba phyed ni dus kyi mtshan nyid do //🔽yang bsgrub pa'i yan lag dang ldan pas gsal bar byed pa'i khyad par gyi las bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zla ba phyed ni dus kyi mtshan nyid do // yang bsgrub pa'i yan lag dang ldan pas gsal bar byed pa'i khyad par gyi las bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The half month is the characteristic of the time.

original: gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Again, in order to teach the special action of the illumination by means of the branch of accomplishment, he says the mandala of illumination and so forth.

original: de la gsal ba ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te de nam mkha'i yang yin la rdo rje yang yin pas de ste rnam par dag pa'i gzhal yas khang der zhes so //
analyzed: de la gsal ba ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te de nam mkha'i yang yin la rdo rje yang yin pas de ste rnam par dag pa'i gzhal yas khang der zhes so //
translated: There, the illumination is the mandala of the moon, and since that is also the sky and also the vajra, it is that, the pure celestial mansion, in that place.

original: zla ba la rang sngags zhes pa rang gi sa bon kho nas snang mdzad cho ga bzhin du bskyed par byas nas /
analyzed: zla ba la rang sngags zhes pa rang gi sa bon kho nas snang mdzad cho ga bzhin du bskyed par byas nas /
translated: On the moon, one's own mantra is the seed syllable itself, and having generated Vairochana according to the rite,

original: de'i snying gar 'khor lo'i dbus su aom cho ga bzhin du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i snying gar 'khor lo'i dbus su aom cho ga bzhin du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: in the center of the wheel in his heart one should place the syllable Om according to the rite.

original: de yang snang mdzad bsgoms nas she'o //
analyzed: de yang snang mdzad bsgoms nas she'o //
translated: And that is known by meditating on Vairochana.

original: des ni tshe ring ba la sogs ba'i yon tan gsungs pa /
analyzed: des ni tshe ring ba la sogs ba'i yon tan gsungs pa /
translated: This is the statement of the virtues of long life, etc.

original: 'dis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽da ni gsung gi rdo rje dang 'dra bar bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dis zhes pa la sogs pa'o // da ni gsung gi rdo rje dang 'dra bar bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: This is the statement of the virtues of long life, etc.

original: chos kyi dkyil 'khor zhes pa rnams smos te /
analyzed: chos kyi dkyil 'khor zhes pa rnams smos te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the accomplishment of being like the Vajra of Speech, he says, the Dharma mandala, etc.

original: de la chos ni padma'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: de la chos ni padma'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: There, the Dharma is the lotus mandala.

original: de la rang gi sa bon las gyur pa'i mtha' yas ji lta ba bzhin du bskyed la /
analyzed: de la rang gi sa bon las gyur pa'i mtha' yas ji lta ba bzhin du bskyed la /
translated: In that, one should generate Amitābha arisen from one's own seed, just as before.

original: aom ngag gi lam mgrin pa'i padma'i dbus su bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: aom ngag gi lam mgrin pa'i padma'i dbus su bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should think of the Oṃ in the middle of the lotus of the throat, the path of speech.

original: 'dir 'jig rten dbang mchog ni snang ba mtha' yas te de bsgoms nas zhes so //
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten dbang mchog ni snang ba mtha' yas te de bsgoms nas zhes so //
translated: Here, the supreme lord of the world is Amitābha.

original: yang thugs kyi rdo rje dang 'dra bar bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang thugs kyi rdo rje dang 'dra bar bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach the accomplishment of being like the Vajra of Mind, he says, the vajra mandala, etc.

original: de la rdo rje ni rgya gram pa'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: de la rdo rje ni rgya gram pa'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: There, the vajra is the mandala of the crossed vajra.

original: de la rang gi sa bon kho nas mi bskyod pa cho ga bzhin du bskyed nas /
analyzed: de la rang gi sa bon kho nas mi bskyod pa cho ga bzhin du bskyed nas /
translated: In that, having generated Akṣobhya arisen from one's own seed, just as before,

original: de'i yang snying gar rdo rje'i dbus su h'um ji lta ba bzhin gnas par bya'o /
analyzed: de'i yang snying gar rdo rje'i dbus su h'um ji lta ba bzhin gnas par bya'o /
translated: Also, in the center of that heart, one should abide just like the hūṃ in the center of the vajra.

original: de dag gi don ni 'di lta ste snying rje la sogs pa dang ldan pa chu la sogs pa'i dbang rnams thob pas mi snang /
analyzed: de dag gi don ni 'di lta ste snying rje la sogs pa dang ldan pa chu la sogs pa'i dbang rnams thob pas mi snang /
translated: The meaning of those [lines] is as follows: One who is endowed with compassion and so on, having obtained the empowerments of water and so on, becomes invisible.

original: gong ma'i rim pas ting nge 'dzin gsum rdzogs par byas te /
analyzed: gong ma'i rim pas ting nge 'dzin gsum rdzogs par byas te /
translated: Having completed the three meditative concentrations in sequence,

original: grub pa'i mtshan ma thob nas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtshan ma thob nas /
translated: having obtained the signs of accomplishment,

original: du ma'i ngo bo dang bral ba gang bdag nyid kyi phyag rgya dang ldan pa de nyid gcig pu bsgoms nas /
analyzed: du ma'i ngo bo dang bral ba gang bdag nyid kyi phyag rgya dang ldan pa de nyid gcig pu bsgoms nas /
translated: one who is free from the nature of multiplicity, endowed with one’s own seal, should meditate on that very [vajra].

original: sku la sogs pa gtong ba dang dgag pa'i dbang @67a * //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa gtong ba dang dgag pa'i dbang @67a * //
translated: Having gained control over the emission and blocking of the body and so on,

original: du byas nas rim gyis spro ba la sogs pa bya bar bstan to //🔽da ni dman pa'i sgrub pa las mi snang ba sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: du byas nas rim gyis spro ba la sogs pa bya bar bstan to // da ni dman pa'i sgrub pa las mi snang ba sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: one should emanate and so on in sequence.

original: ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to explain the accomplishment of invisibility from the inferior practice, [the Bhagavān] declares the maṇḍala of gnosis, and so on.

original: de la ye shes ni bdag nyid stong pa nyid dang ldan pa la sogs pa bsgoms nas de dang 'dra bar yang bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de la ye shes ni bdag nyid stong pa nyid dang ldan pa la sogs pa bsgoms nas de dang 'dra bar yang bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Wisdom is the meditation on the emptiness of self and so forth, and then meditating on being like that.

original: nam mkha'i snying po'i sku'i phyag rgya ni rdo rje chen po ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i snying po'i sku'i phyag rgya ni rdo rje chen po ste /
translated: The seal of the body of Ākāśagarbha is the great vajra.

original: der gang gyur pa'i lus kyi gnas rnams la yi ge aom dmigs nas rdo rje ye shes ni rnal 'byor pa ste /
analyzed: der gang gyur pa'i lus kyi gnas rnams la yi ge aom dmigs nas rdo rje ye shes ni rnal 'byor pa ste /
translated: Having visualized the syllable oṃ in the places of the body that have become that, the vajra wisdom is the yogī.

original: de nam mkha'i snying bo dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //🔽phyi ma la yang rim pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nam mkha'i snying bo dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro // phyi ma la yang rim pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: He becomes like Ākāśagarbha.

original: de dag gi yon tan la sogs pa ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: de dag gi yon tan la sogs pa ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: The qualities and so forth of those are easy to understand and so are not explained.

original: da ni 'jam dpal sgrub pa yon tan dang bcas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'jam dpal sgrub pa yon tan dang bcas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach Mañjuśrī’s accomplishment together with its qualities,

original: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa rnams smos te /
analyzed: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa rnams smos te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “vajra maṇḍala,” and so on.

original: de la rang sngags zhes pa rang gi sa bon gyis 'jam dpal cho ga bzhin du bsams nas /
analyzed: de la rang sngags zhes pa rang gi sa bon gyis 'jam dpal cho ga bzhin du bsams nas /
translated: There, one's own mantra is one's own seed. Having visualized Mañjuśrī according to the rite,

original: de'i snying kha ra autpala'i dbus su yi ge ham ji lta ba bzhin bzhag ste bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i snying kha ra autpala'i dbus su yi ge ham ji lta ba bzhin bzhag ste bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the letter haṃ in the center of a lotus in the heart, just as before.

original: bsam gtan gyi las gzhan bstan pa'i phyir 'od zer zhes pa rnams smos te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi las gzhan bstan pa'i phyir 'od zer zhes pa rnams smos te /
translated: In order to teach another object of meditation for concentration, [the Bhagavān] declares light rays, and so on.

original: gong gi cho gas yi ge aom bsgoms nas /🔽rdul phran rdo rje'i lus zhes pa rnams thob par bstan te /
analyzed: gong gi cho gas yi ge aom bsgoms nas / rdul phran rdo rje'i lus zhes pa rnams thob par bstan te /
translated: Having meditated on the letter oṃ by the procedure above,🔽one should meditate on the letter haṃ in the center of a lotus in the heart, just as before.

original: des ni gong gi mi snang ba'i don nyid gsal bar byas pa'o //🔽da ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des ni gong gi mi snang ba'i don nyid gsal bar byas pa'o // da ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: This clarifies the meaning of the above invisibility.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the accomplishment of Akṣobhya, and so on, [the Bhagavān] declares the realm of space, and so on.

original: de la nam mkha'i dbyings ni nang gi gzhal yas khang brtsegs par ro //
analyzed: de la nam mkha'i dbyings ni nang gi gzhal yas khang brtsegs par ro //
translated: Therein, the realm of space is the inner celestial mansion.

original: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor zhes pa lha bcu dgu'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor zhes pa lha bcu dgu'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The mandala of the Buddha is the nature of the nineteen deities.

original: de'i dbus su rdo rje sems dpa' cho ga ji lta ba bzhin bsgoms la de'i snying gar gdan la aom bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su rdo rje sems dpa' cho ga ji lta ba bzhin bsgoms la de'i snying gar gdan la aom bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In the center of that, one should meditate on Vajrasattva according to the rite, and on the seat in his heart, one should meditate on the letter oṃ.

original: des ni ji skad gsungs pa'i yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des ni ji skad gsungs pa'i yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: By that, one will come to possess the qualities as stated.

original: phyi ma la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi ma la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should also apply it to the future.

original: yang gsungs pa nam mkha'i zhes pa rnams te /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa nam mkha'i zhes pa rnams te /
translated: Again, it is stated: “The sky-vajra” and so forth.

original: de la nam mkha' rdo rje zhes pa 'byung ldan ji lta ba bzhin bsgoms la /
analyzed: de la nam mkha' rdo rje zhes pa 'byung ldan ji lta ba bzhin bsgoms la /
translated: There, having meditated on the sky-vajra just as it is,

original: de'i snying @67b gar rin po che'i gdan la yang /
analyzed: de'i snying @67b gar rin po che'i gdan la yang /
translated: on the jewel seat in its heart,

original: aom bsams na 'dir gsungs pa'i yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aom bsams na 'dir gsungs pa'i yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: one should meditate on the syllable OṂ. By that, one will come to possess the qualities as stated here.

original: yang rdo rje chos kyi bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang rdo rje chos kyi bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Again, in order to teach the practice of Vajradharma,

original: nam mkha'i zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i zhes pa smos te /
