translated: it is stated: “The sky-vajra” and so forth.🔽There, having meditated on Lokeśvara just as it is, on the Dharma-lotus in its heart,

original: de la 'jig rten dbang po ni snang ba mtha' yas cho ga bzhin du bsgoms pa'i snying gar chos kyi padma yang aom bsgoms na zhes so //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten dbang po ni snang ba mtha' yas cho ga bzhin du bsgoms pa'i snying gar chos kyi padma yang aom bsgoms na zhes so //
translated: one should meditate on the syllable OṂ.

original: gdon mi za ba'i sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gdon mi za ba'i sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the practice of Acalanātha,

original: yang nam mkha'i zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: yang nam mkha'i zhes pa smos te /
translated: it is stated: “The sky-vajra” and so forth.

original: de la autpala las gyur pa'i thogs med ji lta ba bzhin bsgoms la de'i snying gar yang gong bzhin du aom bsgoms na zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: de la autpala las gyur pa'i thogs med ji lta ba bzhin bsgoms la de'i snying gar yang gong bzhin du aom bsgoms na zhes pa yin no //
translated: There, one should meditate on the unobstructedness that arises from the utpala flower, just as before, and also in its heart, one should meditate on the oṃ, as before.

original: da ni mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to conclude,

original: rnam snang gi sgrub pa la sku gsung thugs rnams kyi spro ba dus gcig bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam snang gi sgrub pa la sku gsung thugs rnams kyi spro ba dus gcig bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the emanation of the body, speech, and mind in the performance of Vairocana,

original: nam mkha'i dbyings zhes pa rnams smos te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings zhes pa rnams smos te /
translated: he says “in the realm of space,” and so on.

original: de la rdo rje snang mdzad cho ga ji lta ba bzhin bsgoms la de'i snying gar zla ba la sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i aom bsgoms nas /
analyzed: de la rdo rje snang mdzad cho ga ji lta ba bzhin bsgoms la de'i snying gar zla ba la sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i aom bsgoms nas /
translated: There, one should meditate on Vajra Vairocana, just as before, and in his heart, on the moon, one should meditate on the oṃ of Body Vajra, and so on.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid gsum sku'i rdo rje la sogs pa 'dir gsungs pa'i yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid gsum sku'i rdo rje la sogs pa 'dir gsungs pa'i yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: One’s body, speech, and mind will come to possess the qualities of Body Vajra, and so on, as taught here.

original: 'dir aom bsgom pa ni sku'i rigs kyi bdag nyid dang ye shes kyi bdag nyid de phan tshun du dbyer med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir aom bsgom pa ni sku'i rigs kyi bdag nyid dang ye shes kyi bdag nyid de phan tshun du dbyer med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Here, the meditation on the oṃ is because of the identity of the body family and the identity of pristine awareness, which are mutually inseparable.

original: de dag gi gnas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gi gnas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach their location,🔽he says “in the heart,” and so on.

original: shin tu dben pa'i ri dgon dang // zhes pa'i tshigs bcad gsungs te /🔽'og tu yang snyegs so //
analyzed: shin tu dben pa'i ri dgon dang // zhes pa'i tshigs bcad gsungs te / 'og tu yang snyegs so //
translated: and the verse continues below.

original: der tsandan dkar dmar dang chu dang sman dang dri rnams kyis byugs te me tog dkar ni ka la sogs pa rnams dgram par bya'o //
analyzed: der tsandan dkar dmar dang chu dang sman dang dri rnams kyis byugs te me tog dkar ni ka la sogs pa rnams dgram par bya'o //
translated: There, having anointed with white and red sandalwood, water, medicine, and fragrances, one should scatter white flowers, and so on.

original: 'dir mi bskyod ye shes pa rnams kyis ni mngon shes lnga bsgrub pa'i phyir rang gi ting nge 'dzin las 'byung ba'i cho ga rnams bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir mi bskyod ye shes pa rnams kyis ni mngon shes lnga bsgrub pa'i phyir rang gi ting nge 'dzin las 'byung ba'i cho ga rnams bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, the Akshobhya-jnana-vajra-vidyadharas teach the rituals that arise from their own samadhi for the attainment of the five superknowledges.

original: de la 'dir dang la mi bskyod pa ji lta ba bzhin bsgoms nas /
analyzed: de la 'dir dang la mi bskyod pa ji lta ba bzhin bsgoms nas /
translated: There, having meditated here on Akshobhya just as it is,

original: de'i gnas lnga mig dang rna ba dang snying ga dang nu ma gnyis kyi bar dang lte bar rdo rje chen po rtse lnga lnga bsams na lha'i spyan la sogs pa lnga dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i gnas lnga mig dang rna ba dang snying ga dang nu ma gnyis kyi bar dang lte bar rdo rje chen po rtse lnga lnga bsams na lha'i spyan la sogs pa lnga dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and having visualized the five places - the eyes, ears, heart, and the space between the two breasts, and the navel - with five-pronged great vajras, one will become like the five, such as the divine eye, and so on.

original: me stag mang po 'khrug pa'i rang sngags zhes pa rang rang gi sa bon las gyur pa'i snang mdzad bsgoms la 'khor lo lnga'i sbyor ba zhes pa de'i yang @68a * //
analyzed: me stag mang po 'khrug pa'i rang sngags zhes pa rang rang gi sa bon las gyur pa'i snang mdzad bsgoms la 'khor lo lnga'i sbyor ba zhes pa de'i yang @68a * //
translated: The own mantra of the many sparks is the appearance-maker arisen from one's own seed. The application of the five wheels is the meditation on the wheels in the five places of that appearance-maker.

original: gnas lnga la 'khor lo bsgoms nas zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas lnga la 'khor lo bsgoms nas zhes pa yin no //
translated: That is, having meditated on the wheels in the five places.

original: de dag ni mtshon pa tsam ste gzhan dag kyang bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: de dag ni mtshon pa tsam ste gzhan dag kyang bya bar mngon no //
translated: Those are just illustrations, and it is clear that others should be done.

original: nang gi gzhal yas brtsegs pa'i rgyu 'khor lo dang / snang mdzad las gyur pa gnyis bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nang gi gzhal yas brtsegs pa'i rgyu 'khor lo dang / snang mdzad las gyur pa gnyis bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the two causes of the inner celestial mansion and the stacked-up celestial mansion,

original: rdo rje nam mkha'i zhes pa'i tshigs bcad gcig smos te /
analyzed: rdo rje nam mkha'i zhes pa'i tshigs bcad gcig smos te /
translated: one verse is stated:

original: bar ma gnyis la rim bzhin mngon no //
analyzed: bar ma gnyis la rim bzhin mngon no //
translated: The two middle ones are clear in order.

original: da ni rang rang gi sa bon las mi g-yo ba'i rang bzhin du bsam pa ni /
analyzed: da ni rang rang gi sa bon las mi g-yo ba'i rang bzhin du bsam pa ni /
translated: Now, the thought of the nature of Acala arisen from one's own seed is

original: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor dbus gnas par //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor dbus gnas par //
translated: in the center of the mandala of the buddhas.

original: zhes pa rnams te /
analyzed: zhes pa rnams te /
translated: The meaning of those is

original: bdag sa bon las snang mdzad du bsgoms pa'i snying gar aom ji lta bar bsams la /
analyzed: bdag sa bon las snang mdzad du bsgoms pa'i snying gar aom ji lta bar bsams la /
translated: having meditated on oneself as Vairocana arisen from the seed, one should imagine an oṃ in the heart as before.

original: sngags aom rnam par shes pa mi g-yo bar bsgom pa ni 'gog pa'i rdo rje ste /
analyzed: sngags aom rnam par shes pa mi g-yo bar bsgom pa ni 'gog pa'i rdo rje ste /
translated: The mantra OṀ, meditating on consciousness as immovable, is the “vajra of cessation.”

original: gzhan du mi 'phro bar bsgoms na zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'phro bar bsgoms na zhes pa yin no //
translated: Meditating on it as not spreading out elsewhere is the “vajra of cessation.”

original: phyi ma la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi ma la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the following.

original: de dag gi don ni sku la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen por bsgom pa'i gnas su aom la sogs pa bsgoms la /
analyzed: de dag gi don ni sku la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen por bsgom pa'i gnas su aom la sogs pa bsgoms la /
translated: The meaning of those is that one should meditate on OṀ and so forth in the place of meditating on the great seal of body and so forth.

original: de la thig ler gyur pa'i sems 'gog pa'i rdo rje zhes pas 'jug pa la spyad do zhes bsgom par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la thig ler gyur pa'i sems 'gog pa'i rdo rje zhes pas 'jug pa la spyad do zhes bsgom par bya ba yin no //
translated: One should meditate on the mind that has become a drop in that, the “vajra of cessation,” and should meditate on it as “practicing the entry.”

original: da ni snang mdzad du gang gyur pas gong gi zla ba la aom bsams na mos pa'i dbang gis bskal pa gcig la sogs par 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni snang mdzad du gang gyur pas gong gi zla ba la aom bsams na mos pa'i dbang gis bskal pa gcig la sogs par 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that by becoming Vairochana, if one visualizes OṀ on the moon above, it will become a kalpa and so forth by the power of devotion, it says,

original: rdo rje nam mkha'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje nam mkha'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “The vajra of space,” and so forth.

original: phyi ma la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi ma la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the following.

original: spyi'i yon tan du ma nyid du bstan pa ni sku dang gsung thugs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: spyi'i yon tan du ma nyid du bstan pa ni sku dang gsung thugs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The demonstration of the many general qualities is “body, speech, mind,” and so forth.

original: de yang zhes pa ni bdag nyid dang ldan pa'i gzhan dag gis /
analyzed: de yang zhes pa ni bdag nyid dang ldan pa'i gzhan dag gis /
translated: Moreover, by others means by those who possess the self.

original: shin tu yang 'grub par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu yang 'grub par bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that they will be accomplished even in a very short time.

original: 'dir ha cang spros pa ni mi dgos kyis gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ha cang spros pa ni mi dgos kyis gtang bar bya'o //
translated: Here, it is not necessary to elaborate too much, so let us leave it at that.

original: le'u bcu gcig pa'i don rdzogs so /
analyzed: le'u bcu gcig pa'i don rdzogs so /
translated: The meaning of the eleventh chapter is complete.

original: // / da ni sngags las gyur pa'i bsgrub pa dang / yan lag bzhi'i thabs la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /🔽de nas ston pa rdo rje 'dzin //
analyzed: // / da ni sngags las gyur pa'i bsgrub pa dang / yan lag bzhi'i thabs la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir / de nas ston pa rdo rje 'dzin //
translated: Now, in order to teach the accomplishment that arises from mantra and the method of the four branches, and so on,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste //
translated: it says, Then the teacher Vajradhara, and so on.

original: de la bskyed pa'i ye shes zhes pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo dang / de'i phyir bka' stsal pa zhes so //
analyzed: de la bskyed pa'i ye shes zhes pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo dang / de'i phyir bka' stsal pa zhes so //
translated: In that, the nature of the cause is called the pristine consciousness of creation, and because of that, it says, he spoke.

original: de'i mi rtog ngo bo nyid sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' spangs pa'i rang bzhin gyis dag pa las 'gro ba sgyu ma bzhin @68b du snang ba'i rol mo bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mi rtog ngo bo nyid sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' spangs pa'i rang bzhin gyis dag pa las 'gro ba sgyu ma bzhin @68b du snang ba'i rol mo bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the display of the illusion-like appearance of migrating beings from the nature of the nonconceptual, pure nature that abandons the limits of beginning and end.

original: de nyid mi snang ba la sogs pa'i gnas ni dgon pa'i zhes pa'i tshigs bcad gcig ste /
analyzed: de nyid mi snang ba la sogs pa'i gnas ni dgon pa'i zhes pa'i tshigs bcad gcig ste /
translated: The place of that nonappearance, and so on, is the verse in a solitary place.

original: yan lag rnams dang ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag rnams dang ldan par bya'o //
translated: One should be endowed with the limbs.

original: thog mar lus la sogs pa las sa bon las gyur pa'i 'jam pa'i dbyangs bsgoms nas /
analyzed: thog mar lus la sogs pa las sa bon las gyur pa'i 'jam pa'i dbyangs bsgoms nas /
translated: First, having meditated on Mañjuśrī arisen from the seed in the body, etc.,

original: de'i snying gar gdan la mum bsams te /
analyzed: de'i snying gar gdan la mum bsams te /
translated: one should think of mum on the seat in his heart.

original: spro ba la sogs pa byas nas 'jam dpal dang 'dra zhing thams cad 'jam dpal nyid snang bar 'gyur la dngos nyid tshangs pa dang brgya byin la sogs pas kyang mthong bar mi nus zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: spro ba la sogs pa byas nas 'jam dpal dang 'dra zhing thams cad 'jam dpal nyid snang bar 'gyur la dngos nyid tshangs pa dang brgya byin la sogs pas kyang mthong bar mi nus zhes pa yin no //
translated: Having done the emanation, etc., Mañjuśrī will appear like Mañjuśrī, and even Brahmā, Śakra, etc. will not be able to see his real nature.

original: rdo rje mi phyed ces pa la sogs pas /
analyzed: rdo rje mi phyed ces pa la sogs pas /
translated: With “vajra-indivisible,” etc.,

original: da ni ril bu la sogs pa'i rdzas la mi snang ba bsgrub par bstan to //
analyzed: da ni ril bu la sogs pa'i rdzas la mi snang ba bsgrub par bstan to //
translated: now the substances such as the pill are taught to be accomplished as invisible.

original: sngags kyis mtshan pa'i rgyu ni bshad gci la sogs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: sngags kyis mtshan pa'i rgyu ni bshad gci la sogs pa lnga'o //
translated: The cause marked with the mantra is the five such as feces and urine.

original: rdo rje gsum gyi mtshan ma lcags gsum gser dang zangs dang dngul gsum gyis dkris pa aom la sogs pa'i sa bon dang ldan par byas te /
analyzed: rdo rje gsum gyi mtshan ma lcags gsum gser dang zangs dang dngul gsum gyis dkris pa aom la sogs pa'i sa bon dang ldan par byas te /
translated: The sign of the three vajras is wrapped with the three metals, gold, copper, and silver, and endowed with the seed syllables om, etc.

original: sa bon la sogs gang gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pas khar bcug nas bzlas shing bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sa bon la sogs gang gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pas khar bcug nas bzlas shing bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The yogī who has become a seed and so on should recite and meditate, having placed it in his mouth.

original: cho ga de khos ril bu de la kun gyi thugs ni gnyis su med pa'i stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: cho ga de khos ril bu de la kun gyi thugs ni gnyis su med pa'i stong pa nyid de /
translated: By that rite, that pill is the mind of all, nondual emptiness.

original: de der bsgoms na zhes so //
analyzed: de der bsgoms na zhes so //
translated: If one meditates on that, it is said.

original: 'khor lo 'od 'phro zhes pas ni de nyid bsgrub par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo 'od 'phro zhes pas ni de nyid bsgrub par bstan pa ste /
translated: By “the wheel radiating light,” it is taught that it is accomplished.

original: sngon du rang gi sngags sa bon kho nas snang mdzad du bsgoms nas de'i lag par gser la sogs pa'i rdzas las 'khor lo 'do 'phro byas te /
analyzed: sngon du rang gi sngags sa bon kho nas snang mdzad du bsgoms nas de'i lag par gser la sogs pa'i rdzas las 'khor lo 'do 'phro byas te /
translated: Having previously meditated on Vairocana with his own mantra seed, one should make a wheel radiating light from a substance such as gold in his hand.

original: de gtso bo la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhugs pa'i gnas su bsgoms na 'dir gsungs pa'i yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gtso bo la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhugs pa'i gnas su bsgoms na 'dir gsungs pa'i yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one meditates on that as the place where the principal and so on of the maṇḍala reside, one will come to possess the qualities taught here.

original: rdo rje'i sgrub pa la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rdo rje'i sgrub pa la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the accomplishment of the vajra and so on,

original: rdo rje chen po zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rdo rje chen po zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, “great vajra,” and so on.

original: de la rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / padma dang / ral gri rnams kyang gong bzhin du sa bon gyis rang gi lhar bsgoms nas ;
analyzed: de la rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / padma dang / ral gri rnams kyang gong bzhin du sa bon gyis rang gi lhar bsgoms nas ;
translated: In that regard, having meditated on the vajra, jewel, lotus, and sword as one’s deity with the seed as before,

original: de'i lag tu rdzas las rang rang gi phyag mtshan byas ta /
analyzed: de'i lag tu rdzas las rang rang gi phyag mtshan byas ta /
translated: one should make the hand implements of each one’s own deity from substances.

original: rang rang gtso bor gyur pa'i gnas su bsgoms na /
analyzed: rang rang gtso bor gyur pa'i gnas su bsgoms na /
translated: Having meditated in the place of the principal one of each one,

original: so so'i ji skad gsungs pa'i yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so so'i ji skad gsungs pa'i yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: one will possess the qualities as stated for each one.

original: aom gyi ril bu tsa na ka'i 'bru tshad ces pa rnams kyis ni gong du gsungs pa'i ril @69a * //
analyzed: aom gyi ril bu tsa na ka'i 'bru tshad ces pa rnams kyis ni gong du gsungs pa'i ril @69a * //
translated: The “oṃ-pill the size of a mustard seed” and so on clarify the previously mentioned pill and

original: bu gsal bar bya ba dang / de rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bu gsal bar bya ba dang / de rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to complete it,

original: de'i yi ge 'bru dang tshad dang rang gi lha dang gnas dang yon tan bstan to //
analyzed: de'i yi ge 'bru dang tshad dang rang gi lha dang gnas dang yon tan bstan to //
translated: the syllables, size, one’s deity, place, and qualities are taught.

original: 'khor lo sgrub pa la sogs pa gong du gsungs pa'i don gsal bar byed pa dang / de rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir gnas dang rang rang gi gtso bo bsgom pa dang / de'i lag tu rang rang gi phyag mtshan bsgom pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bsgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'khor lo sgrub pa la sogs pa gong du gsungs pa'i don gsal bar byed pa dang / de rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir gnas dang rang rang gi gtso bo bsgom pa dang / de'i lag tu rang rang gi phyag mtshan bsgom pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bsgrub pa bstan to //
translated: In order to clarify the meaning of the above-mentioned wheel accomplishment, etc., and in order to complete it, [the Bhagavān] teaches the meditation on the individual principal [deities] of the places, the meditation on the individual hand implements in their hands, and the accomplishment by the characteristics of the yogin.

original: de ni mkha' dbyings gsal ba'i zhes pa'i don lngas bstan to //
analyzed: de ni mkha' dbyings gsal ba'i zhes pa'i don lngas bstan to //
translated: That is taught by five topics beginning with the clear sky-element.

original: gong ma bzhin du gzhan la yang sgrub par gsungs pa ni tri sh'u la kyo ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gong ma bzhin du gzhan la yang sgrub par gsungs pa ni tri sh'u la kyo ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The teaching of accomplishment in others as above is taught by the goad of the trident, etc.

original: sku la sogs pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i rim pas so //
translated: [It is] by the sequence of body, etc.

original: lam gyi bzhi mdo zhes pa la sogs pa ni dgug pa'i cho ga bstan to //
analyzed: lam gyi bzhi mdo zhes pa la sogs pa ni dgug pa'i cho ga bstan to //
translated: The crossroads, etc. teaches the rite of summoning.

original: de la mtshan ma gcig ni bde ba'i ling+ga ste /
analyzed: de la mtshan ma gcig ni bde ba'i ling+ga ste /
translated: There, the single sign is the blissful liṅga.

original: de bzhi'i gnas su yan lag dang ldan pas sngags las gyur pa'i skyes bu bsams nas kyo ba dang lcags kyo ba la sogs pas sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje dgug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhi'i gnas su yan lag dang ldan pas sngags las gyur pa'i skyes bu bsams nas kyo ba dang lcags kyo ba la sogs pas sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje dgug pa'i phyir /
translated: with the hook, iron hook, etc.

original: dgug bya de nyid rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas par bsams te /
analyzed: dgug bya de nyid rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas par bsams te /
translated: The one to be summoned is imagined to be situated on the wind mandala.

original: de nyid sangs rgyas dgug par sbyor ba'i dam tshig las byung ba zhes so ;🔽/ de nyid kyis /
analyzed: de nyid sangs rgyas dgug par sbyor ba'i dam tshig las byung ba zhes so ; / de nyid kyis /
translated: That is the pledge arisen from the application of summoning the Buddhas.

original: rnam par snang mdzad 'khor lo'i mchog / ces pa la sogs pas rigs gang gtso bor gyur pa'i phyag mtshan bsgoms nas /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad 'khor lo'i mchog / ces pa la sogs pas rigs gang gtso bor gyur pa'i phyag mtshan bsgoms nas /
translated: With that, one should meditate on the insignia of the family that is the chief one, such as the wheel of Vairochana, etc.

original: de rgyal ba dag gi gnas su bsams na ni /
analyzed: de rgyal ba dag gi gnas su bsams na ni /
translated: If one imagines that in the place of the Victor,

original: 'khor la la sogs pa de dag ni dam tshig ste de dgug pa ni lcags kyo kho nas bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor la la sogs pa de dag ni dam tshig ste de dgug pa ni lcags kyo kho nas bya ba'o //
translated: then those retinue, etc. are the pledges. Summoning them is done only with the hook.🔽It is clear that one should summon them with the wheel, etc.

original: des ni gong du rlung la gnas pa ni 'khor lo la sogs pas kyang dgug par mngon no //
analyzed: des ni gong du rlung la gnas pa ni 'khor lo la sogs pas kyang dgug par mngon no //
translated: situated on the wind mandala.

original: 'gugs byed nyid ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: 'gugs byed nyid ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is one the summoner?

original: rnam pa dang ldan pa'i sku gang yin pa bsgoms la /
analyzed: rnam pa dang ldan pa'i sku gang yin pa bsgoms la /
translated: Meditate on the body endowed with the aspects.

original: de'i lag tu sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin kyo ba la sogs pa bsgoms nas rlung la gnas pa'i bsgrub bya dgug par byas nas zhes so //
analyzed: de'i lag tu sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin kyo ba la sogs pa bsgoms nas rlung la gnas pa'i bsgrub bya dgug par byas nas zhes so //
translated: Meditate on the hook, etc. , which is the nature of body, speech, and mind, in his hand, and having summoned the victim who is situated in the wind, one should draw him in.

original: da ni rnam pa'i mchog ces pa la sogs pa sa ni dbyer med pa'i rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rnam pa'i mchog ces pa la sogs pa sa ni dbyer med pa'i rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, beginning with “the supreme aspect, etc. ,” in order to purify the indivisible,

original: bza' ba'i sbyor ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bza' ba'i sbyor ba gsungs so //
translated: the application of eating is taught.

original: bdag rigs gang yin pa de'i skur bsgoms la de'i lce la rdo rje'i @69b sbyor bas de nyid bsgoms na zhes so //
analyzed: bdag rigs gang yin pa de'i skur bsgoms la de'i lce la rdo rje'i @69b sbyor bas de nyid bsgoms na zhes so //
translated: Meditate on oneself as the body of the family that one is, and meditate on that very thing by the vajra application on the tongue.

original: gsang ba gsum zhes pa ni h'um gis sbyang ba dang / aam gis rtogs par bya ba dang / aom gyis 'bar bar bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba gsum zhes pa ni h'um gis sbyang ba dang / aam gis rtogs par bya ba dang / aom gyis 'bar bar bsgom pa'o //
translated: The three secrets are the meditation on the purification by HŪṀ, the realization by ĀḤ, and the blazing by OṀ.

original: sha chen la sogs pa ni go sla ba ste /
analyzed: sha chen la sogs pa ni go sla ba ste /
translated: The great flesh, etc. , are easy to understand.

original: med na yang bsam pa ni dgos pa med pa'i sems kyis sha rnams ma rnyed na kha zas kun la de nyid bsgom zhing brtag go //
analyzed: med na yang bsam pa ni dgos pa med pa'i sems kyis sha rnams ma rnyed na kha zas kun la de nyid bsgom zhing brtag go //
translated: If one does not have them, one should meditate on them with a mind that is not desirous. If one does not find the flesh, one should meditate on that very thing in all foods, and examine it.

original: phyag rgya bzhi sku nyid la ldan par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhi sku nyid la ldan par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the four seals are possessed by the body itself,

original: rdo rje can gyis zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje can gyis zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “the vajra holder,” and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad mchog ldan pa /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mchog ldan pa /
translated: Endowed with the supreme of all aspects,

original: rang lus ngag yid rdo rjer brlabs pa'i /
analyzed: rang lus ngag yid rdo rjer brlabs pa'i /
translated: one’s body, speech, and mind are consecrated as vajra.

original: snying gar ye shes dam tshig ste ;
analyzed: snying gar ye shes dam tshig ste ;
translated: At the heart, the pledge of pristine consciousness,

original: rdo rje mchog 'dzin cod pan du'o //
analyzed: rdo rje mchog 'dzin cod pan du'o //
translated: is the crown of the supreme vajra holder.

original: de'i lce la h'um las rdo rje bsgom par byas nas /
analyzed: de'i lce la h'um las rdo rje bsgom par byas nas /
translated: Having meditated on the vajra from hūṃ on one’s tongue,

original: bdud rtsi lnga dag par byed pa'i cho gas zos na rdo rje gsum thob par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga dag par byed pa'i cho gas zos na rdo rje gsum thob par 'gyur ro /
translated: if one eats the five nectars consecrated by the rite, one will attain the three vajras.

original: de'i cho ga ni gong gi rdo rje'i 'og tu yam las rlung gi dkyil 'khor de'i steng du ram las me'i dkyil 'khor /
analyzed: de'i cho ga ni gong gi rdo rje'i 'og tu yam las rlung gi dkyil 'khor de'i steng du ram las me'i dkyil 'khor /
translated: The rite is as follows: Below the vajra, from yaṃ, is the maṇḍala of air; above that, from raṃ, is the maṇḍala of fire;

original: de'i steng du a'a:las bskyed pa'i padmo'i snod du btags te de'i nang gi bdud rtsi lnga la 'bru lngas mtshan par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du a'a:las bskyed pa'i padmo'i snod du btags te de'i nang gi bdud rtsi lnga la 'bru lngas mtshan par bya'o //
translated: above that, from āḥ, is a lotus vessel, in which the five nectars are placed.

original: sha lnga yang de ste /
analyzed: sha lnga yang de ste /
translated: The five meats are also that.🔽The vajra, light, and fire

original: rdo rje'i 'od dang me 'bar pas /
analyzed: rdo rje'i 'od dang me 'bar pas /
translated: burn,

original: de kun zhu ba la sogs par bya ba dang / ro mi bzad pa myang ste /
analyzed: de kun zhu ba la sogs par bya ba dang / ro mi bzad pa myang ste /
translated: All of that is to be melted, etc. , and tasted with an unbearable relish.

original: de'i steng du aom dkar po bkod pa'i 'od kyis rgyal ba'i gzugs rnams de'i nang du thim nas /
analyzed: de'i steng du aom dkar po bkod pa'i 'od kyis rgyal ba'i gzugs rnams de'i nang du thim nas /
translated: On top of that, having arranged a white OṀ, the forms of the Victorious Ones melt into it with their light.

original: 'bru gsum gyi gzugs kyis mngon par du ma bzlas nas bdag dang dkyil 'khor gyi lce la h'um las gyur pa'i rdo rje bsgoms nas /
analyzed: 'bru gsum gyi gzugs kyis mngon par du ma bzlas nas bdag dang dkyil 'khor gyi lce la h'um las gyur pa'i rdo rje bsgoms nas /
translated: Having recited the three seed syllables, one should visualize a vajra arisen from a HŪṀ on one's own and the mandala's tongue.

original: snying gi zla ba'i dkyil na gnas pa'i 'khor lo tshim par bya'o //
analyzed: snying gi zla ba'i dkyil na gnas pa'i 'khor lo tshim par bya'o //
translated: One should satisfy the wheel that is located in the moon disk of the heart.

original: la la dag ni lce'i rdo rje'i h'um gi steng 'og tu aam dang aom bsams te /
analyzed: la la dag ni lce'i rdo rje'i h'um gi steng 'og tu aam dang aom bsams te /
translated: Some visualize an AṀ and an OṀ above and below the HŪṀ of the vajra of the tongue.

original: bzlas pas sku la sogs pa'i 'od kyis zas kyi dngos po rnams zhu ste /
analyzed: bzlas pas sku la sogs pa'i 'od kyis zas kyi dngos po rnams zhu ste /
translated: By the recitation, the light of the body, etc. , melts the substance of the food.

original: mi dmigs pa kho nar bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa kho nar bya'o zhes so //
translated: One should make it disappear.

original: cho ga de'i yon tan gsungs pa /
analyzed: cho ga de'i yon tan gsungs pa /
translated: The qualities of that rite are stated:

original: rdo rje dam tshig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dam tshig la sogs pa'o //
translated: The vajra commitments, etc.

original: 'khor lo'i dam tshig ces pa la sogs pas ni de nyid kyi rigs la sogs pa 'grub pa'i yon tan bstan to //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i dam tshig ces pa la sogs pas ni de nyid kyi rigs la sogs pa 'grub pa'i yon tan bstan to //
translated: The wheel commitments, etc. , indicate the quality of the accomplishment of the family, etc. of that very [vajra commitment].

original: da ni gong du gsungs pa'i mngon par shes pa'i ngo bo dang yon tan rim bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /🔽gang+g'a'i bye snyed @70a * //
analyzed: da ni gong du gsungs pa'i mngon par shes pa'i ngo bo dang yon tan rim bzhin bstan pa'i phyir / gang+g'a'i bye snyed @70a * //
translated: it is clearly stated from

original: sangs rgyas rnams //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams //
translated: “buddhas equal to the sands of the Ganges”

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: up to

original: bgrod par 'gyur zhes pa'i bar du gsal bar smos so //
analyzed: bgrod par 'gyur zhes pa'i bar du gsal bar smos so //
translated: “will be attained.”

original: 'dir lus rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir lus rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, in order to establish the body,

original: yan lag bzhi 'bras bu dang bcas pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: yan lag bzhi 'bras bu dang bcas pa gsungs pa /
translated: the four branches with their results are taught.

original: bsnyen pa'i dam tshig ces pa la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: bsnyen pa'i dam tshig ces pa la sogs pa'o ;
translated: [This is] stated by “the pledge of approach” and so forth.

original: / byang chub mchog gi rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: / byang chub mchog gi rang bzhin ni //
translated: The nature of supreme awakening

original: rnam pa gsum gyis yang dag bshad //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gyis yang dag bshad //
translated: is explained in three ways.

original: gzhi dang thabs dang rang bzhin gsum //
analyzed: gzhi dang thabs dang rang bzhin gsum //
translated: The basis, the method, and the nature

original: so so'i bye brag shes par bya'o //
analyzed: so so'i bye brag shes par bya'o //
translated: should be known as individual distinctions.

original: spyi'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is a verse of general summary.

original: byang chub rdo rje rtogs pa yi //
analyzed: byang chub rdo rje rtogs pa yi //
translated: The method for realizing vajra awakening

original: thabs ni rnam pa bzhi dag ste //
analyzed: thabs ni rnam pa bzhi dag ste //
translated: is of four kinds.

original: rdo rje bye brag bcu drug dbye //
analyzed: rdo rje bye brag bcu drug dbye //
translated: The vajra is divided into sixteen aspects,

original: de nas las rnams brtsam par bya //
analyzed: de nas las rnams brtsam par bya //
translated: and then the activities should be undertaken.

original: bar gyi sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: bar gyi sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is a verse of intermediate summary.

original: thog mar / snying rje sems ldan gtong ba la sogs yon tan brgyan pa snod rung dang // dpal ldan 'dus pa'i don zhugs cho ga bzhin du dbang bskur snod bcas pas //
analyzed: thog mar / snying rje sems ldan gtong ba la sogs yon tan brgyan pa snod rung dang // dpal ldan 'dus pa'i don zhugs cho ga bzhin du dbang bskur snod bcas pas //
translated: and the consecration is performed by the conferral of empowerment according to the rite,

original: ri la sogs pa chu tshogs ljon shing mchog gi phreng pas klu bas pa'i gnas //
analyzed: ri la sogs pa chu tshogs ljon shing mchog gi phreng pas klu bas pa'i gnas //
translated: in a place such as a mountain, which is adorned with a multitude of streams and a garland of excellent trees.🔽There, the preliminary application is the homage with enthusiasm, the offering, the confession, the dedication,🔽the going for refuge, and the generation of the spirit of enlightenment,

original: de ru spro ba'i sgo nas phyag btsal mchod dang bshags dang bsngo ba dang // skyabs su 'gro dang sems bskyed sbyor ba dang po dang // dkyil 'khor don dang las kyi ting nge 'dzin rnams ni //
analyzed: de ru spro ba'i sgo nas phyag btsal mchod dang bshags dang bsngo ba dang // skyabs su 'gro dang sems bskyed sbyor ba dang po dang // dkyil 'khor don dang las kyi ting nge 'dzin rnams ni //
translated: and the main practice is the meaning of the maṇḍala and the samādhi of action.

original: dge pa 'phel don byang chub phyir bya'o //
analyzed: dge pa 'phel don byang chub phyir bya'o //
translated: These should be performed for the sake of increasing virtue and for the sake of enlightenment.

original: don gong 'og tu bstan pas bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: don gong 'og tu bstan pas bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is a verse in the middle section, taught by the above and below meanings.

original: sangs rgyas gtso bo'i yum dag la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gtso bo'i yum dag la //
translated: The mothers of the principal buddhas

original: mnyes par byas kyang mi 'chags te //
analyzed: mnyes par byas kyang mi 'chags te //
translated: are not pleased by confession.

original: 'dod pa'i longs spyod thams cad la //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i longs spyod thams cad la //
translated: All enjoyments of desire

original: bsten na myur du 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: bsten na myur du 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: are quickly accomplished by reliance.

original: don gong du bstan pas bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: don gong du bstan pas bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: The verse summarizes the above meaning.

original: de rnams kyi ha cang spros pa ni yi ge mangs su dogs pas ma bris te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi ha cang spros pa ni yi ge mangs su dogs pas ma bris te /
translated: I have not written about their extensive elaboration here for fear of verbosity.

original: gzhung bsnyag go //
analyzed: gzhung bsnyag go //
translated: The text is concluded.

original: 'dir bar gyi sdom bshad pa //
analyzed: 'dir bar gyi sdom bshad pa //
translated: Here is the explanation of the intermediate summary.

original: gong ma'i rim pas 'bru gsum zhu nas tshad med pa'i rgyu mthun gyi gzugs kyi lha mo bzhis dbyangs kyis bskul nas /
analyzed: gong ma'i rim pas 'bru gsum zhu nas tshad med pa'i rgyu mthun gyi gzugs kyi lha mo bzhis dbyangs kyis bskul nas /
translated: The three seed syllables melt into the sequence above, and the four goddesses of form that are the natural outflow of the immeasurable ones exhort with song.

original: yig 'bru dang phyag mtshan las skur bskyed pa ni chung ngu'i bsnyen pa /
analyzed: yig 'bru dang phyag mtshan las skur bskyed pa ni chung ngu'i bsnyen pa /
translated: The creation of the form from the seed syllable and hand implement is the lesser approach.

original: 'bras bu bzhi las ni rgyu mthun gyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu bzhi las ni rgyu mthun gyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: Of the four results, it is the result that is the natural outflow.

original: lung nas phung po la sogs 'byin @70b gyis brlab pa'i rnam smin med pa la /
analyzed: lung nas phung po la sogs 'byin @70b gyis brlab pa'i rnam smin med pa la /
translated: In the scriptures, the blessings of the emanation of the aggregates and so on do not have the result of ripening.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Because omniscience is not accomplished.

original: rdo rje'i skye mched rim pa 'dis rnam par spyad pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i skye mched rim pa 'dis rnam par spyad pa'o //
translated: The vajra sense bases are practiced in this sequence.

original: mig gnyis la kshim dang 'khor lo las snang mdzad dang 'dra ba'i sa'i snying po bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: mig gnyis la kshim dang 'khor lo las snang mdzad dang 'dra ba'i sa'i snying po bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In the two eyes, meditate on kṣiṃ and Akṣobhya similar to Akṣobhya.

original: de ltar rna ba dang sna dang lce dang spyi bo dang lte ba la rim bzhin du dzam dang kham dang gh'am dang kam dang sam dang rang rang gi phyag mtshan las gyur pa'i phyag na rdo rje dang / nam mkha'i snying po dang / ngag gi dbang phyug dang /🔽sgrib pa sel ba dang / kun du bzang po dang de rnams bsgom mo //🔽gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched drug la rim bzhin du /🔽dza:h'um bam ho:kham ram dang / rang rang gi phyag mtshan las gyur pa'i /
analyzed: de ltar rna ba dang sna dang lce dang spyi bo dang lte ba la rim bzhin du dzam dang kham dang gh'am dang kam dang sam dang rang rang gi phyag mtshan las gyur pa'i phyag na rdo rje dang / nam mkha'i snying po dang / ngag gi dbang phyug dang / sgrib pa sel ba dang / kun du bzang po dang de rnams bsgom mo // gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched drug la rim bzhin du / dza:h'um bam ho:kham ram dang / rang rang gi phyag mtshan las gyur pa'i /
translated: Avalokiteśvara, and Samantabhadra, who arise from the seed syllables jaṃ, khaṃ, ghaṃ, paṃ, and śaṃ, respectively, and from the hand implements of Vajrapāṇi, etc., in the ear, nose, tongue, head, and navel.

original: gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa bsgom mo //
translated: One meditates on Rūpavajrā, etc., who arise from the seed syllables jriṃ, kṣiṃ, kraṃ, bhrūṃ, and haṃ, respectively, and from the hand implements of Rūpavajrā, etc., in the six sense bases of form, etc.

original: phyi nang gi sa'i khams la sogs pa la rim bzhin du lam dang / mam dang bam dang / t'am dang / rang rang gi gtso bo'i phyag mtshan las gyur pa'i spyan ma la sogs pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: phyi nang gi sa'i khams la sogs pa la rim bzhin du lam dang / mam dang bam dang / t'am dang / rang rang gi gtso bo'i phyag mtshan las gyur pa'i spyan ma la sogs pa bsgom mo //
translated: One meditates on Locanā, etc., who arise from the seed syllables laṃ, maṃ, baṃ, taṃ, and raṃ, respectively, and from the hand implements of the principal deities of Locanā, etc., in the outer and inner earth element, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga la rim bzhin du bhr'um dang a'am dang dzr'im dang kham dang h'um dang / rang rang gi phyag mtshan las gyur pa'i snang mdzad dang / dkon mchog dpal dang / tshe dpag med dang / gdon mi za ba dang /🔽mi bskyod pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga la rim bzhin du bhr'um dang a'am dang dzr'im dang kham dang h'um dang / rang rang gi phyag mtshan las gyur pa'i snang mdzad dang / dkon mchog dpal dang / tshe dpag med dang / gdon mi za ba dang / mi bskyod pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: From each of those seed syllables arises a hand implement, from which arises Vairocana, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitāyus, Amoghasiddhi, and Akṣobhya.

original: de ni chung ngu'i nye bar bsgrub pa dang / rnam smin gyi 'bras bu'o //🔽lung nas sku gsum gyis rnam par dag pa'i don du /
analyzed: de ni chung ngu'i nye bar bsgrub pa dang / rnam smin gyi 'bras bu'o // lung nas sku gsum gyis rnam par dag pa'i don du /
translated: That is the small-seal practice and the fruitional effect.

original: lus ngag yid gsum byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lus ngag yid gsum byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir /
translated: In the scriptures, the three bodies are blessed as the three places of body, speech, and mind.

original: bdag rang gi gnas su h'um dang a'am dang aom las rang rang gi phyag mtshan du gyur /
analyzed: bdag rang gi gnas su h'um dang a'am dang aom las rang rang gi phyag mtshan du gyur /
translated: In one’s own place, from Hūṃ, Aṃ, and Oṃ arise the hand implements of the three places.

original: de gnyis las skur bsams te /
analyzed: de gnyis las skur bsams te /
translated: From those two arise the three bodies.

original: sku'i thugs ka'i phyag mtshan dang yig 'bru las lha mo spros nas rang rang gi rigs su gtogs pa la mchod par bsam zhing dbyangs kyis bskul bas /
analyzed: sku'i thugs ka'i phyag mtshan dang yig 'bru las lha mo spros nas rang rang gi rigs su gtogs pa la mchod par bsam zhing dbyangs kyis bskul bas /
translated: From the hand implements and seed syllables in the heart of the body, imagine goddesses emanate and make offerings to those of their own type.

original: thim pa dang so so'i sngags brjod pa la sogs pa ni chung ngu'i sgrub pa skyes bus byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: thim pa dang so so'i sngags brjod pa la sogs pa ni chung ngu'i sgrub pa skyes bus byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The dissolution and recitation of the individual mantras and so forth are the results of the small accomplishment that is created by a person.

original: lung nas thugs ka'i zla ba'i steng du ye shes sems dpa' bsgom /
analyzed: lung nas thugs ka'i zla ba'i steng du ye shes sems dpa' bsgom /
translated: In the oral instructions, one meditates on the gnosis being above the moon at the heart.

original: de'i thugs ka'i sa bon gyi 'od kyis rgyal ba @71a * //🔽rnams bskul nas /
analyzed: de'i thugs ka'i sa bon gyi 'od kyis rgyal ba @71a * // rnams bskul nas /
translated: The light from the seed syllable in its heart invites the conquerors.

original: lus la thim nas lha mo bdud rtsi'i bum pa thogs pa mang por spros pas dbang bskur bar bsam /
analyzed: lus la thim nas lha mo bdud rtsi'i bum pa thogs pa mang por spros pas dbang bskur bar bsam /
translated: They dissolve into one’s body and are conferred empowerment by many goddesses holding vases of elixir.

original: spyi bo'i dbu rgyan la mi bskyod ba bsgom par bya'o /
analyzed: spyi bo'i dbu rgyan la mi bskyod ba bsgom par bya'o /
translated: One should meditate on Akṣobhya in the crown ornament.

original: de ltar dbang bskur ba ni chung ngu'i sgrub pa chen po bral ba'i 'bras bu'o //🔽'bring gi yan lag bzhi ni bdag gtso bo'i skur bskyed tsam na /
analyzed: de ltar dbang bskur ba ni chung ngu'i sgrub pa chen po bral ba'i 'bras bu'o // 'bring gi yan lag bzhi ni bdag gtso bo'i skur bskyed tsam na /
translated: Conferring empowerment in that way is the result of the small accomplishment that is free from elaborations.

original: yum yang myu gu dang grib ma'i tshul du bskyed pa ni 'bring gi bsnyen pa /
analyzed: yum yang myu gu dang grib ma'i tshul du bskyed pa ni 'bring gi bsnyen pa /
translated: The four branches of the medium are as follows: When one merely generates the body of the principal as oneself, the mother is generated in the manner of a sprout and a shadow.🔽This is the medium approximation.

original: bdag dang 'dra bar yum gyi mig la sogs pa gong bzhin byin gyis brlab pa ni 'bring gi nye ba'i sgrub pa /
analyzed: bdag dang 'dra bar yum gyi mig la sogs pa gong bzhin byin gyis brlab pa ni 'bring gi nye ba'i sgrub pa /
translated: The consecration of the eyes, etc. , of the mother, as above, is the medium approximation.

original: de nyid sku gsung thugs su byin gyis brlab pa ni 'bring gi sgrub po //
analyzed: de nyid sku gsung thugs su byin gyis brlab pa ni 'bring gi sgrub po //
translated: The consecration of that as body, speech, and mind is the medium evocation.

original: yum de'i thugs kar ye shes sems dpa' bsgoms la dbu rgyan la bdag pos dbang bskur ba ni 'bring gi sgrub pa chen po'o //
analyzed: yum de'i thugs kar ye shes sems dpa' bsgoms la dbu rgyan la bdag pos dbang bskur ba ni 'bring gi sgrub pa chen po'o //
translated: The meditation on the awareness being at the heart of that mother, and the consecration by the lord on the crown, is the great medium evocation.

original: 'bras bu bzhi ni gong ma bzhin sbyar ro //🔽lha bcu dgu'i gdan dang sku mdog dang phyag mtshan gsal bar bskyed pa ni chen po'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang chen po'i bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu bzhi ni gong ma bzhin sbyar ro // lha bcu dgu'i gdan dang sku mdog dang phyag mtshan gsal bar bskyed pa ni chen po'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang chen po'i bsnyen pa'o //
translated: The four fruits are to be applied as above.🔽The generation of the clear images of the seats, bodies, and hand implements of the nineteen deities is the result corresponding to the great cause and the great approximation.

original: lha de rnams re re zhing mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa ni chen po'i rnam smin gyi 'bras bu chen po'i nye ba'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: lha de rnams re re zhing mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa ni chen po'i rnam smin gyi 'bras bu chen po'i nye ba'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: The consecration of the eyes, etc. , of each of those deities is the matured result of the great cause and the medium evocation of the great cause.

original: gsol pa gdab pa med par thams cad sku gsung thugs su byin gyis brlabs pa ni chen po'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang chen po'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gsol pa gdab pa med par thams cad sku gsung thugs su byin gyis brlabs pa ni chen po'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang chen po'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: The consecration of everything as body, speech, and mind without supplication is the effect of the action of a great person and the great accomplishment.

original: lha bcu dgu'i thugs kar ye shes sems dpa' bsgoms nas /
analyzed: lha bcu dgu'i thugs kar ye shes sems dpa' bsgoms nas /
translated: Having meditated on the gnosis beings in the hearts of the nineteen deities,

original: dbu rgyan la rigs kyi bdag pos dbang bskur ba ni chen po'i bral ba'i 'bras bu dang / chen po'i sgrub pa chen po'o //
analyzed: dbu rgyan la rigs kyi bdag pos dbang bskur ba ni chen po'i bral ba'i 'bras bu dang / chen po'i sgrub pa chen po'o //
translated: the consecration by the masters of the families on the crown is the effect of the separation of a great person and the great great accomplishment.

original: sbyor ba'i bsnyen sgrub bzhi ni bsgrub bya dang / sgrub pa po gnyis kyi padma dang rdo rje'i sbyor ba ni bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i bsnyen sgrub bzhi ni bsgrub bya dang / sgrub pa po gnyis kyi padma dang rdo rje'i sbyor ba ni bsnyen pa'o //
translated: The four accomplishments of union are as follows: The union of the lotus and vajra of both the object of attainment and the practitioner is the approach.

original: rdo rje dang padma lhan cig zhugs pa'i de ma thag gang reg pa de ni nye ba'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma lhan cig zhugs pa'i de ma thag gang reg pa de ni nye ba'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: The moment the vajra and lotus enter together, whatever touches it is the near accomplishment.

original: rdo rje dang padma h'um las bskyed pa la ;
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma h'um las bskyed pa la ;
translated: The vajra and lotus generated from hūṃ

original: phat ser pos sems byung ba dgag pa'i las khyad par gyi ngo bos bskyod pa de ni sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: phat ser pos sems byung ba dgag pa'i las khyad par gyi ngo bos bskyod pa de ni sgrub pa'o //
translated: are moved by the special nature of the action of blocking the arising of the mind with yellow phaṭ. That is the accomplishment.

original: de'i de ma thag gnyis su med pa de las bde ba chen po 'byung ba ni sgrub pa chen po'o //
analyzed: de'i de ma thag gnyis su med pa de las bde ba chen po 'byung ba ni sgrub pa chen po'o //
translated: The great accomplishment is the arising of great bliss from that nondual state.

original: 'dir dang po'i rim pas dang po'i stong par bsgom pa nas /
analyzed: 'dir dang po'i rim pas dang po'i stong par bsgom pa nas /
translated: Here, the first stage is the meditation on the first emptiness,

original: aa nu r'a gas @71b rjes su chags pa mthar thug pa ni sbyor ba dang po'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: aa nu r'a gas @71b rjes su chags pa mthar thug pa ni sbyor ba dang po'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: and the ultimate passion of the anurāga is the first-stage samādhi.

original: dkyil 'khor dbyung ba nas /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dbyung ba nas /
translated: The ultimate emission of the maṇḍala🔽is the samādhi of the supreme victor.🔽The ultimate tasting of the elixir🔽is the samādhi of the supreme victor of activity.🔽The ultimate dissolution

original: bdud rtsi myang ba'i mthar thug pa ni rgyal ba'i mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //🔽de'i de ma thag thig le'i sbyor ba nas /
analyzed: bdud rtsi myang ba'i mthar thug pa ni rgyal ba'i mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to // de'i de ma thag thig le'i sbyor ba nas /
translated: is the supreme samādhi of the supreme victor.🔽The ultimate dissolution

original: bsdus pa'i mthar thug pa ni las kyi rgyal ba'i mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i mthar thug pa ni las kyi rgyal ba'i mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: is the supreme samādhi of the supreme victor of activity.

original: smon lam dang khrus dang dbang bskur ba dang / sdom pa bzung ba dang / nyal ba dang langs pa dang / bza' ba'i cho ga dang / spro bsdu dang dngos grub bsgrub pa la sogs pa ste go sla bas gzhung bsnyeg go //
analyzed: smon lam dang khrus dang dbang bskur ba dang / sdom pa bzung ba dang / nyal ba dang langs pa dang / bza' ba'i cho ga dang / spro bsdu dang dngos grub bsgrub pa la sogs pa ste go sla bas gzhung bsnyeg go //
translated: The aspirations, ablutions, empowerments, taking vows, sleeping and rising, the rite of eating, expanding and withdrawing, and accomplishing feats, and so on, are easy to understand and should be applied to the treatise.

original: ha cang spros pa gzhag go ;
analyzed: ha cang spros pa gzhag go ;
translated: The extensive elaboration is set aside.

original: / thabs shes rab kyi ting nge 'dzin la sbyor bas /
analyzed: / thabs shes rab kyi ting nge 'dzin la sbyor bas /
translated: By applying oneself to the samādhi of method and wisdom,

original: gtso bo'i byang chub sa bon dang ldan par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: gtso bo'i byang chub sa bon dang ldan par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: one should meditate on the seed syllable of the principal deity.

original: bsnyen pa'i bye brag ni /🔽thun mong mchog gi bye brag gis //
analyzed: bsnyen pa'i bye brag ni / thun mong mchog gi bye brag gis //
translated: The specific approach is🔽the four types of approach

original: bsnyen pa rnam pa bzhi ru 'gyur //
analyzed: bsnyen pa rnam pa bzhi ru 'gyur //
translated: through the distinctions of common and supreme.

original: zhes te / thun mong gi bsnyen pa re zhig gcig gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes te / thun mong gi bsnyen pa re zhig gcig gsungs pa /
translated: The common approach is taught as follows:

original: 'og nas yang na rdo rje bzhi //
analyzed: 'og nas yang na rdo rje bzhi //
translated: Or else, the four vajras

original: zhes pa dang / rdo rje rnam bzhi thun mong ste //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / rdo rje rnam bzhi thun mong ste //
translated: are common to all.

original: zhes pa'o // thun mong gi bsnyen pa gnyis pa ni yan lag drug tu zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // thun mong gi bsnyen pa gnyis pa ni yan lag drug tu zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The second common approach is referred to by “six-branched yoga” and so on.

original: mchog gi bsnyen pa gnyis ni mchog ni ye shes bdud rtsi'o zhes pa dang / bsgrub bya bsgrub par sbyor pa la 'byung ba zhes pa'i tshig gnyis yin no //
analyzed: mchog gi bsnyen pa gnyis ni mchog ni ye shes bdud rtsi'o zhes pa dang / bsgrub bya bsgrub par sbyor pa la 'byung ba zhes pa'i tshig gnyis yin no //
translated: The two supreme approaches are referred to by “supreme is the nectar of wisdom” and “arising in the practice of the object of attainment.”

original: nye bar bsgrub pa ni rigs kyi mchog tu gang gyur pa'i mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams rdo rje'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par dpyad pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar bsgrub pa ni rigs kyi mchog tu gang gyur pa'i mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams rdo rje'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par dpyad pa ste /
translated: The close practice is the analysis of the eye and so on, which are the best of the sense-fields, in the nature of the vajras.

original: byin gyis brlab pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the consecration.

original: bdag po bsgom pas sgrub pa'i tshe na rgyal ba rnams /
analyzed: bdag po bsgom pas sgrub pa'i tshe na rgyal ba rnams /
translated: When one is practicing the meditation on the lord, the victors

original: 'od zer dang tshigs bcad kyis bskul ba dang bdag po nyid sku gsung thugs su byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: 'od zer dang tshigs bcad kyis bskul ba dang bdag po nyid sku gsung thugs su byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: exhort with light-rays and verses, and the lord himself consecrates body, speech, and mind.

original: sgrub pa chen po'i tshe na bdag gang gyur pa'i dbu rgyan la sa bon las gyur pa'i bdag po ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po'i tshe na bdag gang gyur pa'i dbu rgyan la sa bon las gyur pa'i bdag po ste /
translated: When one is practicing the great practice, one should imagine the lord arisen from the seed in the crown of one's head,

original: rdo rje can nyid kyi gzugs bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje can nyid kyi gzugs bsam par bya'o //
translated: in the form of the vajra-holder.

original: rnal 'byor pa nyid ye shes rdo rje ste des 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa nyid ye shes rdo rje ste des 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The yogin himself is the wisdom-vajra, and by that he is accomplished.

original: sku gsung thugs gsum ka'i ngo bo gsungs ba /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs gsum ka'i ngo bo gsungs ba /
translated: The essence of the three, body, speech, and mind, is stated:

original: bsnyen pa'i ye shes zhes pa ste /
analyzed: bsnyen pa'i ye shes zhes pa ste /
translated: The wisdom of the approach,🔽 the essence of the melting of the seed of the principal.

original: gtso bo'i sa bon zhu ba'i ngo bo de'i gnas ni dgon pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gtso bo'i sa bon zhu ba'i ngo bo de'i gnas ni dgon pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The place of that is the forest, and so on.

original: yang na zhes @72a * //
analyzed: yang na zhes @72a * //
translated: Or,🔽

original: pa la sogs pas ni chen po'i bsnyen pa dang de'i 'bras bu bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: pa la sogs pas ni chen po'i bsnyen pa dang de'i 'bras bu bstan pa yin te /
translated: Or and so forth explain the great approximation and its result,

original: lha cig gi de ma thag pa'i dgu'i don bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha cig gi de ma thag pa'i dgu'i don bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning of the nine immediately following the one deity is explained.

original: bsnyen pa kho nas gzhan yang shes par bya ste /
analyzed: bsnyen pa kho nas gzhan yang shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand the others by means of the approximation alone.

original: 'bring po yang shugs kyis mngon no //
analyzed: 'bring po yang shugs kyis mngon no //
translated: The medium is also understood by implication.

original: 'dir gong du rim par bkod pa ni chung ngu'i yan lag tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gong du rim par bkod pa ni chung ngu'i yan lag tu shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the sequence above should be understood as a branch of the small.

original: rdo rje bzhi ni dang po stong pa byang chub ste zhes pa rnams te /
analyzed: rdo rje bzhi ni dang po stong pa byang chub ste zhes pa rnams te /
translated: The four vajras are the first emptiness enlightenment and so forth.

original: sbyor ba'i padma'i nang du dang po sa bon zhu ba dang / de nas de las gyur pa'i gnyis pa gtso bo'i sa bon sems kyi yig 'bru dang / yang de las gyur pa'i gsum pa 'khor lo rdzogs pa dang / de nas bzhi pa badzra dhrika ces pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyis zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i padma'i nang du dang po sa bon zhu ba dang / de nas de las gyur pa'i gnyis pa gtso bo'i sa bon sems kyi yig 'bru dang / yang de las gyur pa'i gsum pa 'khor lo rdzogs pa dang / de nas bzhi pa badzra dhrika ces pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyis zhes pa'o //
translated: The first is the melting of the seed in the lotus of union, then from that the second, the seed of the principal deity, the mental syllable, then from that the third, the complete wheel, then the fourth, the mantra of vajradhṛk and so forth.

original: gnas lnga zhes pa rig ma'i gnas so //
analyzed: gnas lnga zhes pa rig ma'i gnas so //
translated: The five places are the places of the knowledge consort.

original: der ye shes kyi rang bzhin rigs lnga'i sa bon aom bsgoms na mi 'da' pa'i sdom pa yin no //
analyzed: der ye shes kyi rang bzhin rigs lnga'i sa bon aom bsgoms na mi 'da' pa'i sdom pa yin no //
translated: If one meditates on the seed syllable of the five families, which is the nature of gnosis, as OṀ, that is the vow of non-transgression.

original: de dag gi dus ni zhag bdun zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi dus ni zhag bdun zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The time for those is seven days, and so on.

original: de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pas ni sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa'i tshigs bcad brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pas ni sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa'i tshigs bcad brjod pa'o //
translated: With Here is... and so on, he states the verse for the consecration of body, speech, and mind.

original: byin gyis brlab pa ni sangs rgyas su sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab pa ni sangs rgyas su sgrub pa'o //
translated: The consecration is the accomplishment of buddhahood.

original: gal te de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te de lta ma yin na /
translated: If it were not so,

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa la sogs pa yang na zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa la sogs pa yang na zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: then even Vajradhara and so on would not be buddhas.

original: le'u bcu gnyis pa'i don rdzogs so /
analyzed: le'u bcu gnyis pa'i don rdzogs so /
translated: The meaning of the twelfth chapter is complete.

original: // / da ni rdo rje dam tshig bkod pa de kho na nyid kyi don bsgom pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / da ni rdo rje dam tshig bkod pa de kho na nyid kyi don bsgom pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the meditation on the meaning of reality, the arrangement of the vajra vow,

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says then, and so on.

original: de la ye shes rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pas ni gtso bo la don zhu ba'i phyir phyag 'tshal nas mchod pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de la ye shes rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pas ni gtso bo la don zhu ba'i phyir phyag 'tshal nas mchod pa brjod pa'o //
translated: There, with the wisdom vajra... and so on, having bowed down in order to request the meaning from the principal one, he states the offering.

original: bstod ba'i de ma thag bshad par gsol ba btab pa ni sngags rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste bshad du gsol zhes pa dang 'brel to //🔽de la sangs rgyas tshul re bzang //
analyzed: bstod ba'i de ma thag bshad par gsol ba btab pa ni sngags rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste bshad du gsol zhes pa dang 'brel to // de la sangs rgyas tshul re bzang //
translated: The request for the explanation immediately following the praise is “the mantras, etc. ,” which is connected with “please explain. ”

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ni sku la sogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ni sku la sogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: “The way of the Buddhas is excellent, etc. ” is the sequence of the body, etc.

original: rigs rnams kyi sngags rnams bsdus pa'i mchog ni rdo rje bzlas pa ste /
analyzed: rigs rnams kyi sngags rnams bsdus pa'i mchog ni rdo rje bzlas pa ste /
translated: The supreme collection of the mantras of the families is the Vajra Recitation,

original: sku'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sku'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: which is the characteristic of the Vajra Body, etc.

original: rigs dang sngags zhes pa ni rig ma dang ldan pa'i lha rnams kyi sku gsung thugs kyis kyang mtshan pa'o //🔽sngags zlos zhes pa @72b dang ; ye shes rgya mtsho zhes pa la sogs pas ni rig ma dang ldan pa gang yin pas /
analyzed: rigs dang sngags zhes pa ni rig ma dang ldan pa'i lha rnams kyi sku gsung thugs kyis kyang mtshan pa'o // sngags zlos zhes pa @72b dang ; ye shes rgya mtsho zhes pa la sogs pas ni rig ma dang ldan pa gang yin pas /
translated: The families and mantras are also characterized by the body, speech, and mind of the deities endowed with the knowledge women.

original: aom la sogs pa'i sa bon srog dang rtsol ba'i sgo nas spro ba la sogs pa'i cho ga bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: aom la sogs pa'i sa bon srog dang rtsol ba'i sgo nas spro ba la sogs pa'i cho ga bya bar bstan to //
translated: “The mantra recitation, etc. ,” “the ocean of intuition, etc. ,” and so forth, indicate that one who is endowed with the knowledge women should perform the rite of emanating, etc. , by means of the seed syllables such as OM, through the door of life and exertion.

original: zhus pa'i de ma thag gsungs pa de nas ston pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhus pa'i de ma thag gsungs pa de nas ston pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The statement immediately following the request is “then the teacher, etc. ”

original: gsungs so zhes pa dang 'brel to //🔽de la byed pa bskyed pa ni kun gyi byed pa po lta bu yang yin la /
analyzed: gsungs so zhes pa dang 'brel to // de la byed pa bskyed pa ni kun gyi byed pa po lta bu yang yin la /
translated: This is the connection.

original: sprul pa rnams bskyed pa'ang yin no //
analyzed: sprul pa rnams bskyed pa'ang yin no //
translated: Among them, the producer is the creator of all, and also the producer of the emanations.

original: de'i rdo rje mi phyed gsum gyis gang mtshan pa de de ltar yin la /
analyzed: de'i rdo rje mi phyed gsum gyis gang mtshan pa de de ltar yin la /
translated: That which is marked by the vajra of the three inseparable is like that.

original: rdo rje dbye ba gsum zhes pa kun rdzob tu sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje dbye ba gsum gyi mthar phyin pa ni bkod pa rdo rje gsum zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dbye ba gsum zhes pa kun rdzob tu sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje dbye ba gsum gyi mthar phyin pa ni bkod pa rdo rje gsum zhes bya'o //
translated: The vajra of the three divisions is the ultimate of the three divisions of the vajra of body and so forth, which is the conventional. The array of the three vajras is called the three vajras.

original: gnas rnams su zhes pa rang rang gi gnas su sku la sogs pa'i sa bon gyis rang rang gi rim pas spro ba byas na zhes so //
analyzed: gnas rnams su zhes pa rang rang gi gnas su sku la sogs pa'i sa bon gyis rang rang gi rim pas spro ba byas na zhes so //
translated: In the places, in their own places, the seed of body and so forth, by their own order, emanation is done.

original: rgyal ba rnams dang gnyis su med par bsgoms nas mchod pa'i mchog lha mo rnams kyis brtag par bya ba ye shes rdo rje rnal 'byor pas byas na zhe'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams dang gnyis su med par bsgoms nas mchod pa'i mchog lha mo rnams kyis brtag par bya ba ye shes rdo rje rnal 'byor pas byas na zhe'o //
translated: Having meditated on nonduality with the victors, the supreme offering is to be imagined by the goddesses. The vajra of wisdom yoga is done.

original: gzugs kyi mchog brtag pa zhes pa spro ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: gzugs kyi mchog brtag pa zhes pa spro ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas /
translated: The supreme form is to be imagined by means of emanation and so forth.

original: phyag rgya chen pos dbyings khyab par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen pos dbyings khyab par bya'o //
translated: One should pervade the realm with the great seal.

original: da ni dbye ba rnam gsum gyis //
analyzed: da ni dbye ba rnam gsum gyis //
translated: Now, by means of the three divisions,

original: zhes pa ni snang mdzad la sogs par gnas shing de rnams nyid so so dag tu spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni snang mdzad la sogs par gnas shing de rnams nyid so so dag tu spro bar bya'o //
translated: one should abide in Vairochana, etc., and emit them individually.

original: yang gzhan spro ba'i phyir lus dang zhes pa rnams smos te /
analyzed: yang gzhan spro ba'i phyir lus dang zhes pa rnams smos te /
translated: Again, in order to emit the others, [the Bhagavān] declares body, etc.

original: lus la sogs pa bdag med par shes pa'i sems kyis sngags rnams brjod nas /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa bdag med par shes pa'i sems kyis sngags rnams brjod nas /
translated: Having uttered the mantras with the mind that knows the selflessness of body, etc.,

original: sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje spro ba ni sngags brjod pa rdzogs nas rang rang gi gnas su bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje spro ba ni sngags brjod pa rdzogs nas rang rang gi gnas su bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: the emission of the vajra of body, etc., is the dissolution into their respective places upon the completion of the utterance of the mantras.

original: da ni spyi'i de ma thag sku la sogs pa khyad par gyi bzlas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni spyi'i de ma thag sku la sogs pa khyad par gyi bzlas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the special recitation of the body, etc., immediately following the general one,

original: thams cad kyi sku'i rdo rje byang chub pa'i zhes smos te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi sku'i rdo rje byang chub pa'i zhes smos te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “The vajra of the body of all the Buddhas,” etc.

original: de la dang po sku'i mngon par byang chub pa bstan pa'i phyir dang / dngos dang dngos min zhes pa lus kyi tha snyad gang dngos por gnas pa dang / dngos po med pa rnams gnyi gar mi ston cing /
analyzed: de la dang po sku'i mngon par byang chub pa bstan pa'i phyir dang / dngos dang dngos min zhes pa lus kyi tha snyad gang dngos por gnas pa dang / dngos po med pa rnams gnyi gar mi ston cing /
translated: and “entity and non-entity” refers to the convention of body.

original: gang du yang ma grub pa ni rnam dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: gang du yang ma grub pa ni rnam dpyad pa'o //
translated: Not relying on either that which is an entity or that which is not an entity is the analysis.

original: de ni sku zhes bya bar bshad ces te /
analyzed: de ni sku zhes bya bar bshad ces te /
translated: That is explained as the body.

original: de ni sku'i bzlas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni sku'i bzlas pa yin no //
translated: That is the repetition of the body.

original: gsung gi rdo rje byang chub pa'i //🔽zhes pas ni @73a * //
analyzed: gsung gi rdo rje byang chub pa'i // zhes pas ni @73a * //
translated: The enlightenment of Vajra Speech

original: gsung gi bzlas pa bstan to //
analyzed: gsung gi bzlas pa bstan to //
translated: teaches the repetition of speech.

original: sgra dang sgra min zhes pa ngag gi tha snyad dang tha snyad ma yin pa gnyi ga mi bsten pa rnam dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: sgra dang sgra min zhes pa ngag gi tha snyad dang tha snyad ma yin pa gnyi ga mi bsten pa rnam dpyad pa'o //
translated: “Sound and non-sound” refers to the analysis that does not rely on either the convention of speech or non-speech.

original: de ni gsung gi bzlas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gsung gi bzlas pa yin no //
translated: That is the repetition of speech.

original: thugs kyi dam tshig byang chub pa'i //
analyzed: thugs kyi dam tshig byang chub pa'i //
translated: The enlightenment of the mind’s pledge

original: zhes pas ni thugs kyi bzlas pa ston te //
analyzed: zhes pas ni thugs kyi bzlas pa ston te //
translated: teaches the repetition of mind.

original: gnas pa'i rdo rje zhes pa shes pa'i tha snyad mi bsten pa rnam dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rdo rje zhes pa shes pa'i tha snyad mi bsten pa rnam dpyad pa'o //
translated: “The abiding vajra” refers to the analysis that does not rely on the convention of consciousness.

original: de ni sems kyi bzlas par bshad do //
analyzed: de ni sems kyi bzlas par bshad do //
translated: That is explained as the recitation of the mind.

original: yon tan gyi bzlas pa bstan pa'i phyir don rtogs zhes smos te /
analyzed: yon tan gyi bzlas pa bstan pa'i phyir don rtogs zhes smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the recitation of qualities, he says, “realizing the meaning. ”

original: de la don ni mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la don ni mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Therein, the meaning is equality.

original: de rtogs pa'i bzlas pa ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid med pa ni bzang po ste /
analyzed: de rtogs pa'i bzlas pa ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid med pa ni bzang po ste /
translated: The recitation that realizes that is the good, the realitylessness of entities.

original: des yang dag par rig pa'i sgo nas brtags pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi bzlas pa yin no //
analyzed: des yang dag par rig pa'i sgo nas brtags pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi bzlas pa yin no //
translated: The investigation of that by means of correct knowledge is the recitation of Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: phrin las kyi bzlas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phrin las kyi bzlas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the recitation of activity, he says,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing zhes pa smos te /
translated: “the buddha-fields. ”

original: de la sku'i sprin ni de nyid mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de la sku'i sprin ni de nyid mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Therein, the cloud of bodies is endowed with the non-apprehension of that.

original: de ni spro ba yang yin la bzhud pa yang de nyid pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni spro ba yang yin la bzhud pa yang de nyid pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is called “emanation” because it is both an emanation and a going.

original: byon pa ni bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: byon pa ni bsdu ba'o //
translated: The arrival is the gathering.🔽That is the recitation of Amoghasiddhi.

original: de ni thogs med ces te don grub kyi bzlas pa yin no bzlas pa gzhan gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ni thogs med ces te don grub kyi bzlas pa yin no bzlas pa gzhan gsungs pa /
translated: He states another recitation:

original: khro bo'i zhes pa rnams te /
analyzed: khro bo'i zhes pa rnams te /
translated: “the wrathful ones. ”

original: de la dam tshig ye shes ni khro ba'i cha lugs su bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: de la dam tshig ye shes ni khro ba'i cha lugs su bsgom pa'o //
translated: Therein, the pledge-wisdom is the cultivation of the aspect of wrath.

original: de rang gi dkyil 'khor du khro bo'i sngags kyi yi ge bzlas pas pha rol po'i rna bar sgra grags pa de ni zhes so //
analyzed: de rang gi dkyil 'khor du khro bo'i sngags kyi yi ge bzlas pas pha rol po'i rna bar sgra grags pa de ni zhes so //
translated: By reciting the wrathful mantra syllables of one’s own maṇḍala, the sound that resounds in the ears of the opponent is “phaṭ.”
